Reviews.Title: “Cancellation”
Reviews.Author: bktl
Reviews.Content: Their cancellation policy is not practial for the business traveler. If you do not cancel by noon the day before your arrival, they will charge the full amount for your room. Due to business deadlines and meeting cancellations, plans can change abruptly. I have stayed there many times but may need to change to a hotel with the usual cancellation policy of before 6pm the day of arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust1771
Reviews.Content: Great location for seeing all that Boston has to offer. Despite its being close to everything and on busy Commonwealth Ave., our room was very quiet. The room was large and comfortable. Two overstuffed chairs and a large desk, bright and sunny. We will definitely use this as our 'home'-base when we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “St. Patrick's/Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Gina R
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth Hotel was lovely. Comfortable and charming. ALL the staff were wonderful. I realise that is because they would like a good tip but sometimes people can still be over-the-top, but they weren't. Always happy to help and give recommendations that were great. The restaurants in the hotel were fantastic. Overall we had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best I ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Jongseok l
Reviews.Content: If you see the room and bathroom, you will see why I was so glad!!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!”
Reviews.Author: dlliporace
Reviews.Content: there is not another hotel which can compete with the Commonwealth for value, location, amenities, service or comfort!!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL COMMONWEALTH ROCKS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: We just checked out of the Hotel Commonwealth yesterday and miss it already!! Every single thing was incredible. From the door and bellmen that meet you when you arrive- and know you by name to the grand entrance to the WONDERFUL front desk staff. This was a very emotional stay for my daughters and I with their Daddy having to work in Boston for 3 years and us having to stay in AZ and everyone and everything at this hotel made us forget about it!! They welcomed our daughters- BY NAME and gave them there backpacks full of awesome things- LL Bean slippers, sunglasses, chapstick, games, books you name it!! THEN delivered cookies and milk!!! Every need was met and the entire staff and hotel went above and beyond our expectations!!!The rooms were beautiful and clean and so cozy. THANK YOU HOTEL COMMONWEALTH FOR MAKING OUR FIRST BOSTON EXPERIENCE AMAZING!!!! We WILL be back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for repeat customers”
Reviews.Author: Jackie M
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hotel Commonwealth every week for business. Since I have to come back every week, I get relegated to the handicapped rooms, of which there are many. While these rooms may be very accomodating if you are handicapped, the bathrooms are terrible if you're not - sinks with no counter space, no towel hooks, terrible, low-pressure showers. Also, overall, no refrigerators, hit or miss heat/AC control, no microwaves, no in-room coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: 1-MainLine
Reviews.Content: The personal attention from the staff was remarkable. Every time we walked by the Front Desk, the staff greeted us by name. "Hello, Mr. and Mrs. X, how are you this afternoon?" The Doorman and Drivers were just as personable. There is no downside to this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Seana C
Reviews.Content: A true test of customer service is an ability to handle a crisis and Hotel Commonwealth proved excellent during the March 14/15 blackout. They kept people informed by actually visiting every room periodically and having hallway meetings, they handed out flashlights, they made sure everyone was okay. The staff were calm, pleasant, genuine and super professional: they knew how to handle the situation. Truly outstanding customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel- Service at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Kate P
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for a 3 day business trip. The Hotel is beautfiul, with a mix of old world charm and modern. It was an excellent stay with very large and comformatble rooms. All the details were there from friendly staff to nice bathroom products to good restaurants and close to shopping on Newbury Street. However, the main thing that blew me away was- THE STAFF. The staff from the door man, front desk to the cleaners are so kind and thoughtfull. They give great recommendations on things to do in the area as well as make sure your stay is great. They really go above and beyond. I had requested a wake up call, and the phone volume was so low, I didn't hear it- they actually came up and knocked on my door to get me up! (Thank goodness, otherwise I would have missed my flight). It was also my birthday, and they sent up a special gift that really made made my day. My recommendation: STAY HERE!, it may not be the closest hotel to downtown, but the service and ambiance make it worth the extra 10 min walk!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing level of hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Jane H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three weeks for business, and it has been a long time since I have experience such a high level of hospitality. Everyone from the doorman to the maids were overly friendly and seemed to honestly enjoy their jobs. The location is great as it is a few minute walk to Fenway Park. The accommodations are excellent and if I needed anything, the front desk had it in my room within minutes. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Hotel Commonwealth!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha12
Reviews.Content: We had another great visit at Hotel Commonwealth for their annual Bedtime Stories Event. In fact, staying at the hotel was the one thing our kids told everyone who asked them what they were doing for vacation. They didnâ€™t mention going to Cape Cod or birthday parties, but they always told people how excited they were to go back to Hotel Commonwealth. They were not disappointed and loved the backpacks filled with books, LL Bean slippers, lip balm, sunglasses and flashlights. When there was a knock at the door a few minutes after we got to our rooms, the kids guessed cookies and milk and they were right! The reading event in the ballroom was followed by a fix your own hot chocolate bar for the kids and adult beverages for us. We all had fun at the event and the kids went to bed excited for the make your own pancake breakfast in the morning. The accommodations were clean, stylish and comfortable and the staff at the hotel is so friendly and accommodating. I love the Fresh Product toiletries that are provided to guests. The high pressure shower was just the thing needed to wake us up in the morning. At the breakfast, the kids decorated and donned their chef hats and made the pancake batter. They picked out their pancake toppings of fruit and chocolate and we all had a nice big breakfast. We enjoyed walking around Newbury Street and then going to the new playground on the esplanade. All in all, another great time spent at Hotel Commonwealthâ€™s Bedtime Stories Event.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: defreitaslh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, comfortable, and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even have to leave the building!”
Reviews.Author: skohn
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Commonwealth through the Rue La La deal for a special night out. (We live just a few blocks away.) We have had visiting friends stay here so we were fairly familiar with what we were getting into, but we had even more fun than anticipated! We hopped from The Hawthorne to Eastern Standard and then back up to our room. The room was clean and good size. I LOVE the Fresh products in the bathroom. Definitely a great hotel and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at the Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: travelingman826
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth is our go to hotel when we are in the Kenmore Square area. From the valet parking team, to the front desk to Housekeeping, the hotel functions as a unit. It is a credit to the management team. The rooms have the three most important ingredients of any good hotel stay: Clean, Quiet and Comfortable. Be aware that the restaurant, Eastrn Standard time gets crowded and DOES take reservations, even for small parties. We went in at 6:30 on a Saturday night expecting to get a table and encountered an hour wait when we didn't have the time to wait....a good lesson.

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Gail A
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great amenities like bedding, towels, Fresh products and two good restaurants, Eastern Standard and the Oyster bar (not sure of its real name). Staff very friendly and helpful. Three couples went for a weekend get-away and we all had a great time. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be the best service ever.”
Reviews.Author: TheFunnelboy
Reviews.Content: As someone who has been in the hotel business all my life including several upper management positions with Marriott, I have a keen eye for the details. And as anyone else in our business would tell you, nobody is more critical of a hotel's operations, cleanliness and service, than ourselves. Well, there is a reason this hotel is rated #1 in the area on Tripadvisor. Starting with our doorman's greeting upon arrival, then on to our bellman, to the front desk and dining staff, the service was as good as anything I've experienced anywhere in my life. And hats off to the interior designers. The guest rooms and public spaces are absolutely beautiful, with eye-popping colors and decor accented by thoughtful lighting throughout the building. We had breakfast the morning of departure and my wife ordered their french toast, which looked absolutely delicious. She doesn't have much of a sweet tooth, so with the caramel banana toppings she wasn't a big fan, so she passed her dish to her brother and I who did everything we could to avoid polishing off the entire thing on top of our own meals....we came close because it was YUMMY! When the waitress came with the bill, she told my wife that she removed the french toast from the bill because she noticed that she didn't like it. We said to our waitress, "that's OK, we still ate most of it" and her response was "that doesn't matter, what matters is that she wasn't happy with her meal and should not be charged for it." Wow. At checkout I mentioned to the front desk agent how "wowed" we all were with the hotel and the service. Less than fifteen minutes later I received an email from their manager thanking us for staying and for the positive feedback upon checkout. Again, wow. The amazing staff, the great service and culture at this hotel clearly indicates it is run by an exceptional general manager and management team. I know how critical the hiring and training process is to the success of a hotel, and obviously it is all taken very seriously by this team of professionals. Most large hotel companies like Marriott and Hilton have incredible resources and processes for training, hiring, service delivery, etc. What impresses me most is that they are doing it as well if not better than the "big boys" as an independently managed hotel. KUDOS!!! Thanks again for a wonderful experience. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Fenway Park, but too fancy for my taste”
Reviews.Author: movieglue
Reviews.Content: I had a choice of a two room suite or one room with a view of Fenway for the same price. The view was nice, but I took the two room suite. It actually wasn't two rooms, just two living areas divided by drapes. Everything you would expect from a luxury hotel -- two flat screens; fluffy 8" pillows, granite countertop and quite expensive (~$230 with a corporate discount). Two things stood out. 1. There was no bible in the room. 2. They didn't have free samples of shampoo, conditioner, etc. But they did have a "beauty bar" in the room and you could purchase 2 oz containers of fancy lotions and shampoo etal for $20-30. No kidding. When I saw that, I knew the place was too fancy for me. I guess rich folk have that kind of money to throw around.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: nancy6622
Reviews.Content: We stay here all the time, sometimes with our children and grandchildren, and there isn't a better place to stay in Boston. The hotel is truly luxurious and we've always had fabulous experiences. Room service is terrific and fast, the sheets and amenities cannot be beat, and everyone who works here is wonderful. It's one of our favorite hotels anywhere. We are often upgraded and no rquest to the staff is ever refused.

Reviews.Title: “Thank'sTripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Dollarflyer
Reviews.Content: This visit showed the value of Tripadvisor. We chose the hotel on the strength of the rating and reviews. They were accurate in all respects and we really enjoyed the experience of staying there. We upgraded to a wonderful 2 room suite which afforded time to relax. On the 3rd night we were checking guidebooks for places to dine when we noted that the Creek Oyster Bar in the Hotel Commonwealth was actually rated number one by Tripadvisor. 100% deserved with great food, wine and atmosphere. One of the best Oyster Bar experiences anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid ambience”
Reviews.Author: Toft6902
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at hotel for a short business trip. Was unable to do any sightseeing due to the weather, which was snowing, and therefore was forced to spend more time than normal within the confines of my hotel. Pleased to say it was superb. All amenities catered for my needs and would certainly use again if possible.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Perfect night away!”
Reviews.Author: Emily P
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect night in Boston. Beautiful, unique accommodations. Courteous and helpful staff from the front door, to the desk staff, to the concierge, all were welcoming, friendly and excited to help you enjoy your stay. This was the best hotel to spend the night in Boston, I wish it were more! Will definitely come back to the Hotel Commonwealth on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mina R
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough of the hotels staff in this Hotel. They were the best ever! From the door man to the reservation desk. Sam the concierge was fantastic! The hotel itself was in a great location and rooms were beautiful and spotless. I would go back again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Khook1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Location is great and staff is very attentive. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. Rooms are big and restaurant is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: Back for another stay at Hotel Commonwealth...it was great! I brought some friends this time and they loved it too. See you in April.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay - well done!”
Reviews.Author: makarska1997
Reviews.Content: From booking to check out, the trip went without a flaw! Jessie in booking made sure that we got just the right room - Fenway Room! On check in, we were surprised by a complimentary Pinor Noir and a lovely cheese plate! Great way to start the weekend. Fabulous view of Fenway Park from our room. Very comfortable room, complimentary shoe shine and high end toiletries all which you would expect in the #1 Trip Advisory Hotel in Boston! We had very high expectations and you met each and all of them! Well done..

Reviews.Title: “The Best of BOSTON”
Reviews.Author: kevin m
Reviews.Content: From the moment our doors we're opened at the curb for our arrival, they started to treat us like were somebody special. Everything about this hotel was top notch. From the valet, front desk, room service to even the operators on the house phone, they were just so attentive. We most definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: Happyemptynester
Reviews.Content: Easy access to T or nice walk to Back Bay. Well maintained. We were given larger, spacious room than reserved, a nice surprise. Great restaurants right next door. Surprisingly quiet given city location. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth weekend with kids”
Reviews.Author: JAF8675309
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Hotel Commonwealth with our 3 kids and had a terrific experience. We had a large, beautiful room big enough for all of us: 2 boys on a pull out couch and baby in a pack n play they provided. The heavy pull across curtain dividing the space was key so that we were able to enjoy our time in the room as our kids slept. The king bed was gorgeous, really nice. We have stayed here before and will be back because there just aren't that many hotels that make your stay with kids as easy as this. We love the location as it's close to the city and perfect for running on or taking the kids to the Esplanad. The service was exceptional. The restaurants in the hotel are great too: Island Creek is one of the best in Boston, Eastern Standard is my favorite spot for a drink with my husband at the bar and The Hawthorne is my new favorite loungey bar. This place is a must try. Just go check it out. This hotel does it right. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Luxury near Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: Aldo_Nola
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in their 3rd floor "Reading Room" executive suite. Pretty, nicley appointed suite. Great king bed with comfy linens. Room is nicely decorated too with lieterature-related theme.Comfy leather lounge chairs, reading lamps, complimentary use of a Kindle Nook, and a well-stocked library really do make this a great spot for reading. But the location is so great we found it hard to stay put. Fenway Park, Boylston Street, Shops at Prudential, and Boston Common are all very walkable if you like to stroll like we do. Staff knows their business. Front desk, room service, valet parking, concierge all delivered with apparent ease and lack of fussiness. Example: early Saturday morning, I asked when the concierge desk opened which wasn't for an hour. But the desk clerk asked if he could help me, and when I told him we wanted to watch the Liverpool v. Arsenal soccer match he knew exactly the place. He even called to make sure they would be showing that game and when we got there the barman made sure we got a good seat. The only cons: Bathroom disappointed slightly, about on par with a nicer Embassy Suites, but toiletries were top end. Lots of noise from Commonwealth Ave made sleeping a bit harder than we expected. The usual car horns, sirens and other city noises which are part of city like but aren't an issue at Ritz-Carlton or Taj Hotel in Boston. The icemaker outside the room occasionally goes into an extremely noisy mode which can be heard from the room. However, we got earplugs and dealt with this minor annoyance. I really debated whether to rate this 4 or 5 stars due to the noise issue and the lack of bathroom wow-factor compared to Ritz Carlton, but the staff is so competent and the little extras like the Keuring and Kindle provided in the room won the day. Not to mention, the suite is about $300 less than its counterpart at R-C. Plus free wi-fi! I don't give out very many 5 star ratings but Hotel Commonwealth earned every one of them. This is our new home base in Boston and we can't wait for our next trip this summer to see the Sox.

Reviews.Title: “Way above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Bdstrock
Reviews.Content: Central location right next to Fenway Park, great staff, first class huge rooms, nice bathrooms, 2 great restaurants in the hotel (Island Creek was an awesome restaurant), wine bar, subway station literally down below hotel, comfortable beds, and a concierge to take care of every need...if you need more than this then run for president. I'll be back to this

Reviews.Title: “Wicked awesome at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: I have nothing negative to say about this hotel or my experience staying there. Rather, it exceeded my expectations. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room and bedding was devine. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin H
Reviews.Content: If you aren't looking to stay right downtown, this is a great hotel to consider. It's extremely close to BU and Fenway. You can still get downtown relatively quickly with a T-stop less than a half block from the hotel.. The accommodations and staff are superb.

Reviews.Title: “so comfortable and plush”
Reviews.Author: Annie M
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Commonwealth, it was delightful from the get-go: we had a glass of champagne on arrival that was quite good. The room was large and comfortable with two queen beds, a desk and flat screen TV and lots of hookups for computers, etc. The bathroom was spacious and clean and the soaps/shampoos, etc were great! They're from "fresh" and I took all of them home with me. The beds were really comfortable and the down pillows were big and fluffy, down comforters too. The only thing we missed was having a coffee maker in the room, they really should have a Keurig maker in each room, I wasn't interested in paying for room service for a cup of coffee. The staff was courteous and helpful, the doormen and valet specifically were exceptional. Would love to return and stay two nights or more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, excellent service, friendly staff, 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: Don't pass up a chance to stay at Hotel Commonwealth!! It's clean, comfy, beautiful, has excellent service and a friendly staff! I have stayed in this hotel several times and keep coming back. The Hotel is located in Kenmore Sq with fab restaurants located on both sides and The Red Sox a step away. I give this hotel 5 stars and highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Celia G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth several times in the past and have always enjoyed it. This past weekend was spent with our two young children and after our experience, we couldn't help but to write a review. Hotel Commonwealth is, without a doubt, the BEST hotel you will experience while staying in Boston. The accommodations are luxurious, the convenient location cant be beat, and the choices and quality of the restaurants and is fantastic. What prompted this review, however, is how friendly and helpful each and every employee is. From the housekeepers who set up the crib to the waitress in the restaurant....I even lost my cell phone only to have the doorman find it for me within 5 minutes (under the seat of my car!!!) Will most definitely be returning to our 'home away from home."!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome hotel for anyone!!!”
Reviews.Author: Julia H
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth is a WONDERFUL hotel!!! EVERYONE is just delightful & very very helpful!! The room is just perfect & both restaurants & the lounge are great!! Our two young kids loved having their own space as well!! Would go back there anytime!!! And looking forward to our next trip to Boston where we will totally be staying there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie L
Reviews.Content: I had the priviledge of staying at Hotel Commonwealth with my sister while celebrating my 30th birthday and I can't say enough good things about this place. We stayed in the baseball suite, and even though we're not baseball fans, we were stunned at how beautiful the room was. The staff was so nice and Samuel (the best concierge ever!) found out it was my birthday and went above and beyond to make the day special for me. I can't wait to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emsabga
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've stayed in! Room size was perfect, staff beyond friendly and accommodating, great restaurants, central location. No complaints what so ever, and can't wait to get back there again on vacation. Highly recommend staying at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Tonya L
Reviews.Content: Everything is convenient and the staff and hotel are excellent. Perfect place to stay if you are visiting Boston University.

Reviews.Title: “Only good things to say”
Reviews.Author: Feldborg
Reviews.Content: Although it was my first visit to Boston I actually wanted to get back and spend some time in the hotel. The room was very nice, clean and extremely spacious. All the staff we met was friendly, professional, helpful and attentive. The cooperated restaurant Eastern Standard was a popular and fun place and the food is not bad and is also partly available as room service. The hotel's location is quite a long walk from downtown, but the walk is very nice, especially through the shopping street, which is just 5 min. from the hotel, and the subway is right by the hotel, if you're not looking to walk. I would highly recommend it to anyone travelling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff & hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff at the Hotel Commonwealth!!!! Our room was beautiful and spotless!! The restaurants in the hotel were great! We ate at both. The only problem we had was the noisy kids in the room next to us. They were very annoying. Overall, a great experience. I will go back and highly reccommend this hotel if you're looking for great service and lovely accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome”
Reviews.Author: LJF124
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Staff was the most genuine, welcoming and helpful staff out of any hotel I've ever stayed at. The Staff went above and beyond in all aspects of providing a comfortable experience for us. As we left the hotel to go to dinner, we asked the person at the front desk how to adjust the temperature in our room and instead of explaining to us to make the proper adjustments, he sent someone to the room to make the adjustments for us while we were at dinner. When we returned from dinner, the room temperature was lowered and we were extremely comfortable. All of the Staff introduced themselves to us by their first name and were always asking if we needed anything. The room was incredible and had a great view of Commonwealth Avenue. We had brunch on Sunday morning at the Eastern Standard, one of the hotel restaurants, and were met with the same hospitable, friendly staff members of the hotel. All around, this was the absolute best hotel experience I have ever had. I recommend this hotel to anybody, especially for the price. Great value, ABSOLUTE BEST EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Always perfect”
Reviews.Author: Garritys
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth is top shelf in every aspect--service, value, location, cleanliness. The staff are personable and helpful. We have stayed in all levels of rooms and each one is spacious, comfortable, spotless. If you have a car, the staff are very accommodating in retrieving your car throughout the day as you come and go. A car is really not needed as there is a T stop on the same block. Located perfectly for Boston University - virtually on the campus. Eastern Standard restaurant (attached to the hotel) has become our favorite spot for drinks, appetizers and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: storkling
Reviews.Content: Friendly, attentive service, beautiful decor, wonderful restaurant - all in all a wonderful hotel. My only complaints are that the only stationary bike in the fitness center was not working and it was a bit noisy as the hotel was full of families with small children and we heard a baby crying at night.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: KMAC225
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for the night for my birthday, using a voucher from RueLaLa and it was great! The only problem we found was that the hotel was pet friendly and there was a barking dog in the room next door! I saw that the hotel was pet friendly before hand, but figured it would be a separate part of the hotel. Other than the barking dog, we had a great time and the room was very very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Sonia P
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Hotel Commonwealth for the special Storytelling Event. It was above and beyond my expectations- we were treated from the time we entered the doors- with friendly, knowledgable staff. My children thoroughly enjoyed the 5 star treatment we received for this special night- will do it again in a heartbeat. The room was very nice and everyone put the extra touches in not only a customer would expect, but also a parent!! Thanks so much for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “WOW all around!”
Reviews.Author: wahoobbk
Reviews.Content: There is just not a single negative thing I can say about my experience at the Commonwealth Hotel. The staff is seriously the nicest, most helpful hotel staff anywhere. I don't mean in an effusive, "Yes ma'am, happy to provide that for you ma'am, glad to be of service ma'am" kind of way. I mean, EVERY person - from reservationist to bellman to room service waitstaff to housekeeping to front desk personnel - was just naturally pleasant, and seemed to honestly want to help in any way possible. Warm, friendly, polite, genuine, just all-around lovely people. I had several specific needs during my stay (including receiving and sending multiple packages to different places), and I felt complete trust that requests would be taken care of quickly and accurately (confirmed - everything got right where it needed to go). They made my stay so easy and completely stress-free. Bravo!!! The hotel itself is lovely too. I got upgraded to a Jr. Suite, which was fabulous. Nice bathroom, terrific amenities, great towels. Suite had a sitting area divided by big curtains with chairs, a wonderful desk, and TV. Separate TV in bed area. Pillows were to die for (tempted to find out where they came from). Bed was divine. Evening turndown service if requested. Attentive housekeeping service. Room service for breakfast, food was great, and special requests were honored without question. Very, very easy check-in and check-out. Business center with PC and a Mac, with printers all ready to go. Super, duper easy. 2 independent restaurants on-site (Island Creek Oyster Bar and Eastern Standard, reviewed separately) which were both great too. Just an all-around fantastic hotel, and fantastic experience. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Read Boston”
Reviews.Author: MrsCoke12
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at hotel Commonwealth for the second time over the weekend with my 9 year old daughter and the experience was awesome. They kids had Bags filled with books LL bean slipers flash lights lip gloss and more. The Magician was very funny and the children enjoyed the show the staff was very interactive. My daughter loved the pancake making the next morning. Hotel Commonwealth never seems to amaze me instead they WOW me from the door man all they way down to housekeeping was very polite.They seem to improve each and every day when they are alreday excellent. I would reccomend this hotel to everyone... Did i mention it feels like your sleeping on clouds their bed are so soft and so clean you could never have a bad experince at this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Steve F
Reviews.Content: I had heard about the service at Hotel Commonwealth, but you have to stay there to really believe it. We wentfor the bedtime story event and to spend a night "staycation" with the kids in town, they had a blast. The service was phenomenal and best of all, genuine. I have seen "forced" customer service, this was not. I travel a lot for business, i was impressed with how the kids were treated (respecful, and with the goal of letting them have fun). The events were well run, from the check in packae for the kids, milk and cookies, the bedtime story through to the pancake breakfast, this was one of the best hotel packages we have have ever seen. The wine and cheese for the adults was a nice touch, along with the champagne at check in. The slippers were a huge hit! Very well done....we will be back and we will tell everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Story Time”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: My children and I had a fabulous time at the Bedtime Story event. The staff were truly engaged with even the youngest kids! The pancake making instruction was terrific, too. Every child got to take part! We will return for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Great night away!”
Reviews.Author: karenandbrian
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night with our kids for the Bedtime stories/ pajama party package for February school vacation. It was even better than we imagined! Not only was the room very spacious, clean and beautiful. But my kid's backpacks were filled with goodies and LL Bean slippers! The evening entertainment was a very funny magician and wine and beer and cheeses for the parents. Lots of wonderful hot cocoa and cookies for the kids. The next morning was a fun pancake breakfast where the kids got to make their own. Even Frankie the door man was awesome! Just a really nice time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: panthergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a college visit trip. The hotel gave us a 20% discount as a result, but it's still not cheap to stay here (typical for any hotel right in the city). I was a bit turned off by the $42/night parking fee. The room was lovely even if we did have a view of Fenway Park (we're Yankee fans...LOL) and the staff was wonderful. There is no coffee machine in the room but if you ask for one they'll bring you a Keurig (but no milk/cream...you can go down to the restaurant and ask them for some though). We had room service from the Eastern Standard restaurant which was excellent. Overall I would recommend the hotel. Just be prepared for a $700+ bill for a two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay at the Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Computergeek60
Reviews.Content: This was a very comfortable room, and service was great. I made a reservation at the Eastern Standard downsatirs, and they called me in the room when the table was ready! The only criticism of the hotel, is that there is not a coffe maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie J
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with exceptional service, which continued throughout our entire 3-night stay. The hotel and rooms are beautiful, the staff friendly, and the dining options excellent. We had dinner at Island Creek Oyster Bar, breakfast at Eastern Standard, and drinks at the Hawthorne during the course of our stay. i would recommend any of them if you are looking for a great meal. An added bonus was the Fresh products in the room...such a nice treat! I am looking forward to a return visit to Boston and the Hotel Commonwealth in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: NYGirl37
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great service - so happy I picked this hotel! Service was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on a college touring excursion, including a younger sibling who was reluctant to spend part of winter recess doing this. We were first timers staying in Boston and I wasn't sure of where to stay, so I looked to trip advisor. Once again, I was not disappointed. Hotel Commonwealth came up first in my search as the top rated hotel. I am so glad we chose to stay here! The location was perfect for us, within walking distance of schools, shops, restaurants, movies, public transportation, etc. We even had a view of Fenway Park from our room. Service was excellent, from the doorman who warmly greeted us to the front desk staff who was friendly, professional, and an excellent source of information. Upon learning the reason for our visit, one of the men provided us with literature and maps of the colleges we were interested in. The concierge gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants. Checkout was a breeze, as well as retrieving our valet parked car. The accommodations were beautiful and tasteful. And comfortable! Plenty of pillows, excellent beds, frette linens, high end toiletries, spacious room, and amazingly quiet. We all slept very soundly after two very busy days. As for my younger son, he was quite pleased with the hotel gym and the large flat panel tv in our room, which eased the sting of being dragged around to schools! Overall, I highly recommend Hotel Commonwealth, and would not hesitate to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Charlie T
Reviews.Content: A very special place.....polite, friendly service from the time you arrive and are greeted at the door until the time you depart. The Staff at the front desk were professional, thoughtful and courteous. Eastern Standard restaurant was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Luxurious, down to the last detail”
Reviews.Author: Natalia G
Reviews.Content: I had a great 1-night stay in a junior suite at Hotel Commonwealth. I love how this place nails every important detail: wonderful Fresh toiletries, iPod/blackberry chargers, powerful water pressure, origami-folded towels, terry robe and new slippers, Panasonic flat screen TVs, stickers on the toilet paper, thick curtains.... The folks here did not spare expense on cheap furniture or too few pillows. The convenient location (directly across from Kenmore station and a few blocks from Newbury) and included amenities are also key. They offer complimentary turn down service and a business center (Mac or PC) where you can print all you need free of charge. 1-day of complimentary WiFi. Respectable fitness center. And as the other reviewers have mentioned, the caliber of service is top notch - I was able to check-in early (8am!), no questions asked. I will most definitely return to Hotel Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Super Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: peggy s
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been a meeting planner for about 15 years now. Iâ€™ve worked on the hotel side of the business and the corporate side, Hotel Commonwealth truly is a fabulous property. The service was fanatics they helped with all of my special guests needs. The food is amazing, best pastry chef. My guests had an amazing experience from check in to the moment they drove away. Canâ€™t wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commenwealth exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Alice C
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston for an event at BU. Hotel Commonwealth was the perfect location and had everything we needed or it was within a short walk. It is also located next to a T station entrance which made gettng around Boston very easy. Staff was very freindly and helped arrange a special request for us at one of their restaurants. They went above and beyond. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Chaneltina37
Reviews.Content: Service was great, the bar and lounge connected to hotel Hawthorne was excellent. Can't wait to make another trip to your hotel. Thax!

Reviews.Title: “College Visit to Boston From New Jersey”
Reviews.Author: anna147
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Commonwealth Hotel. It was an excellent location for visiting Boston University, Northeastern and Emerson. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: withonelster
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing visit to the Hotel Commonwealth this past weekend. From minute one we were wowed by the impressive Samuel Famuyide. When he politely inquired what brought us to Boston, my daughter replied that we were celebrating my birthday. Settling into our lovely room and planning our day, we were surprised by a knock at the door. We were given a bottle a Prosecco and yummy chocolate truffles accompanied by a sweet note from Mr. Famuyide. It doesn't end there. At dinner off-site, I was given a mini-dessert with a candle once again the result of Mr. Famuyide's intervention. We also loved the restaurant Eastern Standard and ate there twice. Staff and food were both terrific. I would -- no will -- visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: Niki411
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The service was great. What ever you needed they were there to help you with and were extremely friendly!! There is not one bad thing I could say about they employees or my stay at this hotel. This is a 5 star in my book!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and personal service”
Reviews.Author: ofdevils
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying here. We love the location. Right next door to Fenway and sports bars. Newberry Street is 1 block away and mass transit in front of hotel.The sevice is always personal.Rooms are beautiful and spotless.This time it was very cold out so we took advantage of dining in the hotel's restaurants Oyster Creek for dinner and Eastern standard for breakfast. Fantastic.We will be back in June!

Reviews.Title: “Both the hotel and staff were Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Kurt T
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay, and the hotel was absolutely outstanding in every aspect! The rooms were large, comfortable, and neat as a pin. The staff was incredibly polite and helpful, and seemed attentive to every need. Overall, I would say this was the best hotel experience I have had in years!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birdie245
Reviews.Content: All of the Staff were so friendly,happy and kind.They made it such a pleasure to stay at the Commonwealth. The hotel itself is gorgeous and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all expectations and was really excellent. We had a junior suite (the upgrade was on promotion as we checked in). The staff were very helpful and friendly. Nick the hotel porter was particularly enthusiastic and gave us lots of good advice about how to spend our time in Boston. The room was large, very clean and nicely appointed. The highlight was the two wonderful restaurants in the hotel itself. Both were very popular, buzzy and had excellent food, ambience and service. We loved everything about our winter break in Boston and couldn't recommend Hotel Commonwealth enough.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and a place to get work done”
Reviews.Author: streetguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable and well maintained--the equal to any high end chain. We had a junior suite which separated the sleeping area from a lounging and desk area with a curtain. One could get work done in a comfortable way, even if one's partner wanted to spend an extra hour or two in bed. Staff was courteous and almost too helpful (shortly we checked in we received a call asking if everything was ok and did we have any questions.) The seafood restaurant in the hotel was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing night”
Reviews.Author: binney96
Reviews.Content: As others have said it's the attention to detail that will have you wanting to stay no-where esle in Boston (and lets face it that's hard to acheive when you look at the amount of hotels in Boston). Knowledgeble, helpful friendly staff who go above and beyond. I was the organizer of a company event and will for sure use the Commonwealth again and reccomend it to both Business users and visitors. Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Lynn L
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit to the Hotel Commonwealth - this is an awesome place to stay - their service and attention to detail is top notch...I highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to bring my family for a future stay!

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: Mary F
Reviews.Content: What a first class expierence! Everything about our visit was excepional. The elegant decor throughout, we were upgraded to a junior suite on the 5th floor over looking the famous Citgo sign. The room amenities were elegant including towels, sheets, "fresh" toiletries products and a comfortable sitting area with desk and 2 tvs. Staff also first class, from the doormen to the desk and bellstaff, all were equally professional and attentive. We had a elegant cocktail at The Hawthorne and a yummy breakfast in Eastern Standard. Will look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Service at it finest”
Reviews.Author: ndang2
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, stand above all. You first walk in, greeted by a doorman, walk into beautiful foyer. Staff attentive and polite. In the heart of boston, walking distance to many great sights. Room: open, clean and the bed great. Fenway room equipped with a view of fenway park. Hdtv and a blu-ray player. Offer a lot of bang for your buck. Free internet service, movie rental and even board game. Downside: I stayed on the 2nd floor and there is no ice machine. You need to go to 3rd - 5th floor. A great hotel right above the kenmore subway exit.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: kim r
Reviews.Content: I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to everyone - they have a wide variety of people while I stayed - families, young couples etc and they only time I heard a peep was in the lobby. Hallways quiet ALL night. The entitre staff were extremely helpful and unbelievably quick. We asked for an extra robe, delivered within 5 minutes, same for a coffee pot for the morning. Room service was also not only fast but the food was HOT!! I travel quite a bit and will definitely come back to this hotel. Oh and they also were great w/restaurant recommendations...not only did they send us to my now "new favorite" but had the restaurant hostess greet us by name and lead us by a waiting line to a seat....talk about service!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...but the best in Boston?”
Reviews.Author: mprocacc
Reviews.Content: Pros: Attentive staff, three nice restaurants on site, newer property, clean Cons: no preferred seating at restaurants for hotel guests; 1 of 3 restaurants closed for private party (really?!); a bit off the beaten path; lobby was nice but not spectacular; walls were a bit thin. Spent $400 for a king suite. Nice room but the hotel only has 4 floors so traffic noise is a concern. The rooms was nice but not "old world elegant". Our sitting room was quite large but sparsely furnished. It's a $20 cab ride to downtown; in the winter don't try to walk it - way too cold. For my money, the Lenox has more charm, more elegance, and a much better location. Hotel Nine Zero is also in the hunt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot when visiting Boston!”
Reviews.Author: meeshnewyork
Reviews.Content: Location in Kenmore Square is perfect. Immaculate, charming rooms are larger than most other hotels. Friendly, helpful staff. Public transportation is at your doorstep. Walk to Fenway, resturants, shops, green spaces. Good value!

Reviews.Title: “All that I could hope for”
Reviews.Author: Londonpelican
Reviews.Content: I made an unexpected trip to Boston without hotel reservations, figuring I could get a room at a good downtown hotel without difficulty. But the reason for my visit made it more convenient to be around Fenway Park. I was walking in the area and happened across The Commonwealth. Its medium size, beauty, rooms and restaurants made it look like a good choice, but I had no idea how good. Everything in the hotel worked beautifully, the service was beyond compare, I could not have been more comfortable, and the two restaurants connected to the hotel, with meals that could be charged to the hotel, were as good as any in the city. I immediately started telling my friends what I treasure I had found. It is also across from a Subway stop, although I never used it, and walking distance from the trendy shopping area of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: nancymusicadvocate
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth is located in the heart of the city, close by to all universities and conservatories. Very convenient with THE most professional staff I have ever encountered. Our needs were immediately attended to by the exceptionally accommodating manager Dan Bahr and his well trained staff with a smile and action. This hotel is modern elegance, offering a gentlemanly doorman assistance hailing a taxi, requests handled timely at the front desk, wi fi, comfortable bedding and very friendly people. I will return and highly recommend them to anyone staying in Boston, especially tired mothers who are running their kids around for college tours and auditions! PS: Having two adjoining restaurants to the hotel makes it convenient to eat out and, the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Bad night sleep”
Reviews.Author: dmacq
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by stating that I have stayed in over 15 hotels in Boston, therefore I am a pretty good judge of quality. The hotel is in a great location to see a Red Sox game, but not close to Faneil Hall or the waterfront. The staff was very nice and they have a couple great bar/restaurants connected to the hotel. The room was clean, and large with a separate sitting area and tv. But the bed was horrible!!!! It was so bad that my husband slept on the floor. We complained when we checked out and were told that the next time we stay there they will put a piece of plywood under the mattress... Are you kidding me! How about buying new mattresses, because the one is room 332 felt like it was 50 years old. It's a shame because everything else was good, but when I pay $300 per night I expect a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch in Boston”
Reviews.Author: codebluev7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a quality property located in Kenmore Square at the tip of the BU campus. It has two excellent restaurants in house, Eastern Standard and Island Creek Oyster Bar. We have eaten at both. In bad weather you never have to leave the hotel. Here are some things you should know: 1. Valet parking is 42.00 per day which is standard in Boston. The parking lot is behind the hotel and is secure. 2. The staff is very friendly and I recommend you ask the concierge for help with reservations at the restaurants if necessary before you arrive. 3. The best rooms are facing Kenmore Square on the upper floors for a good view. You don't see much of Fenway in the back. 4. The Hotel has good security with card key elevators. 5. A short walk from the hotel is Dunkin Donuts, 7-11 and a bagel shop. 6. Bertucci"s a chain Italian restaurant is a very solid alternative for drinks and food. The Junior Suite was very nice overlooking Kenmore Square

Reviews.Title: “Take it from a travel professional...”
Reviews.Author: kiwi28104
Reviews.Content: Working in the meeting, conference and incentive business, I stay in a lot of hotels throughout the year. This property is a gem! Each individual, from the bell staff to the front desk, from the telephone operators to the room service staff, was exceptionally attentive. They always addressed me by name when I would come & go, and they always went further than necessary when assisting me with something - whether it was securing transportation, walking directions, a fridge in my room for meds/food, delivery of room gifts to other guests, etc. The rooms were lovely (FABULOUS sound system), and the bed was very comfortable. We do a lot of business in Boston, and I look forward to staying at this property as often as possible when there.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: We had a brief stay on a Saturday night in January. The hotel looks classical but seems to have been built quite recently. We had a "junior suite" - it was very spacious, very well appointed and very comfortable. We were travelling with another party who had booked a basic room. She was upgraded on checkin to a junior suite to keep her within proximity to us - very kind. The two restaurants attached to the hotel are very good but were packed out on the Saturday night.Location is adjacent to Fenway Park and Boston University - I would have prferred to be a bit closer to Boston Common. The staff were very efficient, helpful and friendly. Overall, a very good experience with perhaps location and the cost of parking my only quibbles.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: DublinFoodie333
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent an overnight stay recently at the Hotel COmmonwealth, we were so impressed by the staff and the premises, the selection of restaurants was superb, all round we were made to feel that the Hotel would go bove and beyond to make our stay with them an amzing experience. BRAVO!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: ndesan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Commonwealth for one night this past week for a reception and was impressed by their facilities and welcoming staff. The hotel is well decorated and is attached to two very nice restaurants. My room overlooked Fenway - big plus! I was on the 5th floor so I didn't experience any traffic noise even though I was facing the freeway. Oh, and room service was even attentive and quick (and delicious). I'd definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: CGallucci
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in Boston while our two year old son has heart surgery. My husband, son and I stayed for a couple of nights before my son was admitted. The staff were kind and gracious at every turn - they sent cupcakes, Teddy bears and a get well card signed by all the staff up to our oversized, immaculate and plush room. The hotel oozes charm and the staff make you feel incredibly welcome at every turn. And, there are two fantastic upscale restaurants which I would be happy to dine at every night. We plan to live there for a week to indulge when my son is discharged.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: aegmusc
Reviews.Content: Outstanding room and service. Only issue was loud housekeepers in hall starting about 8am.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: meghan s
Reviews.Content: Located right in Kenmore Square, great location. Hotel was beautiful. We stayed in the Fenway Room. Bed was comfortable and plenty of pillows. I would definetly plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth428
Reviews.Content: As the parent of a senior at Boston University, I have stayed at a number of hotels and bed & breakfast locations in Boston over the years. My recent stay left me wondering why I did not find Hotel Commonwealth sooner. During a major power outage at my home, I had a need for a hotel close to my daughter that would allow me to continue my business, working remotely. Hotel Commonwealth was the perfect choice. The staff arranged for a wonderful room. At first I was concerned because the location was on a low floor overlooking Kenmore Square. My concerns were incorrect. The windows and curtains totally blocked the sound and light. The free Internet was flawless in connecting to my Companyâ€™s VPN for the duration of the stay. Further, my employer commented that the telephone reception during our conference calls was actually much more clear than my own home office. Since most are not looking for an office away from their office, I will share that the bed was very comfortable. I have never experienced such a warm wonderful shower in any hotel or home. It seems like an odd feature to highlight, however, most hotels are usually lacking in water pressure. Not Hotel Commonwealth, where I revelled in the warmth and steam. Fluffy towels and the accompanying spa bath products rounded out the experience. The location of the hotel is convenient to Boston University, area restaurants, the T, and a short walk to shopping (Newbury Street) and more restaurants. The staff was as accommodating as they could be when I needed to extend my stay due to the continuing power outage at home. All the staff was wonderful, from the efficient valet parking, helpful front door personnel, to the friendly front desk staff. I will definitely choose the Hotel Commonwealth for a future stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Just want we wanted/needed!”
Reviews.Author: Sonnyzell
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a classy hotel that offered all-in-one services...and we found it at the Hotel Commonwealth! The rooms are gorgeous, with comfortable, plush pillows and bedding. The junior suite had a comfortable sitting area and work space. Loved the bathroom...do wish the shower was a little bigger, not quite made for two! The hotel also has a gallery, which was a fun diversion. The best part of the hotel were the restaurants/bars! We didn't want to waste the majority of or one night in Boston fighting the cold and traffic, and with two restaurants and a bar we didn't have to! The Hawthorne was amazing! Pricey, yes, but everything there was first class. The bartenders love their craft and are more than willing to educate you along the way. The cocktails were delicious, with special touches. We had dinner at Island Creek Oyster Bar. To die for! The salmon tartar is a must! Again, great service...from the hostess who held our table (we were having too much fun at the Hawthorne!) to the great bartender. Even the guests were fun! We topped off the stay with brunch at Eastern Standard! Yummy!! And the service was excellent, along with the food! We will definitely return to The Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Boston and my stay at Hotel Commonwealth was a perfect experience to welcome me to the city. The staff was extremely helpful and kind. The room and room service was as good as it could have been. Free wifi connection enhanced my business experience. Last, both the front desk staff and the conceirge recommended multiple after hour experiences that worked out well. I truly enjoyed my stay. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and classy”
Reviews.Author: Catherine N
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night and it was joy from start to finish. It is a spectacular looking hotel and the staff are exceedingly accommodating, personable and knowledgable about the area attractions. The hotel is located near all the places I intend on visiting on return trips to Boston - the Prudential, Newbury Street, Beacon Hill, Charles Street, the MFA and of course Fenway Park. Looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect first visit”
Reviews.Author: vicki g
Reviews.Content: I came out with my daughter who was on a college visit and picked the hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews...this hotel earned every single star during our stay. We arrived from a red-eye flight with a request in place to check in early...bleary eyed at 7:30am we were gratefully allowed to check in to our giant and very comfortable Fenway double queen room. From the first people at the front desk, to our very friendly and helpful bellman, to every last person we had contact with at the hotel, the service was superb. As described correctly in all the other reviews, the rooms are very spacious, clean, and comfortable. The location of the hotel next to the T and in walking distance to many great areas made it the right choice for our stay and will be our "home base" for all of our future Boston visits!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful! We stayed here for a company party that was being held at the House of Blues around the corner. The valet was great for the awful weather, the staff was beyond great, and the room and view were incredible. I forgot some things in my car and when I told the front desk they brought it up to my room within 5 minutes! I would absolutely consider staying here whenever I am in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Boston....GO RED SOX!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is amazing. They went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was great. We loved the hotel, loved the location and the junior suite was quite nice. The towels were plush, the bathroom was spacious and the decor in the room was perfect! The only complaint we had is that the bed was not comfortable. This is something the hotel should seriously consider exploring as a good night sleep, when traveling, is so important.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about the great people at Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: HtwoO M
Reviews.Content: We were on a short stay in Boston to visit the MFA & celebrate a birthday. After checking out numerous hotels on-line, we chose Commonwealth for the great location, a MFA special offer, and the relatively new construction. We were very pleased with the staff, from the bell captain & crew, valet service, front desk, conciere, engineering, and cleaning. They were very friendly and helpful, arrranging dining reservations at Hammersley's, taxi service, and making sure our every need was taken care of. We received a special surprize treat for the Birthday guest, and got plenty of personal attention each time we left and returned. At the end of our stay we felt like pampered celebrities. Thanks to all, esp Dan, we'll be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: RuthP620
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room - two televisions- what a bonus. Also free wireless. Loved the layout of the room - sort of a two room concept giving someone who has to work some space from the other person in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: atl_business_woman
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in for business. The King suite was really comfortable. The concierge was excellent. The front desk staff was really helpful. Great restaurants on either side of the hotel (though a bit pricey). Would have really been better if the hotel had a hotel or jacuzzi, but for business purposes, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Rgds
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here! Very hospitable and accommodating staff. Very friendly. They aim to please. Room was lovely ( great pillows) and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nailed it!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at Hotel Commonwealth left something to be desired. I wrote an email to the manager explaining, and we were invited back for a second night. They went above and beyond to make sure that we had a fantastic night for my birthday. Our room was absolutely gorgeous, the jacuzzi tub was lovely, marble everywhere. Loved the separate shower...the bathroom was literally the size of an apartment I once had. The beds are so comfortable, love the pillows, the sheets, the bathrobes and the slippers. They came in while we were out to eat and neatened the room, turned down the bed, left chocolates on the pillow. It's the little things like that that make a hotel stay special. The staff, especially the front of the house manager Jeff, were extremely attentive and friendly. Everything we requested, from a fridge to an extended checkout, was given to us quickly, efficiently and with kindness and warmth. We have tried both adjoining restaurants, loved them both. Island creek has a great ambiance, Eastern Standards' brunch is very very good. We truly enjoyed our stay. We will absoutely be back and we recommend this hotel for any kind of stay, business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic boutique hotel with great people”
Reviews.Author: 1fstlap
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to stay near Boston U. while visiting my daughter and a friend recommended it. I didn't expect much but was pleasantly surprised. Lucas at the front desk was very friendly and helpful, he should be there 24 x 7 ha ha ha! The hotel is right at the kenmore station of the T line and gets you easily around the city. It's a quiet hotel but it's flanked by two nice places to eat and unwind, the hotel's own oyster bar on one end and the Eastern Standard on the other. Just came from another boutique Hotel located in Times Square nyc, and the Commonwealth was bigger, nicer and they have Fresh brand toiletries which my friend insisted I must take home for her! On my way to the airport I was taken in a Cadillac Escalade for the price of a cab fare. Luxury,Value, and Service!

Reviews.Title: “Our third time here, and definitely not our last!”
Reviews.Author: Erin2131
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful stay at this hotel! The location is convienent to many popular spots and is located right near the "T" (subway). The hotel staff is friendly and always ready to help. My boyfriend and I always try to make it up to Boston at least once a year, and this is always the hotel we prefer to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Julie T
Reviews.Content: This was the first time stayed at Hotel Commonwealth, but I hope it is not the last! Everything was delightful from the very friendly hotel staff to the valet car service. The room service was efficient and delicious, and we loved the adjoining restaurants. We also appreciated the dvd library. :) I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Glorina”
Reviews.Author: Glorina G
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter had a great experience. At first thing when we arrived we were given a room upgrade. Nice!!!! The room was very clean and beautiful. It is right next door to the "T" entrance,which was nice because of the bad weather. One night we were greeted with a cheese tray in our room. The beds were super super comfortable. But what we liked the most was: THE PEOPLE. They were all so friendly and helpful. It is a bit on the expensive side but it is worth every penny. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lea P
Reviews.Content: The service was superb and the room we stayed in was very comfortable with a beautiful view. I would absolutely suggest this hotel to a friend or acquaintance. I definitely plan on coming back to Hotel Commonwealth on my next visit to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Best in the area”
Reviews.Author: Mat P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great location for both Red Sox fans and Boston University parents. The door men are great and the service is second to none. The rooms are very spacious and the beds are very comfy. Most rooms have a good view as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Winter Visits By Frequent Visitors To Boston”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: First off, the Hotel Commonwealth is an excellent hotel with a very outgoing, friendly and professional staff. It is conveniently located to the shopping streets of Newbury and Boylston, Fenway Park and the museums all of which would be walkable on nice days. When I went in January, however, the temps were in the single digits so it was exceptionally convenient to be at the HC which is right next to the Kenmore T stop; an extremely short walk to Fenway and its collection of bars and nightlife; and allows for meals and drinks at 3 onsite locations which are all very very good particularly for craft cocktail and seafood lovers. The new Hawthorne is pretty cool and Eastern Standard and Island Creek Oyster Bar are great places - and all three are accessible from inside the Hotel w/out having to go outside (very important on sub-freezing nights). The lobby/sitting area is nice and smells great. Had a Fenway Room which does look out onto Fenway. Very big bathroom. "Fresh" brand hair/body products provided. Room was very dark when shades were drawn. Pretty quiet overall in the room/hallways. Fitness Center is small and has no windows, but has 6-8 machines and some free weights. Kenmore is much better than when I was a student 20 years ago, but it is still not the nicest or best neighborhood to stay for first time visitors IMO unless your activities are centered around BU or Fenway (then, absolutely Yes). But if you are pretty familiar with Boston and know you're way around, then I cannot recommend the Hotel Commonwealth highly enough. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne F
Reviews.Content: Recently, my daughter, a Boston University student, needed surgery. We lived at Hotel Commonwealth for a recuperative, post-surgery week and it could not have been better. They met us at the door with a wheelchair when we returned from the hospital; they were friendly, gracious and accommodating to our many guests; and they even sent someone to pick up dinner for us in downtown Boston when my daughter was craving gluten-free pasta. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: jl90
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in Boston to attend a Celtics game. The Hotel is beautiful and conveniently located. We were able to take the Green Line which is right across the street to Fanuiel Hall, TDGarden, and the Museum of Science. Our beautifully appointed room had a great view into Fenway Park. Hopefully I'll be able to get tickets to a Sox game this summer and stay here again. I did not eat in the Hotel restaurant but did enjoy room service for breakfast which was great. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. I definitely would love to stay at this beautiful hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “No other choice, but the Commonwealth!”
Reviews.Author: Mchefmom
Reviews.Content: Every time we're in Boston, we chose to stay at the Commonwealth. The service is great, everyone helpful. I love the suite configurations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Wystan A
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are simply huge. The location is fantastic for reaching the Commons, Newbury Street, and the Red Sox temple.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth ROCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: My daughter is a freshman at Boston University this year and have been staying/trying all different hotels in the Fenway/Beacon Street area... this hotel was by far the BEST one yet!! Service was OUTSTANDING... staff was friendly, courteous and kind! The rooms were HUGE and so clean... could have eaten off the floors! Will only stay at Hotel Commonwealth from now on when visiting my daughter at BU!! Thanks so much... we will see you guys in March! SUPERIOR HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in an instant...”
Reviews.Author: SBD2958
Reviews.Content: Not only is the hotel beautiful, and conveniently located, our stay was amazing. We were instantly upgraded and thoroughly enjoyed the Baseball Suite. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, making reservations nearby, calling taxi for early hours and giving great tips for a safe and successful trip in Boston. Itâ€™s a must stay anytime we visit Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the ONLY PLACE to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Commonwealth several times. From the moment you are greeted at the front door and until you depart, everything is top shelf. The entire staff is friendly, courteous, and extremely helpful. We love the accommodations. The rooms are tastefully done and are so comfortable. ( We'd like to buy a bed from them!) We have eaten at both restaurants, Island Creek Oyster Bar and Eastern Standard -- there is no reason to leave the hotel when you have dining like this! There is also a great bar that recently opened. The Commonwealth's location is another plus. It's an easy walk to shopping on Newbury St., and an invigorating walk to Quincy Market and the Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay at hotel!”
Reviews.Author: paula m
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise gift from our children and we were not sure what to expect. The hotel and staff were amazing! I travel for work often so am used to staying nice hotels. This hotel was the best I have ever been in. The hotel was beautiful, fancy and clean. The staff was exceptional. The front desk staff was efficient,and checked us in with a great smile. He gave us accurate information about the hotel and the surrounding areasnever did I feel that he needed to get to the next gueast. Every staff member that we passed in the halls to asking about a local spots was kind and always smiling. I assume that the hotel must be great place to work for because everyone was wonderful! The two restaurants were great and the hotel helped with reservations so we did not have to wait in the restaraunt. I can not compliment this hotel enough, especially the wonderful staff, they made the visit! Will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: frtanz
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Look foward to a return stay. Staff very accommodating. Location and facilities made my birthday celebration visit to Boston great.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year's Eve Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Meaghan44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth on New Year's Eve and was so impressed. I travel a lot for work and rarely receive the type of service I received during my stay. The Front Desk Staff was amazing. The rooms were great (love love love the Fresh bath products) and room service (from Eastern Standard) was also timely and delicious. Can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay close to Fenway!”
Reviews.Author: Doug R
Reviews.Content: We had an very enjoyable weekend here. The hotel is convenient to the T (subway) and just two blocks from Fenway Park. Our room, and the hotel in general, was exceptionally clean and quiet. The staff was very helpful, efficient and friendly. The hotel has wifi, and a small business area with computers if you need them. The valet service took good care of our car (which was one of my main concerns.... I have a new car and it was like leaving our baby with a sitter for the first time!). The associated restaurants were friendly, with good but not great food, and both were pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahsouriante
Reviews.Content: Amazing property with a unique decor, a great location and two excellent restaurants. The subway station is litteraly next door. The room was spacious, staff did great. Two little things are missing for me: a night light in the bathroom and a coffe make.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: weyl-59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable with nice rooms. Adjacent to Fenway Park, within walking distance of BU on one side and the convention/hotel complex on the other side and perhaps 25 minute walk from the Boston Garden down Boylston. A little pricey compared to boutique hotels in other major cities plus no coffee maker in the rooms which are spacious. It's easy to settle in and use the hotel as a work space while visiting Boston. The nearby Dunkin Donuts looks a little seedy but they have very good coffee in the morning. Perhaps the best feature for this hotel is the adjacent oyster bar and seafood restaurant, Island Creek Oyster Bar, which is outstanding with some good wines and first-rate bar drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and service”
Reviews.Author: Jek05446
Reviews.Content: A wonderful boutique hotel with excellent service and convenient location. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone coming to Boston. Especially for Red Sox or other Kenmore Square and Back Bay area activities. A short walk or short cab ride to anywhere in the city. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lmbistis
Reviews.Content: Hotel service, rooms, and location were excellent. Had a king suite which was a good size, with a view of Kenmore Square and a jacuzzi tub. Also loved the oyster bar and the Eastern Standard. Would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What is Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Jaguar2012
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed here. This was booked for me and was a reasonable price, so I went with the plan. I've stayed at the Mariott Copley many, many times and absolutely love it. I was pleasantly surprised. Hotel Commonwealth is so uniquely decorated. It is gorgeous. When in the guest rooms, you don't think it is a hotel.The bed was so comfortable. I loved it. The restaurant, Eastern Standard was such a nice and lively atmosphere. We met for after dinner drinks and since Harpoon IPA was on draft, that was the choice. The desk staff as well as doorman when arriving and departing were so helpful and polite. This is where I will stay the next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great restaurant & bar options”
Reviews.Author: JB1966
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel once you make your way up to the (nice) lobby on the first floor. Service is excellent and very friendly. Nick and Dan in particular will went out of their way to make us feel very welcome. The junior suites are great so i would try to book one of these if you can but the Fenway rooms are also good (but obviously smaller). Hotel location is great for transport (literally on top of Kenmore station) and shopping on Newbury Street in Back Bay (a nice stroll from the hotel towards the Common). The Island Creek Oyster bar is so good that we went back 3 times during our stay - something we normally never do. Admittedly 1 occasion was because we had a booking issue at the ES restaurant and they did a great job at the Oyster Bar accommodating us on one of the busiest nigths of the year. Service at the Oyster Bar is excellent, the atmosphere is great and the food (it's not just a bar but also a restaurant) is simply delicious (the oysters were spectular but loads of delicous seafood options for the non-oyster eaters). I highly recommend this restaurant. The hotel also has a nice lounge bar and the Easter Standard Restaurant. The latter looks good, buzzy and with a nice bar but we did not get to eat there because of the booking issue so I can't comment on the food. The only minor negative comment about the hotel i can think of is that the air ventilation system was a bit noisy even when the aircon/heating was not on but perhaps this was only in our room. Otherwise, the rooms are very quiet and you can't hear the street nor the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations... great way to start off the year.”
Reviews.Author: Lindy m
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with the Hotel Commonwealth. The staff were all very kind and very helpful. The room service was quick and the food was delicious from the Eastern Standard Restaurant next door. The room its self couldn't have been better. It was spotless, beautifully decorated and very comfortable. We don't live very far away but we were attending a wedding at the hotel that evening and thought we deserved a nice treat and decided to book a room for the new years eve wedding. I'm so glad we did, what a nice way to start off 2012. We look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful two-day getaway”
Reviews.Author: TomO0350
Reviews.Content: Upsides included amazing, five-star service; large, quiet, well-appointed mini-suite facing Comm. Ave; overall location (walked everywhere). Minor disappointments included odd, and somewhat out-of-date TV technology (remote; had to get DVDs from the front desk; missing cable from back of TV that had to be replaced); and the food was just ok at the Eastern Standard Restaurant. Overall, a solid four-star rating, with hopes of returning at another time.
