Reviews.Title: “Just What The Doctor Ordered”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer N
Reviews.Content: I live within 30 miles of the hotel. Desperately needed a change of scenery, as ill health has restricted my activity and kept me house-bound in recent weeks. The Hotel Commonwealth was chosen because I have familiarity with the neighborhood (Eastern Standard Restaurant has been my new favorite for the past year) and a best friend moved to the Brookline neighborhood, just a few miles up the road. I was hoping for a beautifully appointed room, superior service, and ideal location for a night in the city. Chose a suite on the top floor; views were lovely and the hallway was quiet during the late night hours. The Hotel Commonwealth met my high expectations. I had a glorious 24 hour trip into the city and am already making plans to stay there again. Thank you HC. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth was a gem”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: This is the the best hotel I have stayed in and I have been travelling for 45 years. The staff is so ready to please or help you. Every staff member that we met showed that they were happy to be there even through it was the holiday season. The rooms were excellent and well decorated. We faced the street area and it was very quite. The restaurants (Island Creek and Eastern Standard) were great. The meals and the presentation were absolutely a cut above the rest. They found out that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and we received a lot of attention. We were pleasantly surprised to find this gem of a hotel in Boston's Kenmore Square area, because the area was so serene that you would not believe you were in Boston. It is so well located at the Kenmore terminal that you can get anywhere in Boston by way of the T. We are telling all our friends and plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Eve at Fenway!”
Reviews.Author: Jack20111
Reviews.Content: Staff was very polite and helpful, even making dinner reservations for us. The dining experience at Island Creek Oyster Bar was outstanding! The extensive raw bar and unique approach to dining was enjoyable. The entrees were unique and fantastic. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Location+Price+Extras+Service=Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Koho26
Reviews.Content: Great location close to downtown, at the edge of Boston U and across the highway from Fenway Park. Reasonable rates. We had a package that inlcuded a $50 credit in the attached restaurant for breakfast and 2 tickets to the Art Museum less than a mile away. All the workers were very friendly from housekeeping to the dorrmen to the front desk. Free use of computers and printers which was nice for checking in and printing boarding passes. Had late return flight so they gave us a late checkout to 2:00pm - very helpful to us. Would absolutely stay here again. Once again, Tripadvisor was accurate!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: linda d
Reviews.Content: During our 3 week holiday to the US we stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth in October 2011 and rated it our best stay. The staff were very friendly, efficient and the rooms decorated beautifully and very comfortable. The location was perfect for exploring Boston and to finding great places to eat. We would definately stay there again and thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The hotel itself is very beautiful and appropriately priced and having a restaurant (Eastern Standard) connected to it makes it even more convenient although there are other choices within walking distance. We love the city of Boston and will stay here again. We love that it's so close to our favorite ballpark-Fenway. I would and will recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the junior suite”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel commonwealth for one night while in town for a concert. It ended up being perfect in terms of friendly service, the junior suite for an extra small fee was awesome with a big whirlpool tub, and the location was perfect being right by Fenway. We had a great time and would definitely stay here again for a sox game in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Julie Y
Reviews.Content: I had been to Boston before but never to this particular area. I was there Monday - Thursday for work and while I didn't spend much time at the hotel other than to sleep there, I found it very warm and cozy. The valet/bell personnel were very helpful, as was everyone at the front desk. They use a driver named Lou who is also very friendly and costs same as a cab to ride in his very comfortable Cadillac SUV. My room was quite large with a large couch and desk to work from. The bathroom was roomy with plenty of counter space. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Second home”
Reviews.Author: PrfDCT
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth is a first class, first rate hotel that reflects the best of Boston. There are young people everywhere, all very capable and eager to make your stay a great one. The hotel is comfortable, accomodating and convenient. It is kept in great condition. The decor is classy, the rooms are large, yet like a friendly embrace. And the Boston T is right out the front door. I stay here often and I have imagined it my second home. PrfDCT

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cindy D
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel in Boston has two fantastic restaurants, great service, and all the amenities one could ask for. I loved it! I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable, and great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: trojan39
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a weekend with my girlfriend at hotel commonwealth. It was our first time in Boston together and we really didn't have a plan at first. The gentleman who worked greeted us at the door upon our arrival were extremely helpful. Nick who worked at the desk was extremely helpful. He broke down the city and mapped out the entire subway system for us. He walked us through how to get to various places like the movies, the aquarium, and the fine arts museum which were highly suggested by him. We had a wonderful time at the hotel commonwealth and we loved the spacious rooms and the in room dining. The risotto and the creme brÃ»lÃ©e is a must order. Their management hopefully recognizes what a great job they are doing because we certainly appreciated it. They gave us direction and the comfort we needed in seeing the city of Boston just for two days. Shout out to Nick, Luke, and the door men for taking care of us. They all deserve a raise! Great location and worth every penny! It's no wonder they are ranked as tops on trip advisor. I normally don't respond or write reviews but I felt compelled to. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Maximillian M
Reviews.Content: Superior service!!! I travel quite a bit for business and stay at many "Fancy" hotels. None come close to the service that Hotel Commonwealth offered me. There was always someone available to help me find a restaurant, massage, special transportation,or simply to greet me with a smile and ask me if I needed anything. The rooms were spacious and elegant and arranged to provide maximum comfort. I will be staying here every time I go to Boston and have recommended this Hotel to friends, family, co-workers, and even my executives. Don't forget to check out the two wonderful restaurants on-site.

Reviews.Title: “G”
Reviews.Author: Georgewii
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel. Near our business @ Partners in Health, who recommended you. "Eastern Standerd was an excellent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Candis W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gorgeous. I could see Fenway Park from my window. Eastern Standard was just down stairs. It's super close to BU's campus. I've been to a ton of hotels, and this one was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lozio
Reviews.Content: Elegant yet not fancy. You feel yourself like in a comfortable bubble. Staff: great. Friendly but with the right distance. A place where I will turn back. Distance from Back Bay shops is 10 minutes walking. The T is just outside of the hotel. Taxi always there just in case. The Red Sox temple is at 2 minutes. Choice the Commonwealth room: it's like a junior suite.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth is awesome”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: We had our company's holiday part at Eastern Standard, a wonderful restaurant next to The Hotel Commonwealth. The valets at the door, the desk staff, the bell captains could not have been more friendly and ready to help us at any turn. We had a car and bag in no time on our way home. Rooms are very spacious and so clean. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a hotel in Boston (right near the transit stop) and adjacent to Fenway Park.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: sallyemoore
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant and helpful staff. Incredibly comfortable bed and well appointed rooms. However it was rather expensive, but in line with similar hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the ordinary experience”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend after our nearby apartment was destroyed. The staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. At no cost they volunteered to bring in an extra refrigerator and microwave and on check in they sent up complimentary chocolates and a bottle of wine! It was a very stressful time for us and the service could not have been better. As usual, the accommodations were also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Commonwealth!”
Reviews.Author: C K
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three times now, once with our children and twice by ourselves. The room is really nice the bedding is terrific. The hospitality and service are wonderful. What we love the most is the location and the two outstanding restaurants downstairs, Eastern Standard and Island Creek Oyster Bar. The food and service is amazing and the design and decor is truly inspiring. We highly recommend a trip to the Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Service Supreme”
Reviews.Author: Donna77889
Reviews.Content: The staff are great!! Very genuine and authentic. Relaxed and subtle, everything about this hotel from decor to service is first class. I've stayed in most of the Boston hotels, but now that I've found the Commonwealth intend to always book there.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon5000
Reviews.Content: I came to Boston to visit Harvard and MIT and chose to stay at the Hotel Commonwealth based on all the good reviews I read online. I came to realize that the reviews were definitely accurate as the service exceeded my expectations and they really do treat you like royalty here. When I first arrived the doorman took my luggage straight to the concierge and gave them my name for check in! The front desk was very welcoming and they arranged for me to stay in a more quiet room as I requested. The room was very nice, spacious and quiet. The Fresh bath products were amazing! The next day when I was going to visit MIT, the doorman immediately asked if I needed a cab and brought me one within seconds. It was pouring outside, so he let me use his umbrella during my visit to campus! The only thing I think can be improved is if they offer free coffee in the mornings or a coffee maker in the room. Ultimately, it is the sincere and genuine customer service they provided that I care most about, as it gives me a peace of mind that I will be taken care of no matter what comes up.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_san_11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for business multiple times, and will continue to return. The location can't be beat (esp. for a Red Sox game) and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. I recommend the Junior Suite - luxurious and spacious at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: wendy p
Reviews.Content: My nine year old had tests scheduled at Children's hospital and we hoped to avoid the hour plus drive in on the morning of the tests. We deceided to stay at HC the night before. To our suprise they gave us a discounted rate AND upgraded us to a suite. The room was impeccably clean (and I am neurotic about that!), spacious and very tastefully decorated. We were disappointed that there was no tub and the halls were a little noisy at night but otherwise- perfection. Staff were attentive and thoughtful. The location is just fabulous so we had many resturants to choose from and spent time in the Barnes and Noble across the street. We decided to return again after the holiday just for fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: UI1987
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times. Location is good for us. Hotel is nice. Staff do not neccessarily go out of their way to provide service. This last visit the stool was plugged not just in our room but the whole corridor. Some 24 hours later still slow drains to flush and drain tub...you know the type of tub that fills up some 2-4 inches of water while showering with soap and hairballs before it attempts to slither down the pipes. We called for a plunger one day and it took about 2 hours before they showed up with some 6 foot snake to try and snake the drain. The same night we called for a plunger to just keep in the room as the toilet was a slow process. Nothing like feeling you're back in college with all of the other students in town. Bed was old and soft.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: hisgrandma
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, older hotel with spacious rooms, nice linens, high end bathroom amenities and great service. It is in a convenient location, but not a particularly scenic part of town. So, the view (from the rear of the building) is of roof mechanicals, an expressway and yes, the Fenway Park sign. Tip: pay the extra $ for a front view of the street. The service is terrific from bellmen to front desk staff to housekeeping. The two restaurants in the hotel are outstanding! Even though we could have gone to many wonderful eateries in the area, we returned night after night to these two and were never disappointed. The trolley stop is only 2 blocks away, the subway next door and a bus stop is just out the front, making touring very convenient . My only complaint is there are no coffee makers in the rooms. Your choice is to go the lobby (only on weekends for $3.50/cup), order room service at $10/small pot, go to one of the restaurants in the building or go outside to a Dunkin Donuts 2 buildings away. I would return to the Commonwealth for a future trip IF the hotel put coffee makers in the rooms or made free coffee in the morning available. So, for those of us who MUST have our morning coffee, preferably upon rising, this was a little inconvenient. On the whole, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, great location and flawless service”
Reviews.Author: Sefmarshall
Reviews.Content: Nice departure from the norm. Stylish, well placed hotel convenient to everything. Thoughtful service, impeccably designed with some great touches. Great decor and the restaurant - Eastern Standard - was terrific. Can't say enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: okmeow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for work and was pleasantly surprised by the fantastic service. One evening I came home to a cheese tray with fruits and some wine. It really made my evening! Thank you for the wonderful and thoughtful stay. The bed was very comfortable. Rooms was spacious and very clean. The decor is very tasteful and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype: A Great Weekend Get-A-Way”
Reviews.Author: jneil
Reviews.Content: My DH and I recently spent two nights at this hotel to celebrate a special occasion. The location is very convenient, the green line Kenmore stop is literally below the hotel. This enables one easy access to the T and travel around the city. We arrived a Â½ hour before check-in and were offered a cup of hot apple cider. We were pleasantly surprised to find out that not only was our room ready but that we had been given an upgrade to a suite overlooking Kenmore square. Room: The room was huge and beautiful with a heavy curtain to separate the comfy king-sized bed from the living area. We loved the two comfy chairs and ottoman, a nice desk, and flat screen tv. (There are actually two, one is in the bedroom, too). We were given a complimentary bottle of wine and some delicious chocolate truffles in our room so we decided to enjoy that and watch some Saturday college football before we headed out for the night. At first, I couldnâ€™t get the television to work but one quick call down to the front desk, and the problem was solved. The curtain between the two rooms blocked off any leaking light from the front curtains and we loved the â€œcaveâ€� feelingâ€¦.love complete darkness to sleep. The room also had a universal IPod player with remote so you could control it from your bed if need be. The bathroom was immaculate with a nice size tub and wonderful â€œFreshâ€� products. The toilet had its separate room which was nice for getting ready when we both needed to use the bathroom. Shower pressure was great but watch out for that water, it could get really hot! The only complaint was they only provided one robe while there were two of us in the room but not a big deal. There was a safe in the closet albeit not very large. Also, an umbrella was available if you needed to use it. Turn down service is provided (they ask at check-in if you want it) and they leave you some nice chocolates. Staff: We cannot say enough about the staff that works here. They were one of the nicest front desk staffs I have even come into contact with. Any question we had was met with sincere assistance. Restaurant: We ate a late night meal and later a late lunch at one of their restaurants, The Eastern Standard. Being locals, we had dined here before and really enjoyed it but my DH loved it this time around. He had a prosciutto sandwich which he claimed is â€œone of the best sandwichesâ€� that he has ever had (hence why we returned for a late lunch). Saturday night was packed and we hung out in the bar. I noticed a bar table had been open for a while, and when I went to the host stand, she was more than happy to seat us there. Our server was excellent (canâ€™t remember her name, sorry) despite the huge crowd and later hour. Location: As mentioned, the T stop is right thereâ€¦.a major plus. Also, we were easily able to walk down to the Newbury Street area and the Boston Common. We had unusually warm November weather and many were taking advantage of it by walking around. Saturday night we took in a show at The House of Blues which is literally around the corner from the hotel (next to Fenway Park) This hotel is immaculate and every time we walked into the lobby we commented on how much we loved the smell! From the doormen to the front desk to the restaurant workers and the maids, we have nothing but praise. This hotel made our local get-away weekend even better and we would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Kerri B
Reviews.Content: My daughter became ill unexpectedly and we needed to find a good place for her to rest and recover. Their staff was wonderful and assisted us very well.

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: room78
Reviews.Content: checkin and out was a breeze. Great restaurants right under the hotel. Room was very clean, spacious, comfortable bed, nicely decorated without being over the top. Terrible tiny ironing board. They put us in a handicap access room, perhaps why our bathroom was huge. quiet rooms; couldn't hear neighbors or any stret noise on a busy Saturday night. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: cashea_11
Reviews.Content: I'm a local, but stayed in town for a work event. The staff was outstanding--friendly, efficient, energetic. The room was beautiful, location is perfect--accessible, close to the river, fun part of town. I felt like I was on vacation right here at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MsChelsea
Reviews.Content: My stay was a weekend overnight with my daughter who was meeting some friends at HOB for a show. The staff was friendly and very accommodating with everything. The location was perfect for us and we loved the view of Fenway! We had breakfast at Eastern Standard the next morning and that was great as well. I hope to get back there for a longer weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Mimsyrn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a scheduled meeting. The hotel is a beautiful place. The staff was especially willing to help and very pleasant to work with. The room was perfect with everything one could possibly need. I completely enjoyed my short stay but would gladly have spent a week there!

Reviews.Title: “A truly magical Holiday experience”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Commonwealth over the 2011 Thanksgiving Holiday made my family's holiday a truly special time. It is a very beautiful hotel in a great location with an exceptional staff. From the great doormen who great you upon every arrival to the friendly and knowledgeable front desk staff who attend to every need, to the exceptional dining venues (we loved Eastern Standard!) it is 5 star all the way! Great rooms, easy transportation and superb dining made for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: shoshanasmom012
Reviews.Content: I think I may have already written a review last time I stayed there, I had my 3rd stay at Hotel Commonwealth over the weekend and it continues to be consistent on great quality, clean, beautiful hotel, great bang for the buck and, what makes me keep coming back is the kindness and warmth of the staff! I switched from Four Seasons and don't think I"ll ever go back! Top notch in every way.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Very nice choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Jeff T
Reviews.Content: Fresh, clean, spacious, elegant, a lovely modern hotel with an excellent restaurant (Eastern Standard) connected to it. Eager, friendly staff, large, comfortable rooms (really little suites), and the best water pressure I've ever experienced in a hotel. This is a serious issue for anyone with a lot of hair who has tried to rinse it out in the typically dinky spray of most hotel baths.

Reviews.Title: “Predictably excellent”
Reviews.Author: HELRAM
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth and I have learned to expect and appreciate the quality service provided from the front desk, to the complimentary shoe shines, to the maid services to the restaurants attached. I conducted a business meeting in the room. There was ample desk space to work. My window looked out on Fenway Park and the green wall sigh, "Home of the Boston Red Sox". The location is great and they just opened an enjoyable, beit higher priced bar. I love staying here/

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Commonwealth on a repeated basis for several years when I visit my son, who lives in the Kenmore Square area. The location is perfect, at the center of everything Back Bay, and the service is impeccable. All of the service personnel call me by name and try to fulfill my every wish. The Eastern Standard restaurant downstairs has delicious, fresh food of all types. I loved my Thanksgiving turkey dinner. Best of all is their special Caramel Bread Pudding dessert. I've been known to take out a serving and bring it back home to Philadelphia!

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: HiLeslie
Reviews.Content: My family lives on the East coast so we stay at Hotel Commonwealth whenever we visit. They are always warm, welcoming, attentive, and they go over the top to be accommodating and nice. It means a lot to us after coming in from the West coast with kids in tow--we're all tired, and they get us set up quickly. They have several great restaurants so we now look forward to our stay and getting to eat there--plus the cocktails are great. The hotel is pretty, clean and in a great location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: DH7156
Reviews.Content: I'm a BU parent and the location can't be beat. Eastern Standard restaurant offers exceptional food in an English Pub atmosphere. The T is outside the door so it's an easy trip to downtown. It's expensive but worth it for me to be on the campus of BU. Needs coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: AmandaSym
Reviews.Content: I mainly work in London but visit Boston for work about once a month and have tried a bunch of different hotels. This is the best! The staff are friendly, the rooms are luxurious, the location is perfect and the restaurant "Island Creek Oyster Bar" is definitely one of the best in Boston. Eastern Standard on the same block is a great bar. Fenway Park is a few minutes walk and shopping in back-bay is a 5 minute walk. Kenmore station - the green line - is directly next to the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and friendly, personal service”
Reviews.Author: nnonmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Commonwealth for 6 nights in November while attending a conference at another big-name hotel. Felt sorry for the conference attendees who were staying at that hotel as it was so big and impersonal. The Commonwealth met and exceeded our expectations. There's a marvellous restaurant attached to the hotel which supplies 24 hour room service. Got to know Nick and Jeff, the world's most friendly and helpful concierges. The Kenmore subway is immediately underneath so access to public transport is excellent. Fenway Park, the home of the Red Sox, is just behind the hotel. It's close to Boston University. MIT and Harvard are just over the river in Cambridge. Loved staying here, would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of smirks, but short on professionality”
Reviews.Author: Traveller124
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Hotel Commonwealth late at night. The hotel had been given notice 8 months ago that I would need to have completely synthetic bedding in the room, because I am allergic to feather and down, etc. I had also called and spoken to the General Manager a few days before arriving. He promised me that all my requirements would be addressed. When I checked into the room late on the night of arrival, I was shocked to find that the pillows and bedding were not synthetic, but feather filled. I called down to the front desk, and they told me that even the mattress was feather filled. I was shocked and left the room immediately. I had life threatening asthma as a child, caused by feather pillows. As a medical person I am absolutely appalled that the hotel could neglect something this important, and potentially life threatening, certainly deleterious to one's health. When I went back to the front desk, they offered to change out the room that was now filled with feather and allergens. I refused to stay in that room. The manager at the front desk was smirking. I left for a 5 star hotel after making a few calls. When I called a few days later to speak to the person that I had booked the hotel room through, she was also smirking on the telephone. Apparently, it was a big joke that they had messed up in such a big way. I called the General Manager. He insulted my intelligence by insisting that the room had indeed had synthetic bedding in it. I know the difference between synthetic and feather filled bedding. I found his attitude extremely dishonest. For those of you that do not know, feather filled bedding contains dust mite which is an allergen. It is the filthiest type of bedding that one can use, especially in a hotel setting where many people use it. I do not know how this hotel is No. 1 on the list for Boston. There are much better hotels in the vicinity, that have staff that are better trained. Although I did not stay in this hotel, I saw enough to know that they fell far below reasonable hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and well-situated”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: The hotel really is well-reflected in the consistently high ratings here. Very clean, very nice, large and well-appointed room (even the "basic," which is what I had). Desk staff was very pleasant and efficient. Owned by Boston University, this hotel is obviously convenient to that, but generally convenient and yet not in the major bustle of the convention hotels, etc. Boston is such a walkable city that I had no problems with pleasant walk on Commonwealth and then Newbury right to the Commons,and obviously much shorter walks to Fenway Park, Convention Center, Prudential shopping, etc. T is literally under it for going longer distances. Definitely worth fullest consideration, and price is also more than competitive!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Operas
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and I love hotels! This was the best hotel by far! They are kind, attentive, and treat you like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kristi0000
Reviews.Content: Elegant, spacious room that was very clean with strong shower and very comfortable be. The staff was very nice, professional, helpful and services were fast. Restaurants in the hotel, excellent. Nice view and quiet. Great location for exploring the city on foot, and to explore farther corners subway is very easy to use. Close to nice restaurants and bars or lounges for those who are not too young and not too old.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: bribabe105
Reviews.Content: When you visit Boston, stay here! Its a beautiful hotel, and a good price for its value. Plus its a good distance from a lot of things to do. Your treated like royalty here! the rooms are comfy and you get amazing sleep here. You cant get any better in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Girls trip”
Reviews.Author: RKWB
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the hotel. The hotel is beautiful but most of the service was impeccable. I brought a friend with me who said she felt like a movie star. Everyone treats you like your somebody. I believe that's the best you can get! Room was beautiful and loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful non-chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanjBha
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for work and loved it! Only a 30 dollar cab ride from Logan Airport. Great walking neighborhood and a very nice place. Room was clean, elegant and modern. The amenities were great and I loved having wifi. Oyster restaurant in lobby was delicious

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: If you go to Boston, stay here. The service was perfect, the restaurants in the hotel are fun, and the room was on the same scale as a Ritz or Four Seasons. I'll be coming back and will be steering friends to stay at Hotel Commonwealth.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: VGMHawaii
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional!! My 8th trip to Boston, this time for 11 nights at the end of October, and I am still in love with this place. The staff is gracious and warm, and very professional, they consistantly look for ways to make your stay more comfortable and enjoyable.The Hotel, and the rooms are impeccable and clean, and even after coming here for eight years, I can say that it looks like a brand new hotel. I look forard to my vacation again next year, and would advise anyone visiting Boston to make this their "home" while there. I have to say that this is my favorite Hotel. Thank you Hotel Commonwealth.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for first timers or baseball fans visitng Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Steven Z
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth was wonderful. This was our first time in Boston and staying at the Commonwealth meant we were a little farther away from some of Bostons hot spots but gave us the opportunity to explore the city via the Boston "T" subway line. We found the hotel staff to be wonderful and very very helpful, say hi to Nick at the front door, he was a joy to chat with and shows real pride in his work. From a convenience perspective if you are coming to see a Sox game the Commonwealth would be ideal as the hotel is literally 1.5 blocks from Fenway. It is also situated literally over top of the Kenmore T stop making it ultra convenient and you can literally take a single fare trip by bus and train from the airport in about 35 minutes, super convenient! The commonwealth also has 2 of Boston's best restaurants, Island Creek Oyster House and Eastern Standard, on their property putting fine dining at your finger tips. The hotel staff will do their best to get you seated on late notice as well. The front desk got us a table at the Eastern Standard mid dinner rush when open table told us now reservations weren't available. The restaurant even called our room to tell us when our table was ready, we felt like VIPs. We would definitely stay here again. If I only had one complaint it would be that the rooms thermostat, although digital, was finicky and it seemed at times it would be much colder or hotter when set at the same temperature. Other than that our stay was about perfect!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “A weekend in Boston at The Commonwealth Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Commonwealth many times as a very convenient hotel for downtown Boston but stay there now because it is the best place in town! As regular travelers to Beantown, we have tried many of the higher quality hotels and like most of them but The Commonwealth has a unique quality unparalleled by other establishments. The lobby, rooms and corridors are very clean and are decorated without being ostentacious. The staff are superb, cheerful and courteous from the doorman to the check-in desk. They are always like this irrespective of who they are or which shift is on. The choice of restaurants and bars is also excellent with Eastern Standard on the west side for breakfast or a drink, Island Creek Oyster House on the est side with an amazing daily cuisine, bar and Sunday brunch plus the newly renovated Hawthorne Lounge which has a very special atmosphere perfect for the culture of the hotel and its clientele. Don't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “I Won't Stay Anywhere Else in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Mikeb1Falmouth_MA
Reviews.Content: Although we live close to Boston, I surprised my wife with a birthday weekend in the Hub. I selected the Commonwealth because of Trip Advisor reviews and my expectations were exceeded. What a wonderful place! Most important is the customer service, which gets an A+ -- from the time we arrived to the time we left, everything was perfect. The nicest surprise was a free upgrade to a suite when I mentioned we were celebrating my wife's birthday. The hotel's two restaurants are also excellent and the location is convenient to Boston attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in Boston”
Reviews.Author: buck60_Ogunquit
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Commonwealth Hotel on many occasions and each time I am just so happy with the experience. From the valet and bell people to the front desk..on to room service and back to the valet, I have never had such a wonderful consistent experience. the hotel is beautiful, in a great location and the restaurant next door is just terrific. I love this place...I travel a lot...been in a lot of wonderful hotels...but this one is truly a favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth is # 1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: karen c
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Commenwealth was excellent. The entire staff were friendly, courteous and very helpful. The room was clean and spacious. We had the breakfast included with the room which was a great addition to the hotel package. The hotel is situated in a beautiful safe area with easy access to the subway. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay At The Commonwealth Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindarachi
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the front door, our every need was met. That was surprising enough but the other observation that startled me was that every inch of the hotel common areas and our room was meticulously clean. I'm one of those people who inspects the bathroom first and when we arrived at our room, that was the first thing I did. Towels were plentiful and neatly folded. There was no film on the mirror over the vanity nor was there any in the sink or sink vanity. Everything gleamed. Then I checked out the area where the toilet was located. They typical rim of dirt that builds up after multiple washes with mops was non existent when I looked at the area where the tile meets the floor. Again, everything sparkled. Our beds, pillows and blankets were perfect and I awoke in the morning feeling well rested and very spry! All the furnishings were beautiful, in excellent condition and created an ambiance that made us feel as though we were welcome and resting in the lap of luxury. The only thing that was negative in any way was the pull out sofa. One of our party had to sleep on it and she was less than comfortable but that is often to be expected with a pull out. In general, our experience was exemplary. In fact, while I was there, I made another reservation to stay the night before Thanksgiving!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Commonwealth 4 nights. It was a wonderful hotel stay; we bought a Museum of Fine Arts package which included 2 tickets to the Boston Museum of Fine Arts and breakfast at Eastern Standard. Food is good at Eastern Standard and at the seafood restaurant. Both tend to be jammed in the evenings. We would defintely stay at Hotel Commonwealth again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Big Incidental Problem”
Reviews.Author: mcguirej6
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay at Hotel Commonwealth was pleasant. The staff at the front desk were very welcoming and friendly. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel itself was located in a safe and fun area. However, we asked the bellhops what our alternate options were in terms of parking other than the hotel's valet. He suggested, without hesitation or any further comment, to park on the metered street behind the hotel/valet parking lot - which we did. After checkout, we placed our belongings in the car and went to get lunch before the drive home. We returned to the car a few hours later. In broad daylight, we found the window of the car smashed, the doors unlocked and several items stolen from the car including a MacBook Air. When the police arrived they said that where we parked - the metered street behind the hotel - "gets hit all of the time". Hotel Commonwealth may not have been privy to this information, but hopefully they - and other potential Hotel Commonwealth guests - are now. And, Hotel Commonwealth now has the option to share this caveat with guests that have cars.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Julep111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I pick a city every November to visit where we have never been. This year it was Boston, Massachusettes. After careful consideration we decided to stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. The location is directly next to a T stop which was our transportation for the trip. We entertained guests at Eastern Standard, the hotel restaurant, which was a buzzing, delightful venue with wonderful cuisine. We had drinks twice at Island Creek Oyster Bar, which is the equally wonderful hotel restaurant offering up small plates and oyster sliders and great cocktails! On our last night there, even though both restaurants were full, they managed to get us in as we loved the food so much that we wanted to return. The rooms are large, comfortable and quiet and the staff is always smiling and courteous...no wonder, they are working at one of the best hotels in Boston! Other highlights were the bath products, Frette linens and a daily newspaper. While in Boston we walked the Freedom Trail, visited the Paul Revere House, the Kennedy Library, Harvard and Beacon Hill. We had cocktails at the Top of the Hub in the Prudential Building. That is a treat not to miss. Lobster rolls and clam chowder at Union Oyster House were crowning touches to a great trip to the wonderful city of Boston and a definite recommendation for the Hotel Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: Tina D
Reviews.Content: While visiting our daughter at BU, we wanted to stay within walking distance of the campus. From the moment we walked in, it was obvious this hotel was well maintained and the attention to detail was evident. The staff was so pleasant, courteous and welcoming. Our room was well beyond what we expected...spacious, spotless and tastefully decorated. I can't say enough how much we enjoyed our stay there. These days it's rare to receive such wonderful customer service. I'm glad to have the opportunity to share our experience. We definitely will stay again when we are in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Commonwealth!”
Reviews.Author: LEK248
Reviews.Content: I was in town for two days for work and was glad I chose to stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. The front desk staff was lovely and courteous and upgraded me to a suite because of availability. The accomodations were decorated beautifully, very comfortable, and most importantly clean! The guest valet parking was a little pricey at $42 per night but other than that, I have no complaints. If you have an opportunity, definitely eat at the Island Creek Oyster Bar. They have extremely delicious food. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wasakawaka
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and most importantly helpful. The room was very tidy and we had a great view of commonwealth Avenue! We had the suite which we upgraded to for a small fee. The room was one of the best I've been in and the bed was VERY comfortable, the only issues I have is that the bath was small and uncomfortable and there is no in room coffee maker but this is a small price to pay considering all the plusses. The location is very close to some shopping on Newbury and Boylston under some of the most beautiful and scenics streets I've ever been to. It's important to note here that the subway train is across the street so getting downtown is fairly easy. I have to say in closing that this place has going for it staff, comfort and location, in that order,

Reviews.Title: “the only place we'll stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Ahfahvoot
Reviews.Content: Loved our beautiful, clean suite, very comfortable bed, complimentary glass of champagne on arrival, excellent & friendly service, convenient location for us as we were visiting our son @ BU, right across street from T.....no complaints whatsoever!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carey M
Reviews.Content: Amazing experience starting when I first walked in, doormen politely opened the door, genuine smiles on their faces. Front desk clerk also very nice and pleasant. It is obvious these people enjoy working there! They got me into my room early, the room was gorgeous and spotless! Lovely bathroom soaps and shampoos, lush towels, awesome shower. Bed was extremely comfortable, lots of pillows, crisp white linens, warm comforter. My only frustration was there was not a coffeemaker in the room, so we had to go out in the morning to get coffee. We could have ordered coffee from room service, but it was a little pricey for us.

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else in Boston?”
Reviews.Author: mrcandoit
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is great! Having stayed in Boston numerous times (as well as NY, LA, San Francisco and Chicago), I can honestly say this hotel is fantastic! The service is uniformly attentive and friendly without being intrusive. Helpful? Check. Professional without being stuffy? Check. Prime location next to the T and with plenty of cabs? Check? Two rocking good restaurants attached to the restuarant? Check. Odd wakeup call request fulfilled? Check. Is this place inexpensive--no. Is it worth every penny you'll pay for it? Assuredly. I had a junior suite and it was outrageously large and comfortable. If I had known about this place before the Boston Marathon I would have booked it pronto. Book it and make your self happy.

Reviews.Title: “Boston trip to visit my BU student”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy F
Reviews.Content: My sister & I were visiting my daughter who is attending Boston University. Since Caitlin is a sophomore this year, I decided to try the Hotel Commonwealth as I have passed by many times in my previous visits to Boston and the BU campus which is adjacent to the Hotel Commonwealth. We experienced exceptional service all the way around the hotel service staff, especially at the check in desk. Jeff and Lucas were so helpful with all of our questions & requests for restaurant suggestions, tour advice, etc. The cost of the hotel was a little more than I am accostomed to paying when I stay in the downtown Boston area but we were pleasantly surprised with a large bright room and a very enjoyable stay. The location was perfect, my daughter's dorm is only a short walk from our hotel door which is so convenient. Thanks for a great weekend!!!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Sean S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently made our first trip to Boston. We looked at other hotels, but selected this one because of its #1 status on Tripadvisor. We are so glad we did...the hotel was beautiful. They offered us an upgrade to a suite with a room divider and extra TV for a small fee, so we took it. Definitely worth the extra couple bucks, my wife could sleep in and I could close the divider, turn on the TV and use the free high speed internet without bothering her!! Everyone from the doormen to the girl at the front desk to the cleaning staff were extremely friendly. We ate at both Eastern Standard and Island Creek and loved them both too. Best part of the hotel had to be having a "T" subway station under the hotel. When we come back to Boston...and we are definitely coming back...we would stay here in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hotel Commwealth”
Reviews.Author: Neal W
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Hotel Commwealth! We were upgraded to a great suite, room service was terrific, all the people were extremely courteous!!! They were so nice, and my wife said it was one of the best places she has ever stayed! HIghly recommmended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Jim_1300
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 15 customers on a Hockey trip. Rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. Service was substandard. 2 doormen stood and watched as as patrons struggled with luggage. Check in was slow but checkout was faster

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtfull Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Generalmanager501
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth last weekend as a getaway, an opportunity to experience the pleasures of Boston without any of the hassles. Our experience at the hotel was first rate in every way. Prior to our arrival we had made some inquiries regarding entertainment at the nearby House of Blues. The next thing you know the concierge from that facility was in contact with us to offer assistance. On arrival night we were able to call down and quickly get a seat at the very busy Eastern Standard downstairs, perfect. Our room was quiet as a vault with one of the most comfortable beds ever. Everyone we encountered from begining to end was eager to offer assistance in a genuine way. We appreciate that. We have stayed at many Hotels in Boston but can clearly see why this one is rated so well.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend at the Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: 41742Linda
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the the Hotel, its location, amenities and the wonderful staff we experienced this past weekend. The staff is very service oriented, so professional, efficient and most accommodating. Everything you need is right there and within walking distance. Eastern Standard and the Oyster bar (part of the hotel) are amazing. If you haven't stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth, check it out. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Boston”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to the Hotel Commonwealth for 3 nights in October after a similar stay in 2010. Both stays were wonderful. Over the last fifteen years, we have stayed in many of this country's top hotels. The Commonwealth is our favorite. Like any great hotel, the rooms are clean, comfortable, and stylish. Its location is prime with Fenway Park, Newberry Street, and Cornwall's nearby. Two of Boston's best restaurants and a T station are conveniently located within the building. These things justify the hotel's rating with the best, but the feature that sets the HC above the rest is its excellent staff. From arrival to departure each staff member we encountered gave us a smile, a greeting, and an offer of assistance. Samuel (the concierge with the non-stop smile) gave us some great recommendations. The management of the HC clearly possesses a talent for finding confident, competent, pleasant people, See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Qball1128
Reviews.Content: I love this classic hotel. Service, room decor including very comfortable beds and bedding, no noise, perfect location within easy reach of public transportation, and as a bonus, excellent restaurants all make this hotel the perfect destination in Boston. Have stayed her several times and always can count of a perfect stay! Again, the service really stands out here. I have walked by many hotels in Boston where the doormen are talking and laughing and people come and go and open doors themselves. This will not happen at the Hotel Commonwealth. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MrsJngs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while vacationing for 4 days. Beautiful hotel. Wonderful people. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Regular luxury getaway”
Reviews.Author: Dja D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the epitome of luxury boutiques. I've enjoyed many wonderful stays at HC, and in my opinion there is no better in Boston. The accomodations are incredibly comfortable and luxurious. The staff is absolutely wonderful, and the location is perfect ! The proximity/relationship the hotel has with the Eastern Standard restraunt next door, makes for fabulous cuisine in the restraunt OR in your beautiful room. Also, a relatively new seafood restraunt on the other side of the hotel called Oyster creek offers up quite a beautiful variety of classic and/or coveted unusual delicacies. I am a permanent fan , for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Jacquie R
Reviews.Content: We were staying in town for a show and wanted a hotel near the venue. Although the valet parking rate was ridiculous, it was quite nice to drive up to the front and just leave the car for the eve. Parking around Boston is a challenge.The staff was attentive and courteous both at the front door and the front desk. We were asked each time we left if we needed directions or suggestions which was nice. I'm not used to staying at better hotels so it was a treat having the doors opened for me. The room was very quiet and comfortable. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. The shower had the best water pressure of any hotel I've ever stayed at, which is great with long hair. We did have to call for a second terry robe. This request was filled promptly. Although there was a fridge in the room, you could not fit personal items in it. I carry insulin that requires refrigeration. The temperature control was great. I prefer a cool room and the control allows for air conditioning even in the fall. The location is great for Fenway, Lansdowne St., and BU access. The T is right there which can get you anywhere else in Boston or Cambridge. I did miss having complimentary coffee or tea in the room in the morning. Overall I loved my stay here and although a little pricey for my budget I would still stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to be if stuck inside”
Reviews.Author: Dilweg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HC for FSU v. Boston College game Nov 3. Went up for game and ended up with gout and couldn't leave hotel, luckily the hotel is great. Staff upgraded us to executive suite for $50 more per night. Great room, bed and separated sitting area with french doors. Overlooked Kenmore Square on one side and Fenway Park on other. Great Bed and furniture in room. 2 great restaurants attached and reasonably priced room service. Nice front staff and housekeeping also. T station at hotel so $2 for ride to anywhere. A little pricey, but most hotels are in Boston, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and classy”
Reviews.Author: kwibblesny
Reviews.Content: This has been our home away from home when we visit Boston University. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the hotel itself is small enough with just the right amount of charm to make you feel like you're really on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth-anything but Common”
Reviews.Author: workinggirl2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice and love it. Perfect location if want to be near BU, Fenway. Easy walk to. Back Bay/Newbury Street. Watch out for Head of the Charles/Northeastern/BU parent weekend in October. Prices considerably higher,difficult to get restaurant reservations, but concierge worked it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Impression of Boston Amenities”
Reviews.Author: DetroitStar48226
Reviews.Content: When I first went to Boston, this was my first hotel experience. It was certainly wonderful. The hotel itself is beautiful and our room was top-notch to view. The bed's mattress was obviously a little dated and affected our ability to have an entire night of good slumber. But aside from the uncomfortable mattress, the entire bedroom and bathroom was gorgeous and a treat to enjoy. The restaurant for breakfast was also wonderful. We had a very tasty breakfast. Now about those parking rates.......... :o

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mercerjd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Commonwealth for a few days leading up to the Memorial Day weekend in 2011. Prior to our arrival a reservation agent, Emily Cormier, was kind enough to e-mail a map of the subway system for our convenience. Upon our arrival, we had an excellent experience with the hotel staff. We arrived around 11pm and were promptly greeted and offered bottled water. We stayed in a deluxe queen room with a Fenway Park view. The room was clean and very spacious. There was free high speed internet which definitely was a bonus. The bathroom was well apportioned. The location of the hotel is ideal. You're within walking distance of Fenway Park, Prudential Center, and other sites. Plus, Kenmore station is adjacent to the hotel which is very convenient for traveling throughout Boston. The hotel restaurants were fabulous. The Eastern Standard's breakfast is a good option. Also, you want to have at least one meal at the Island Creek Oyster Bar. The service there was first rate. Hotel Commonwealth is a great option if you are visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yogibe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times and am always amazed at how in sync the entire staff is towards delivering excellent customer service. It's impressive. The hotel itself is in a great location. The rooms are spacious and clean. The internet is high speed and free. The urban location is fun. An overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: rustycycle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth on two occassions during our recent travels around New England. The Hotel is located in the Back Bay area of Boston some 3km from the downtown area of the CBD. This was a good choice as driving in and out of the area is much easier than the downtown area and it is close to the main InterstateTurnpikes and rail stations. The hotel itself is located right above a tube station. It is an esay 5 min walk to hip Newbury St with all its cafes & restaurants. We upgraded to a deluxe room which was quite large and had all the mod cons etc. Maybe a little pricey, but well worth the extra coin. The staff were super friendly and helpful and they arranged bookings etc for us. A well recommended place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: RetiredAnLovingIt
Reviews.Content: Nice place, great location, very good service. There are other nice hotels in Boston, this one has class, heritage, reasonable rates. But #1, it is located where I want to be when visiting Boston. And I love Little Steve's Pizza on Boylston.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth K
Reviews.Content: I am always looking forward to my Boston visit because I know I have a place to stay which is like my home away from home. All the staff really make each experience an excellent one. anything you ask them, you know it will be delivered. they always go beyond the 200%.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MalDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while doing a course in Boston university. I was upgraded to a larger room - although colleagues standard rooms were generously sized also. They all seem to have a bedroom and sitting room which are seperated by a curtain. All the staff were very helpdul and courteous. The attached restaurants were both very good. The T line is next door also. The rooms are well insulated from street noise but the walls betweens rooms are surprisingly thin for such a good hotel, so you can hear the odd cough and showers being turned on and off - not a big deal really. Overall - I would highly recommend this hotel and vertainly stay there again if visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star all the way”
Reviews.Author: Commadore
Reviews.Content: The quality of the hotel was excellent. Not a single service person who was not helpful and friendly. So little to say about it because it was as expected a very high quality hotel where everything was perfect, Spacious well appointed room with attractive public areas. We would recommend it without qualification.

Reviews.Title: “Happy travels”
Reviews.Author: smoothride_11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from visiting our daughter at BU and had the good fortune to stay at the Commonwealth. It was our second stay there, and my husband and I have agreed that we need look no further for accommodation while in Boston. Beautiful rooms, friendly and helpful staff, good restaurants and the best hotel soap and moisturizer we have ever been comped with.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning !”
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay and not our last. Great location next to the T and rooms were comfortable,quiet and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: SoloTravels1234
Reviews.Content: Open the thesuarus and pull out the superlatives: that is the only way to describe Hotel Commonwealth. As a single traveller and returning guest in what is a busy hotel, I was delighted to be welcomed and remembered (seriously) by some staff members, who could just as easily have been "too busy" with the chaos of parents' weekend and Head of the Charles. Special cheers to Samuel, the hotel concierge, who was a miracle worker, not only arranging dinner reservation, but graciously helping us tweek things a bit at the last minute 2 nights in row. I'm not sure who was more impressed: me or my son & his roommates. Truly, from the welcoming doorman and valet staff to the front desk, from Eastern Standard breakfast room service to the sparkling care given to every element in the room, Hotel Commonwealth is simply the best. Yes, the facility sparkles, but that sparkle would not exist without the best staff at the helm. Cheers to the people who make the Hotel Commonwealth the best!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: denise r
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Boston for over 3 years now while our son attends BU. We ALWAYS try to stay at the Commonwealth. Nothing else nearby compares. We have had to stay elsewhere a couple of times and are always disappointed because everything about the Commonwealth is outstanding. We are so comfortable there, it is our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable Service”
Reviews.Author: luvfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: What other hotel will e-mail you 2-weeks in advance to tell you that the city will be packed and offer to make dinner reservations for you? What other hotel has a teddy bear of a doorman named Nick, who will see your luggage in the hall while you are in the business center and offer to store it, or bring it to the curb and hail you a cab? What other hotel, despite being packed and out of rollaway beds due to parents' weekend at the local colleges, will send up extra blankets and pillows so your daughter can spend the night on the floor in your room with you? Only the Hotel Commonwealth. I love staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Speachless! Business or Family”
Reviews.Author: GerardBraun
Reviews.Content: I stay at a hotel almost weekly for business and also on a regular basis for family trips throughout the county. The Commonwealth hotel has to be one of my top 3 picks if not my top pick. The service is unmatchable; the friendly staff is always a pleasure the rooms are beautiful, extremely well kept and comfortable. The best part is that all this never changes. The experience has been the same from my first stay a year ago to my most recent stay last week. The times I have taken my family the staff has given extra attention to my 5 and 7 year old by remembering their names throughout the stay. I could go on and on but you need to go experience this one of a kind hotel yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: Sara T
Reviews.Content: The staff was very attentive, providing a wonderful weekend experience for our anniversary. The room was very spacious with the most heavenly bed and pillows. It is certainly one of the best hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “More expensive than most, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Anthony316
Reviews.Content: Very, very nice hotel. It is a luxury hotel but only three stories high. Two good restaurants attached, and the subway stop is right outside the front door so very well serviced by public transport. Fenway Park is just across the road which is good if you want to visit it for a game or a tour. You can walk in to the Boston common in about 30-40 minutes, and this is a good thing to do at least once coz there's a few things along the way to look at (e.g. The library, or the shops along Newbury street) Bagel shop across the road is a good budget option for breakfast each morning.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terrence C
Reviews.Content: This the best hotel I have stayed in. The room was spacious, nicely laid out with a pleasant unforeced atmosphere. The hotel in general had a lovely atmosphere, neither pretentious nor spartan, very balanced and pleasing in every way. It is much better than places like the Mariott that have a pretentious internal look, but the rooms are very plain and not inviting. All of the staff, from doorman to desk help were genuinely helpful without the forced, from-the-director-scripted line of "how are we doing at the Sheraton" crap that really annoys me. I have stayed at conferences all over the country in different chain hotels and none come close the pleasant stay my wife and I enjoyed at the Commonweath.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for college visits”
Reviews.Author: RalphLSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally situated for visiting colleges in Boston. Our room was tastefully decorated and the beds were comfortable. The staff was very helpful in getting us tickets to the Bruins game and helping us find our way around. If you can avoid driving you will save yourself $42 per day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaLL
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Commonwealth for a business trip. The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful and accommodating. The room I was provided for the night was definitely the most luxurious room, outside of European castle stays, that I have ever personally enjoyed! The area is lovely and close to so many great things to do. The hotel also connects to a fabulous restaurant that I would visit even if I wasn't staying there. I don't know if I could ever enjoy staying anywhere else in Boston again after staying at Hotel Commonwealth. It was made my business trip a dream!

Reviews.Title: “Too short a stay!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia G
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in the hotel, and my biggest regret is that it was a business trip that allowed me to be there only one night. The jr suite was fantastic, the bed and linens and robe extremely comfortable, and the room was probably the cleanest hotel room I've been in in years. The staff, as other reviewers have said, is friendly and professional, and I couldn't have asked for more. When I go back to Boston I intend to stay there again; it will be my first choice. I did not get to eat dinner in the hotel restaurants, but one of my business colleagues who lives in Boston said that they are excellent spots. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable experience!”
Reviews.Author: jmtavares
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over a weekend. The staff is very professional and welcoming and very attentive to details. They even communicated that it was our anniversary to their on-premises restaurant. Nice touch. The room had a great view of Kenmore Square and the bed and pillows were heavenly. We were in a Jr. Suite and the bathroom is fantastic with a large walk-in rain shower and huge Jacuzzi tub. You are within taxi or public transportation distance of al that is worthwhile seeing in Boston. It's a gem in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: tvlworld
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth is one of the better hotels in Boston in terms of comfort and style, but what makes it the place to stay is the service and location. Right under the lights of Fenway, a short walk to many of the colleges near here, or Newbury Street and Boylston for shopping, this location provides a great central point to visit Boston. Additionally, the T stop is right outside the door, to open up the rest of the city. From the moment you walk in the front door, you are treated to an excellent standard of service. The entire staff is friendly, not overbearing, and happy to help out with any small thing.They thought of everything. Umbrellas in the room, good hairdryers, make up mirrors, the junior suites have 2TVs for easy viewing, and either side of the hotel provides an interesting view. The Fenway view is for sports fans, and the front offers a look over busy Commonwealth Ave. No crappy self made coffee. Room service brings real coffee, real cream, on time with a friendly smile. Eastern Standard is an excellent restaurant as well, that offers a comfortable atmosphere, with upscale food. The bartenders know their stuff. I am a repeat guest and will continue to recommend them..

Reviews.Title: “Luxury without flash”
Reviews.Author: DontGatherMoss
Reviews.Content: This hotel has accounted for all of the details of comfort without being ostentatious. Everything from the service to the linens is excellent. The restaurant (Eastern Standard) is one of the best in Boston as well. My only complaint is the alarm clocks. If figuring out how to set the alarm doesn't keep you up late, the beaming clock face certainly will. My message to Commonwealth: change the clocks and you will achieve hotel nirvana.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Sanditravels13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at in Boston. Great location (walking distance) to Fenway Park. Room service was excellent and the doormen and bell service were extremely helpful. I was trveling with a 93 year old WW2 veteran and they assisted with every door, taxi loading and unloading and information about the city.

Reviews.Title: “THe best!”
Reviews.Author: GraftonLaurie
Reviews.Content: From the doorman's greeting to the desk service to the room it just doesn't get better in Boston. I have stayed at many hotels and never enjoyed them as much as this one. I had screwed up my reservation and the desk supervisor got me a room elsewhere for one night. When I returned he sent up truffles, 2 splits of wine, cheese, bread and other munchies with a hand signed note from everyone out front that he hoped our transition back to their hotel went smoothly. And this is when I screwed up. Hotel Commonwealth is all about service and quality in every way. I hesitated to even write a review in case everyone starts staying here and makes my getting a room that much more challenging. The hotel is also quiet, close to the MFA and Isabella Gardener, a short walk to Newbury Street or the Symphony and has two of the best restaurants attached to its building. You just can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Eileen S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth helped us relax and unwind after at the end of our busy days. Every member of the staff was warm, friendly and sincere. Upon arrival, we were assisted immediately. The car and bags were taken care of for us, so we could proceed to check in. I had a junior suite. The room was quiet, comfortable and elegant, matching the overall feel of the hotel. They truly pay attention to detail and it shows. Whenever I walked through the lobby, I was greeted by a member of the staff. Breakfast at the Eastern Standard was a great way to start the day. We dropped by for drinks one night and it was lively scene. There was a wide range of standard and exotic cocktails. I can personally recommend the Lemon Fizz. I will be staying at the Commonwealth whenever I visit Boston in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Home run in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: abszoo
Reviews.Content: Accomodations were comfortable, quiet and aesthetic. Location superb (Kenmore T station across the street). One of the best Oyster bars in the city on the property. Service from concierge to housekeeping to front desk was responsive and warm. I hope our daughter chooses a college in Boston and we have the opportunity to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahut
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Commonwealth in mid-October. We checked in late and initially we were given the handicap room. We weren't happy with that bathroom (I like a tub) so we asked for a new room and they upgraded us to a junior suite. The staff is superb. The Eastern Standard restaurant that is attached is divine. Loved the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Best”
Reviews.Author: Donna A
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Commonwealth in Boston. The room was clean and SO quiet while facing Commonwealth Ave. The staff were friendly and so helpful with directions, restaurant suggetions and room service. Will definitely return there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Everyway with the Exception of Checkout”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel12453
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for the money. The location is great and the rooms are well appointed and comfortable and very spacious. The check-in experience was exceptional--we (two couples traveling together) were offered room upgrades (suites) for an additional $20/per room and complimentary champagne upon arrival. Staff are extremely (perhaps a little over the top) friendly and very accomodating. The only disappointment was at checkout--I instructed the clerk to charge both rooms to one credit card, but unfortunately our traveling companions were charged separately for her room. This was a simple request that should have been honored.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Luxury”
Reviews.Author: kwill4u
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth is a very nice place.The location is within minutes from everything to do in Boston.This is a full service hotel with all the amenities.The rooms were large with plenty of room for relaxing on the couch and chairs to the writers desk and spacious bathroom.The beds were awesome and the pillows were exceptionally soft.I didn't want to leave the comfortable bed and soft pillows after sleeping like a baby all night.My wife and I enjoyed our stay and had a great time in Boston.The Hotel Commonwealth is Boston luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Ask For More”
Reviews.Author: Dudley G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the commonwealth on my recent trip to Boston and although it was a bit more then I wanted to spend it was worth the extra money. The staff was incredibly helpful at all times and you never felt like you were bothering anyone no matter how many questions we might have asked. the rooms were clean, decent size, and very comfortable. Would certainly stay here again. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved our room and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: I took a chance of booking a hotel without consulting my wife because it was a surprise anniversary trip and I really lucked out with this hotel. The location worked out great, we're able to walk down Comm Ave from the hotel to the Common and what a beautiful 2 days we had. Easy access to the T as well. The staff was very courteous, the room was very clean and seemed brand new as if never used before and the hotel in general is one of the nicest I've ever stayed in Boston. The restaurant and bar is really great as well. I can't say enough about this place, I highly recommend it. I guess the only bad thing was the $40+ fee for parking the car but I guess that goes with the territory of city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: sweil83401
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times visiting our daughter at BU, The location is great, the staff is vey helpful, and rooms are very comfortable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Commonwealth does it right!”
Reviews.Author: JBJones10
Reviews.Content: I had a great long weekend stay at Hotel Commonwealth! The staff - from the gentlemen opening the door for me, to the individuals at the front desk, and the people cleaning the rooms each morning - all had smiles on their faces and greeted me each and every time I was around. The location is GREAT! Easy access to head out of the city and also to go right into downtown - The T is right across the street! Restaurant connected to the hotel as well - delicious breakfast! Wonderful experience at a smaller, luxury hotel with detailed and personal attention from every aspect of the staff. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: chillystella
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great location, fine restaurant, amazing room. Probably the best in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Uncommon luxury at the Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: BagsarepackedDallas
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth is an oasis of calm in busy Boston, located in between Fenway Park and Boston University with access to both the T and bus lines right outside the front door. The front desk and staff are always ready to help with any question. One afternoon we had to wait to get our room made up, so the front desk sent up homemade truffles and bottled spring water for our "inconvenience." Safety is a key concern; you have to put your room key into the keypad in the elevator in order to access any floor above the lobby. The rooms are clean and spacious, the beds and multiple pillows are very comfortable. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service par excellance!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler50_11
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay one night stay at this hotel. when I arrived, I was surprisingly upgraded to a suite. Beyond the luxury accommodations and very clean surroundings was the outstanding customer service. From the front desk professionals to the fabulous doorman- I wanted for nothing! Lots of different dining options within steps of the hotel. I would not hesitate to stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: vito711
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we come to Boston which happens to be about six times a year since or daughter goes to BU. The employees are wonderful. The rooms are beautiful. I look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ramapo College Visual Artists Society loves Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Laura V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. Our group of 17 people was accommodated without any problems. We even had access to all 5 of our rooms before check-in. Every employee, from the valet drivers to the concierge to the cleaning staff is very friendly. The concierge is knowledgable of the area and guided us through every step of our stay with a smile. We stayed in queen double rooms which were surprisingly spacious. More important than space, in my opinion, is how clean the room was. The location of the hotel is superb. Access to the Green T line is maybe 20 steps from the hotel which is incredibly convenient. Our group walked from the hotel to Faneuil Hall with ease. I will definitely stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: 33Beverly11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is accommodating from the time of reservation to check out. Helpful on the phone, check in is pleasant, the room--perfect!! Everyone from the front door staff to someone you run into in the hallway--perfectly professional and friendly. Tried to meet all our needs even when busy with others. The only issue might be the cost of rooms--some times it's pretty steep!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long trip to boston. Hotel Commowealth is a good place to stay while on a family vacation. The subway entrence couldn't have been any closer to the building. This really helped us for getting around. We had a few issues before we ever left but the hotel got these sorted our and our stay was nice. The mattresses could be nicer but then again it is a hotel. The staff are great for helping with plans and rental cars.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth, My HOME away from Home.”
Reviews.Author: Jane G
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth is my home away from home. I stay there around 20 nights a year. The staff is professional, gracious and personable. They anticipate your needs. And the restuarants are fantastic, Eastern Standard and Island Creek. Again the staff in the restaurants are superb.
