The Junior suite is worth the minimal upcharge to have the mid room curtain to block off the sitting area/desk. Gives it a 2 room feel, work area and sleep area. Also blocks the window sunlight. Great access to all of Boston with the T right there, as well as one of the Hubway bike racks. Walk along the Charles River or up to Newbury Street for shops and restaurants. My favorite city hotel in the world. The Fresh toiletries are my favorite in any hotel, and now they sell the bath size.

Reviews.Title: “BU Hockey and more”
Reviews.Author: Bfyler
Reviews.Content: Was a guest on Oct. 8th and I can not say enough about the class of this organization. Was greeted with a smile and was in my room very quickly. The room was great very luxurious. When I checked in I had mentioned that I was taking my son to the BU Hockey game and then took my son and wife out for dinner. Upon our return there was a tray of fruit and sping water waiting for us with a personalized note. This was very classy and much appreciated. I then took my son to the Hockey game and my wife was able to relax. This whole experience was just great. If you are able to go to the restaurant that is attached you will be pleasantly surprised.. Enjoy we did !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean rooms at affordable prices.”
Reviews.Author: lanalogue
Reviews.Content: I love staying here on business trips. The rooms are very nice, clean and new. The staff is attentive and accomadating.

Reviews.Title: “A Job Well Done”
Reviews.Author: Dom P
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth staff are extremely attentive and professional. The hotel decor is best described as an understated elegance. I would definitely stay there again on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: robert a
Reviews.Content: We travel to boston often and this hotel is perfect.It is the" just right " size with all of the great service anyone would want.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gsol
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston often and had yet to find a relatively affordable and yet modern and well run hotel with a reputable restaurant. This hotel has everything starting with fantastic service. I arrived a little early and the front desk offered an upgrade to a Jr. suite for only $20. The room was absolutely five stars. The restaurant, the Island Creek Oyster Bar, is superb and the bar well above average. The only slight problem is its location, very close to Boston University and Fenway Park but not to the financial downtown. However, public transportation, buses and the T are nearby. While in Boston, I will stay nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tubeaudiofan
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Commonwealth were extremely helpful and accommodating. I had a variety of 'special requests' they handled with pleasure. They made every effort to ensure that we had a great experience. The hotel is quiet, perfectly located for business in Boston, and is a lively area that is a mix of university students and faculty, young professionals, and old Boston. The Island Creek Oyster bar is a wonderful addition, with awesome food, and very friendly, attentive, but unobtrusive, staff. I enjoyed my dinner there so much, I returned for lunch! Unfortunately I didn't have a chance to try the Eastern Standard, but the menu and the restaurant both looked very good. I look forward to returning to the Commonwealth on my next journey to the Boston area. I have found my hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Our "go to" hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Carol M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel a lot and this hotel is a gem. The rooms were clean, bed was comfortable there were high quality bedding, towels and toiletries. The service was wonderful. What a pleasure!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: eidtp
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, lovely rooms, good service, great location. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LLTraveler7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Commonwealth several times for business and family trips, and it is always a pleasure. The hotel has great amenities -- a wonderful restaurant right next store, a nice gym, large rooms that are modern and immaculate and luxurious.The rooms have the kind of detailing that one finds at a Four Seasons or Ritz -- beautiful bedding, fine toiletries, excellent wine in the minibar. The location is perfect -- right near Fenway, a very short walk to Newbery Street, and across the street from the Kenmore T station. The staff is extraordinarily customer oriented, from the management to the bellman. On a recent stay, I had to catch a train on a Sunday morning, and assumed I would be able to get a taxi at the last minute. I didn't know that there was a bike race that morning that had shut down traffic and rerouted all taxis. The young bellman took my luggage and led me down the street to a an intersection several blocks away. With a calm and friendly manner, he found me a taxi against all odds, preventing me from missing my train. I stay at many top hotels around the country, and I found this level of service to be fairly extraordinary. The rates are lower than the "name brand" top hotels, and while it is not cheap by any means, I would say it is a good value for the level of service and high-quality, spacious rooms. The lobby is not a bustling big-hotel lobby, but it is very elegant and beautiful and filled with light. The concierge is knowledgable and accessible, and the staff is extremely friendly and ready to make extra efforts to help guests make the most of their stay. This hotel is a lovely home away from home in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service.”
Reviews.Author: Laurie083
Reviews.Content: Beautiful,clean,upgraded our room without extra charge,wonderful restaurant adjoining,ideal location for Boston College or Boston University visit.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LesliePerkins
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasant experience, the rooms are quiet and comfortable. Only wish I could have opened the window, I like fresh air at night. The staff is attentive to every need. the restaurant is one of the best in Boston. The Raw Bar serves the best and freshest oysters, about 10-15 different kinds. I will go out of my way to stay here when in Boston, every time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth - Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobalHealthMan
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hotel Commonwealth almost during every visit to Boston. It has wonderful amenities such as workout room and free internet. The restaurants on both sides are fantastic and it is perfectly located for the many meetings in Boston. The service and attention from the staff is second to none. A must stay place in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: RobinHSW
Reviews.Content: Sometimes, when booking a hotel, it's uncertain if the reviews are truly what they seem. Our stay at the Hotel Commonwealth was terrific. We were in Boston looking at colleges, so the location was perfect- walking distance to BU & Northeastern, and on top of the T station. Our room overlooked the back of the Green Monster at Fenway- that was a total surprise, and although backing onto a highway, was totally quiet- no street noise at all. It was very large, with a huge double sided desk and lots of outlets and charging stations. The beds were very comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was better than I've ever experienced! The staff was incredibly helpful- from the doormen to the front desk staff to housekeeping. Our only complaint was the size of the fitness center- they could use a true elliptical machine and put TVs on all the equipment. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit!”
Reviews.Author: ChiTraveler1965
Reviews.Content: From the moment a staff member opened the door to my cab, I was treated like a valued guest. Staff at the front desk were gracious, helpful, and kind. The complimentary turn down service was welcomed pampering. The bed was very comfortable, and the restaurant had great food--although the portions were much too large, because I had no way to store and use the leftovers! I am really looking forward to returning to the Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ElsaGrow
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel this week and wanted to note how extremely great it was. Checking in was easy and everyone was extremely helpful and courteous. The room was immaculate and very luxurious-such a wonderful place to stay I was bummed I only got to stay one night! We did eat at the restaurant-ES- and it was pretty good; great service and delish menu items. Thank you to the wonderful hotel staff for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Boston Univ, Fenway, and great T access”
Reviews.Author: GoHawks5
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a fall weekend - no Red Sox, no BU events, hotel was quiet. Excellent staff, room overlooked Fenway, very large with very modern amenities. Internet, TV, Ipod clock radio were all up to speed. Our rate was an excellent value, although when we've looked before it was much more expensive. Small fitness center, but updated equipment. T stop is literally next door.

Reviews.Title: “Dan Bahr Head Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Beth D
Reviews.Content: You definitely have the right person in the position of Head Conciege at your top rated hotel. Dan Bahr made a friend's stay a most memorable one on September 17, 2011. From the Happy Anniversary wishes at the front desk, to special treats when they entered their room my friends had a wonderful time due to the attention Dan paid to their stay. They loved the room and everything about the hotel! Kudos to Dan and the staff at Hotel Commonwealth. I know I will be staying with you when visiting Boston. Beth DeVivo

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, luxurious hotel - but it is the exceptionally pleasant, professional, courteous and helpful staff that puts it over the top. I would also like to mention that I am very sensitive to odors, and this place smells great! I detected NO odors in our room, and the pleasant aroma of white tea and thyme wafts subtly through the lobby - where we throughly enjoyed complementary glasses of champagne in the evening. We were so comfortable and pleased with our experience here, we will switch from the Taj as our new "home away from home" in Boston. Bonus feature: Island Creek Oyster Bar, adjacent to the hotel, is outstanding for dinner or brunch. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway in the middle of the action!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaHamilton5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both work in hotels in the Boston area and were pleasantly surprised by the level of service and the ambiance of the Hotel Commonwealth! We had a couple of noise issues that were IMMEDIATELY resolved upon calling the front desk; Ryan also apologized and offered us complimentary breakfast at Eastern Standard (great restaurant located in the same building) and gave us a later checkout time so we could sleep in a little longer! This was definitely a very generous way to make up for the disturbance. We live in Cambridge (about 10 minutes from the hotel) and are definitely looking forward to staying here again in the future for a night away! The location is great and the rooms are wonderfully spacious, and that's not just by city standards!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous service!”
Reviews.Author: KatieAze
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night. I surprised my husband with a night out (without our 22-week old baby) for some husband/wife time. When I booked the room, the conceirge offered to make our dinner reservation, too. Very nice. Also, and more impressively, when we returned from dinner there were two bottles of wine and 6 gourmet cupcakes with a Happy Birthday card waiting in our room! I had told the front desk it was my husband's bday when I booked the reservation and they obviously took note. Finally, I am a nursing mother of a 22-week old and had to pump during my stay (so romantic I know). There was a mini bar with a sign reading "do not store personal items in fridge" so I had nowhere to store my milk. I called the front desk and they brought me up a separate mini fridge. I thought that was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Jill W
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was extremely courteous, pleasant and helpful. The hotel is very well taken care of and the baseball suite was outstanding. First time in Boston and would only stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. I believe it was the nicest hotel we've stayed in and the staff took care of us as if we were family. Excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Boston at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: TamiEI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had occasion to be in Boston overnight. In the past we had always stayed at the Hotel Elliot, but for a multitude of reasons we were not terribly impressed on our last stay and decided to look for a new hotel. The moment we arrived at the Hotel Commonwealth and were greeted by the valet, we knew this stay would be much better. The service was second to none! Everyone was wonderfully cheerful and helpful. The restaurants were open late into the evening, and the food was fabulous! The accommodations were comfortable and the decor was absolutely beautiful! We now have a new home base when we return to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Melissa P
Reviews.Content: The room was great and the staff was professional and friendly - everyone from the doormen to the front desk. I had a great time. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: wildzeb46
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable, and the staff was amazing - attentive to our every need. We were celebrating our anniversary, and the staff made sure we had a wonderful stay. Coming back after a day touring the city was just like coming home. We recommend the hotel and will definitely return for another stay whenever we come back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Charmeth214
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, everyone was extremely helpful. Would highly recommend the hotel and will definitely stay there any time I come to Boston

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels I have ever stayed at and the best in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: cwkesq
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. Everythig was perfect. Staff is super friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel if you are going to a Red Sox game”
Reviews.Author: lovecabo079
Reviews.Content: We have been going to this hotel for years with our three children whenever we go to back to back Red Sox games. We live in New England and could easily drive home, but this is far more convenient. We walk to Fenway, two blocks. It is so clean and modern. The service is phenomenal! When we go there we get the Fenway Room which gives you a great view of the Green Monster. They have a plate of cookies and milk waiting for my kids. My kids look forward to this every year. If you do not have children who are staying there, it is quite a nice getaway. It is such a quiet hotel. Conveniently located. Fantastic restaurant!!! Fantastic service.

Reviews.Title: “Red Sox Weekend”
Reviews.Author: snowsy
Reviews.Content: A pleasurable experience. Staff was great very helpful, especially the front desk wiht info and discount coupons.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth, Comfortable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: dorothyadele
Reviews.Content: When I return to Hotel Commonwealth in Boston, it is like going home. Hotel Commonweath is located at 500 Commonwealth Avenue in Boston. It is a small-luxury hotel. When you exit your cab at Hotel Commonwealth, conscientious doormen greet you. We visit often, and some of the doormen greet us by name. It is a special feeling. As you enter the hotel, you are struck by the rich reddish-gold carpeting with gold, blue, green and rose colored-mosaic patterns. As you ascend the staircase, you arrive in an elegant lobby. I love enjoying my coffee and reading the paper in the lobby, during the morning, and watching people. The rooms have views of Commonwealth Avenue or Fenway Park. You can see the â€œGreen Monsterâ€� at Fenway Park from the Fenway rooms. From the Commonwealth rooms, you can watch the cars and pedestrians on Commonwealth Avenue. Comfortable beds with light-weight-down comforters and four medium-firm pillows furnish the rooms. I usually don't sleep well in hotel beds, but I sleep great here. The amenities in the bathroom include lemon-scented-soy shampoo, shower gel and body lotion from Fresh. They also offer pomegranate hair conditioner. The hotel has two popular restaurants. Eastern Standard and Island Creek Oyster Bar. At Eastern Standard, you can dine on the patio or in the restaurant. If you choose outdoor dining, you can enjoy people watching on Commonwealth Avenue. If there is a Boston Red Sox game, baseball fans pack the bar and restaurant. One of my favorite appetizers is the steamed mussels prepared with white wine, tomatoes and fennel. It is served with crunchy bread for dipping. I also love their clear chocolate martinis. One of the bartenders gave me the recipe. If you want it, let me know. Island Creek Oyster Bar is new, but it is known for delicious, fresh seafood. They rely on local farmers and advertise that they use the freshest ingredients. They have a great reputation. My family visits Boston often, and we stay at Hotel Commonwealth. My daughter played lacrosse at Boston University and we would come to watch her fall and spring lacrosse games. Now, I visit whenever I can. I canâ€™t think of another hotel where I would feel as comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: martygSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on business for two nights. All the arrangements were made by my hosts in Boston. It was a surpise and a thrill to arrive at this hotel. Real "Olde Worldy" Boston style. Although I am into minimalist decor generally, somehow the opulence of the rooms seemed to suit the location and architecture. The room I had (I think it was a Jr Suite) was spacious and had good amenities. There were two downsides: 1. The minibar fridge....there were stickers on it saying that if you removed anything from it (e.g. to keep something of your own cold) that you would be charged instantly by some electronic detector. Real big brother stuff. 2. Internet access (free) is painfully slow. Not worth docking a star for these. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly, as good as you will get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Debbie P
Reviews.Content: For your reading ease, a list of what to love about this place: - Elegant & well appointed rooms. Clean and gorgeous. - Old world charm - As comfortable as home - REALLY...Outstanding. - Attentive, pleasant, courteous and professional staff - Incredible dining - 2 highly rated restaurants adjacent to hotel - Many more dining options a short distance away - Easy Transportation - Valet and Taxi stop at the front door - Located where the action is - downtown, hopping with activity! Love this place, and found my home away from home for Boston trips.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous spacious room, quiet yet right in the center of Kenmore square where all the action is!”
Reviews.Author: Bhp3128
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Boston for a red sox game and chose the Commonwealth because of the location ( walking distance to Fenway). We were a little hesitant to book it because the price was a little high, but we did get a aaa discount. The service from the valet to the front desk was above par! Everyone was friendly and eager to help. We got back from the game at 1 am and the front desk people were still very friendly! The room was huge, so many windows. It had a modern look yet old charm too. The bedspread was a down comforter and so comfy and the toiletries are high quality too for people who like to use those! Very pleased all in all!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: gadduke
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Hotel Commonwealth while attending a convention and I was lucky enough to get to tag along. This Hotel is right in the heart of Fenway with the ball park directly behind it. There is plenty of nightlife and restaurants in the area but the restaurant in the hotel is pretty good as well. I had breakfast there every morning. The only negative that I encountered was on our last day me and my wife had breakfast at the restaurant and the waitress sort of flaked out and left us hanging for a very long time. I had to grab another waitress and ask her for the bill and when we passed the waitress that was serving us she didn't even acknowledge that we were leaving. The other waitresses however were great, very responsive and provide great services. The Hotel itself is kept up immaculately...The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful like you normally would expect at a 5 star hotel. I'd definitely would come back again if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: DDonSco
Reviews.Content: We were on a holiday from Scotland and spent 8 nights at the Commonwealth. Staff were excellent and the rates competitive (we upgraded on arrival to a mini-suite). Room was very comfortable bed, bed linen, bathroom and toiletries, TVs all high quality. Clean and quiet. From our perpective perfectly placed for public transport. We walk a lot and so 15 to 30 minutes got us to lots of places with good shops and entertainments. Concierge very friendly and helpful. We felt welcome. And Boston was wonderful as ever.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely rewarding experience”
Reviews.Author: stork35
Reviews.Content: Simply an eleven out of ten! Great Hotel with well trained staff.

Reviews.Title: “College Visit Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: opportunity1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth was perfect - great location (Kenmore stop of the "T", excellent service, immaculately clean, spacious room - we definitely will stay here again and recommend it to our friends. We stayed in a Suite. As an aside, they supply the "Fresh" product line of bath toiletries, complimentary. (if you are not familiar with this very pricey line - the products can be purchased at Neiman Marcus).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Level of Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: BostonBoater
Reviews.Content: Although my stay was business related and short, the level of service from the staff at the Commonwealth Hotel was exceptional. Everyone from the valet to the front desk was courteous and very accommodating and I look forward to another trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: swedishgeek
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel! The rooms are very nice and as an experience it's very satisfying overall. The staff is friendly and helpful. I liked the fresh brand soap and shampoo; it's a sign of caring for quality. Beds are comfy if now overly so. What keeps it from a five: Far from central Boston. Very noisy fan (or something) in the hallway. I actually had to sleep with earplugs on.

Reviews.Title: “Always Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: Baseballfan1020
Reviews.Content: This was the third time staying at the Hotel Commonwealth. We have yet to be disappointed! Rooms are meticulously decorated and clean. Service is outstanding. Love being welcomed by name upon returning to hotel after day at Red Sox game. Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Boston Red Sox fans ONLY place to stay!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SHARON B
Reviews.Content: I sent my husband and his brother, a lifelong Red Sox fan, to the Hotel Commonwealth for a weekend trip to FINALLY see the "The Green Monster" live. EVERYONE from the booking agent to the conceirge to the front desk workers made the boys feel welcome. Their room looked out on Fenway park and the personal touches of notes and refreshments made them feel like true MVP's! Thanks to the staff for making a memory for our family!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmhelle
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel commonwealth over the weekend and loved it! yes it is a bit pricey what you really get what you pay for! the staff was very helpful and friendly, the hotel was SO clean and wel kept, great restaurants nearby (island creek oyster bar) and just minutes to Fenway Park- perfect location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Tom I
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in as many months that I had the privelge of staying here. What a pleasure the first time, equally repeated the second. The hospitality is genuine and the effort is excellent. We arrived late due to traffic & the Red Sox game. Our rooms were waiting for us without excuse & "arms were gently twisted" to get us immediate seating at the Island Oyster Bar. Another treat I may add (don't miss it). When we explained to Garrett at the Island Oyster Bar that we were going to the Pats game tomorrow, he graciously invited us to his tail gate party. What a gentlemen! Space limits me to go on about the rooms as well. Exquisitely appointed and very comfortable. The ONLY place to stay in Boston !

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Trip in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Jason A
Reviews.Content: Great location and very friendly staff. Rooms were clean and had everything I needed. The location right off the green line was ideal as I was running out to Boston College and back downtown during my stay. One of the nicest hotels that I have stayed in and I strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful experience at the Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Valerie46093
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in the experience at this hotel was incredible! We were greeted by name during the rest of our stay. All of the staff are friendly and courteous Our room was beautiful, clean, spacious, and had a wonderful view of the city. The bed was the most comfortable we have slept on in any hotel. While there, we dined in the both of the hotel's restaurants. The food is amazing at both! If you are ever in Boston, definitely stay at this hotel. We certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “Special weekend, special hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent the weekend for our tenth anniversary. Since it was our anniversary I wanted to find a hotel that was more than just a room to sleep in. We got what we paid for and much more. From the moment we pulled our car up until the moment we pulled away, every member of the staff offered us a truly exceptional stay. After spending the night out on the town Friday we came back to the room to find a note from the staff with a bottle of champagne wishing us a happy anniversary. We still don't know how they knew because neither of us remembered mentioning it to anyone but it was the type of attention that we received the whole weekend. Rooms are very comfortable and spacious and hotel is convenient to Fenway and mass transit if you are not up for walking.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappoints!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beachbum46084
Reviews.Content: In town for just one night for our anniversary and to catch a Sox game... Briefly mentioned we were celebrating when we checked in. After the game, we came back to the room to find a bottle of champagne and treats from the staff. It was so thoughtful and delicious. I will NOT stay anywhere else in the city. Room was immaculate and spacious. Clean, clean, clean. I am a germ freak, yes I brought my flashlight to check for bedbugs and such. No worries here, had a great night sleep, very comfy bed. Had brunch at Eastern Standard kitchen, delish for sure! Can't wait to come back next fall!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: RochesterNHTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice and convenient of many attractions...walking distance to Fenway.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: PeteSF
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Commonwealth a number of times, and it never disappoints. The rooms are spacious, vey comfortable, and immaculately clean. The free WiFi is fast, too! The staff is friendly and very professional. This is my favorite hotel in Boston, and perhaps my favorite in the Northeast. The location next to the Kenmore T stop makes it eas to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Reputation for excellence is well-earned”
Reviews.Author: juanlb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 2 young children in mid August and we all thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Location is convenient, decor is beautiful and the service was very good. Rooms are very spacious (high ceilings add to the sensation of amplitude), with great linens, comfortable mattresses and quality toiletries. It's an independent boutique hotel, that offers the same quality of service and facilities as the top chains. The only downsides are the lack of pool and the cost for overnight parking (more than $40). In all, I will definitely return and highly recommend this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: lindsaymohn
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay in preparation for a long drive up the coast to Maine. We arrived tired and harried, and the charming young people at the front desk cheered us up immediately by being so personable and welcoming. We have a college student in Boston, and will surely stay at the Commonwealth again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyU910
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are from NJ and have stayed at this hotel for years whenever we attended a Red Sox game. For us the convenience to be able to walk to the park in minutes is a huge plus rather than cabbing to/from if we stayed elsewhere in the city. We stayed there on 9/13/11 for our anniversary to attend a game. We were pleasantly suprised with the first class treatment we received which included a room upgrade, flowers, champagne & CC strawberries. As another reviewer wrote, the staff, service, room cleanliness is first class all the way and we also highly recommend staying here. Boston, Red Sox, Fenway Park and the Commonweath Hotel doesn't get much better than this!!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: dina b
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel and the only hotel that i stay at whent raveling to boston! everything about this hotel is terrific.....service, rooms, people, comfort, cleaniness, food, etc etc..... i HIGHLY recommend staying here wether it is business or pleasure.....this hotel wont disapoint!

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tondravi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights during the Advent Convention. I'm a Boston local but decided I didn't want to travel back and forth for the convention. I had a GREAT time at the Commonwealth! I didn't go in with any expectations and was pleasantly surprised with my experience. The last hotel I stayed at in downtown Boston was the Ritz and I will say the Commonwealth was a better stay. It's got the same great service without the stuffy attitude and atmosphere. Everyone was so friendly and asked how you were enjoying your stay and was there anything they could do for you. The hotel itself is very charming. The decor is very trendy without the feeling that they're trying too hard. I love boutique hotels so this was just perfect for me. The location was perfect for what I needed. I was a ten minute walk to the Hynes convention center, five minutes to Fenway Park, ten minutes to the best shopping and restaurants in the area ( Boylston and Newbury Streets with Copley/Prudential Malls). I had plenty to do during my breaks at the conference. The room was huge with a sitting area that had a second TV. that was great because my husband was with me and he could watch the game while I caught up on work and watched what I wanted to. There's also this great charging station where you can hook up all your gadgets we can't seem to live without at once. That was something I hadn't seen before in a hotel. The pillows were fantastic! I felt like I was sinking into a cloud every night. I was also a fan of the lush towels in the bathroom. For the first time I didn't have to call for more. They supplied nice Fresh amenities too. I love Fresh products so that was a bonus for me. Room service surprised me with a great bottle of wine and chocolate truffles when I arrived. Very nice touch after a long day at the convention. The staff is just fantastic. The room service and maid service were wonderful. The only thing that was missing from the room was a coffee maker. You need to give yourself an extra minute to grab that before you start your day. Overall I had a great time at this hotel. It was a short stay but I'll definitely be back next time I need to stay in town. I think people who are in Boston for Business or pleasure would enjoy staying here. If you are a Red Sox fan I don't think there is anywhere closer to Fenway! I would definitley recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “way above expectations”
Reviews.Author: timkid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel while attending a family wedding. Almost all of the guests stayed there. It was a great experience. The rooms were comfortable and soooo quiet. Bellmen and front desk helped with restaurant recommendations and I was impressed that gave suggestions that fit whether it was $$ casual dining with kids or $$$ couples place. My first experience with the hotel was by phone (with reservations) and, honestly, I have never had such a polite experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's a gem”
Reviews.Author: Loweemac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Commonwealth about a month ago and couldn't wait to come back. From the charming doormen to the helpful and warm staff ready to greet you at the desk, this hotel is the best. This past weekend we returned and they upgraded us to a wonderful suite. The room was beautiful, spacious and clean. We loved this most recent stay because we were going to an event at Fenway and we could walk there and back. We love everything about this hotel and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: We attended a wedding in Boston and rooms were reserved by the brides family at the Commonwealth hotel. From the people who checked us on to the porter who heed us with our bags at checkout time the staff was incredibly helpful, friendly and efficient. I travel over 200 days a year and stay in the best hotels in the world and would recommend The Commonwealth to any of our friends or business associates. Well done Commonwealth.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda J
Reviews.Content: We came for a family wedding, and the location was perfect--we were able to walk to the rehearsal dinner and the reception. Sightseeing was easy too, as the green line stops next to the hotel. The hotel has great coffee in the lobby, but is also next to Dunkin' Donuts :). The Fenway and Commonwealth rooms are spacious. The staff was very accommodating, and gave us great recommendations for local restaurants to try.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Choice”
Reviews.Author: caryaf
Reviews.Content: Our daughter is now a Senior at Boston University, and we've stayed at the Commonwealth on all but one or two of our visits to her these last three years. Both the rooms, and service, are impeccable. The rooms are all very large, and the decor is elegant. But its the people, in the end, the push this hotel over the top! We've seen the same people for all these years, and in an industry where employees are always moving, the fact that Commonwealth keeps the loyalty of their people speaks volumes. Happy employees keep the guests very happy! Doormen (Jeff is incredible), Front Desk Staff, Concierge, and all are terrific. Attached restaurant, Eastern Standard, is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great meeting facilities and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ExecAALB
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance to anything you would need including Fenway Park. Meeting facilities and food requests were handled perfectly, no disappointments. Fast and efficient check in and check out and last minute requests for meeting room needs handled with satisfaction and no questions asked. Have recommended this hotel/venue to our corporate meeting planner for future executive business meetings. Great restaurant next door, Eastern Standard, great for dinner and lunch - suggest making a reservation which the concierge is more than happy to oblige.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: PatBurns16
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth is an amazing place to stay. We were in Boston for four days on a road trip from Boise, ID. When we first arrived we were greeted by Yohanes, a great friendly valet. He helped us with our luggage and it was a nice welcome to the hotel. Then the Front Office Manager, Mr. Ryan Burns, was extremely nice and welcoming. He made us feel like family. He then guided us to the Eastern Standard, which has amazing burgers. Then the next morning we were greeted by another valet. He noticed my Kansas City Royals hat and commented on baseball. Nick Macdonald, "Nicky Mac", was a nice and friendly person. He made us feel welcome and was very nice to all of us. Overall our stay here was amazing. Great staff, great food, and great location. You need to stay here if you are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: julhutton
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about Hotel Commonwealth. The hotel is gorgeous, the rooms are so comfortable, and the location is perfect. You have easy access to Boston University and Boston College. What I loved the most, however, was the staff. I have never encountered such a friendly, helpful group. When I return, and I will, it will be because of this fantastic, enthusiastic group of employees. Hotel Commonwealth, job well done!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have been to in a while.”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: Everything was top notch from our arrival on. Family loved the accommodations and we will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!! Loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: callen21
Reviews.Content: First class, top notch, impeccable friendly service, beautiful rooms, bed that feels like you are sleeping on a cloud!! From the time I pulled up to valet park to the time I checked out, every moment at the Hotel Commonwealth was outstanding! Every staff person I encountered was so friendly and helpful! I stayed for business but will be back to with family to enjoy a weekend stay in Boston. Great location- a stone's throw from Fenway (I could see the Green Monster from my room!) Take a break too and have a cocktail in the bar. Bartenders were friendly and great mixologists too! Hotel is beautiful! Rooms are spacious and nicely decorated, modern. Do yourself a favor and stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Hotel Commonwealth twice this summer, and both times were great. Our son just started his freshman year at BU, and in July we stayed there during orientation. The staff was very friendly, and the rooms were comfortable and clean. Last week, my wife and I spent four days there while moving our son into his dorm room. The customer service was fantastic. Our flight was cancelled due to Hurricane Irene, and we ended up having to change our hotel reservation. They were able to accommodate us without a problem. The concierge, Samuel, provided us with great recommendations and was able to get us seats to the Red Sox game. I wanted to do something special for my wifeâ€™s birthday, and she loved it! We enjoyed eating at the Island Creek Oyster Bar as well. I would highly recommend it. Over all, I would say the Hotel Commonwealth is a great deal for the location. My wife and I plan on staying there many times in the next four years.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for BU Orientation and moving into dorms”
Reviews.Author: CalifoniaMO4
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were recently in Boston attending Orientation at BU and moving her into her dorm. The Commonwealth location was very convenient as the school is located accross the street. and the dorm was nearby. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful from accomodating our early check in request and suggesting excellent restaurants to helping move a lot of luggage in and out of the hotel. The hotel is a short walk to Newbury Street and the Charles River. Fenway Park is just behind the hotel. We look forward to staying at the Commonwealth Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our second home in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Rademakers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 days in August, were very satisfied and therefore we came back for 4 days in September. The second visit already felt like coming home. The staff gave us a very warm welcome and all the help we needed. The Commonwealh Hotel is going to be our second home in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Kenmore Surprise”
Reviews.Author: KensColumn
Reviews.Content: New and excellent in all regards. Rooms were large and beautiful .

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Bob L
Reviews.Content: I found this property to be well appointed with soothing decor and all the right amenities to make my business visit perfect. The service team at this property is what sets itself from the rest. Moreover, the location is second to none as it is quite convenient to get to/from other Boston locations and there are plenty of area restaurants to walk to and Fenway Park is right around the corner. I also made airport transportation service reservations with their concierge and the car service was the best I ever experienced. I will definitely return to this property when I have business in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: JC&DP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth because of it's proximity to Boston University as our daughter is attending BU on exchange from Sydney University. It was well located, had spacious rooms and the best shampoo, soap, body lotion in the room of any hotel we have ever stayed in. Yes they are sparing however if you ask they are happy to supply additional on request. The service was friendly and helpful. We dined at both restaurants connected with the hotel. The Oyster Bar was a little disappointing. We ordered the lobster and found it was chewy and overcooked. The oysters however were excellent. The Eastern Standard restaurant where breakfast is served was a busy and fun place for drinks and served a lovely dinner with excellent service. Included i our room rate was a $50 credit for breakfast and this was more than enough for 3 people. Excellent for those who enjoy baseball as Fenway Park is just around the corner. The gym is well equipped and the subway is just next door. Free internet is appreciated. All up we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Personal attention to details! Never a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: sasisaki
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Commonwealth for several years now. We have always been treated well and the hotel staff is amongst the best around. The location of this hotel is extremely convenient and the restaurants are super! The rooms are always comfortable, spotless, and well-maintained. The prices are competative for the area but the staff at Hotel Commonwealth always add a special treat to make their customers feel relaxed and respected...A diificult task especially when you are helping your kids move into freshman housing at BU. I personally love the cookies on your pillows at turndown time! This is a first class hotel...well-done!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: fridayz
Reviews.Content: Had to book last minute and this was the only place i could find. So glad I did. Lovely room, people nice and efficient checking in and out. I have to go to Boston a lot and this is my new place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It is average and needs help but has potential”
Reviews.Author: brad w
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel and in the same suite. The room is ok. It is dated. The bed was clearly old and broken and probably the worst bed I have ever stayed in. The bathroom is dated and the tub is way too old. The shower leaked and needs updating. The people were fine and the hotel is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to the Boston University campus. The staff is terrific”
Reviews.Author: natasha48
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised and disappointed that there aren't coffee-makers in the rooms. One can be requested and it will be brought to the room, but I'm wondering if there will be enough to go around on a crowded weekend. I'll be returning to the hotel in October for Parents' Weekend at BU and the hotel is fully booked. The rates go up a lot (to $500 and up) on this weekend, so I better get a coffee-maker at these prices!

Reviews.Title: “Die hard Sox fans and die hard Commonwealth fans”
Reviews.Author: tedhistory
Reviews.Content: Our fourth trip this year to Boston for Bruins and Red Sox games. The staff at the Commonwealth do everything to make this our "second home." The hotel meets every need

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: NSChurch
Reviews.Content: If I'm in Boston for business or leisure I'm staying at the Commonwealth! From the physical space, to the service and to all of the amenities between, there's no better place in town! Until next time hotel Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Very worthy of your Business”
Reviews.Author: Sean1986
Reviews.Content: The front door staff was awesome. The front desk staff was efficient. The rooms are really nice and the bathrooms very spacious. The water pressure in the shower was the best I have experienced in Boston. My only complaint is that they do not have an On Demand video system. Rather you have to call the Concierage and order off a list of available DVD's. We chose 7 DVD's we were interested in and turned out that none were available. Not a smart system for an otherwise top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “staff was excellent”
Reviews.Author: momi60
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much.The upgraded room we got was very comfortable and the staff was always kind and very helpful. We certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and great service”
Reviews.Author: Kcholiday
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. There was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but we asked the front desk staff who immediately organised a tea/coffee maker for us. Great gym. Go down to the hotel attached(not the oyster bar) for breakfast or dinner. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great ...but really???”
Reviews.Author: generalbarnicke
Reviews.Content: Pricey, but teriffic hotel, great location, and friendly, welcoming staff. For a game at Fenway you can't ask for a better location! But for the cost, it's not too much to expect a bar of soap for BOTH the sink and shower right? Small thing, but if you're trying to cater to everything a guest might like to feel at home, don't make them transfer soap from the sink to shower.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, over the top service”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: We came into Boston for a Red Sox game, and could not be happier with how close the hotel was to Fenway and suggestions the staff had for us for places to eat the area. Great weekend, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed it and would love to go back.”
Reviews.Author: kate g
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family of three, grandparents and grandson. We were immediately upgrades to a very nice family room with no prompting by the very warm and helpful staff. They helped us with the the tickets for the trolley bus tour, which virtually took up the whole of the day. Lots of general information as to where to eat and what to see. It was a great insight into the beautiful city of Boston. Everyone, was so kind warm and welcoming throughout the City and especially the staff in the Commonwealth Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Janice H
Reviews.Content: We were offered a bed and breakfast deal when we contacted the hotel by telephone. It worked out really well for our family - the breakfast meals at the Eastern Standard restaurant were delicious. The service was prompt and convenient. We even went back for a night cap and the bar part of this restaurant was lively. As for the hotel - the beds were very comfortable, the sitting area in our room was spacious and the bathrooms were very large and well equipped. We had free internet and a flat screen TV. The rooms were quiet. The "Fresh" line of creams, body wash and shampoo were the nicest products that we were ever offered in a hotel room. A very nice touch. The staff (bellmen, front desk, concierge, housekeeping) were friendly helpful and went above and beyond to make sure our stay was a good one. When we booked the room we were asked how they could make our stay more comfortable - this gave us a really good feel - like our business was important to them. We took advantage of some on-line shopping and had the packages delivered to the hotel - they were happily produced upon our arrival. The hotel is located on gorgeous Commonwealth Ave within 5 minutes walk to Newbury Street - tons of ice cream shops, cafes and shopping. We were able to walk to our Duck Tour from our hotel. The furnishings and photographs all throughout the hotel were beautiful and really interesting to look at. We will definitely stay at this hotel whenever we travel to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “BEST SERVICE ANYWHERE”
Reviews.Author: E J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels from Las Vegas's finest to Europe, and this hotel has the friendliest, most helpful staff ever. The rooms are nice and they have great views. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: rickbk
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston on a college-hunting trip with our daughter. We were put into two gorgeous rooms overlooking Commonwealth Avenue. The real treat was the front desk staff. They could not have been more friendly and helpful. during busy Restaurant Week, they assured us of a reservation at the superb Island Creek Oyster Bar (part of the hotel) and helped us remember the name of an Italian Restaurant on Charles Street we have been to years ago (Toscano). They printed out google maps to make our navigating easier, including routes to avoid traffic. We would recommend it and come back

Reviews.Title: “A coffee pot in the room would have made it perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Remember2love
Reviews.Content: Everthing was great. They upgraded us to a bigger room and when we opened the curtains, Fenway Park was right there. It was rather magical. There were wine glasses and a bottle opener, which I thought was nice. The staff was great and the place was very clean too. Only issue was there was no coffee pot in the room and the only fridge was full of things to buy. Hard to put anything in it. Otherwise it was great!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will come back”
Reviews.Author: EbonyVermont
Reviews.Content: The service was extraordinary and the room lovely. We got extra attention as well for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: GCW49
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was where I wanted to be in the city and it promised comfort with no hassles. It was perfect. Everyone was courteous and helpful. My two young boys like Japanese cuisine and so we crossed Kenmore Square for a very good dinner and to visit the Boston University Bookstore. Parking is a little pricey but the attendants were as nice as could be and the lot is immediately behind the hotel. The boys and I look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommend this hotel and will be back for another stay”
Reviews.Author: Tracey G
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how perfect this hotel is...especially if you are going to a Red Sox game. The room was gorgeous...the location was perfect and since the train is right outside the door...you can get to anything you want in a matter of minutes

Reviews.Title: “A great find!!”
Reviews.Author: jaa251
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is perfectly situated near BU, Fenway, Prudential center and Newbury St. The Kenmore T stop is right next door so you can get anywhere in Boston with ease. The service was excellent - the staff is very friendly, extremely helpful and welcoming. The rooms are spacious and beautifully maintained. Don't miss the Oyster bar downstairs - freshest raw bar in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HKZim27
Reviews.Content: Long before we even checked in at the Hotel Commonwealth, they made their commitment to exceptional customer service apparent. A month or so before our trip, I e-mailed the hotel to request late check-out on the date of our departure to accommodate our participation in the Freedom Trail Run (a don't-miss if you like touristy stuff and physical activity!), and at least three front-end staff members replied to my e-mail within a half hour to say the hotel would be happy to accommodate my request. That was only the beginning. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by extremely friendly and helpful front-end staff, bellhops, and doormen. At check-in, we were given a jogging map just because they remembered from my e-mail that we were participating in the run! I thought that just really showed the special attention they pay to their customers. Then we went up to our room to discover a beautiful, spacious, immaculately clean corner suite! If that weren't enough, there was a bottle of champagne and a card signed by a number of the staff members to congratulate me and my husband on our first anniversary--I had mentioned in my e-mail requesting the late check-out that we were traveling to Boston to celebrate it. That was such a nice touch, and it continued to show that the hotel staff really wanted their guests to feel welcome and special. Throughout our stay we were greeted at the hotel door and desk each time with friendly faces, and we always arrived back to our room at the end of our long touring days to clean, fresh towels, a beautifully straightened room, and a comfortable bed. Every single staff member we spoke to was kind and happy to help. The front desk staff even provided us with extra towels to dry off when we came into the hotel soaking wet after running back from nearby Fenway Park during a flash storm! And there I was thinking that they wouldn't even want to let us into such a beautiful establishment in such a state! :) We also ate at each of the hotel restaurants once. The food at the Island Creek Oyster Bar was excellent, and our serving "team" was very knowledgable and helpful to me as I tried oysters for the first time ever! (I wouldn't know any better, but the couple dining next to us opined that the restaurant has simply the best raw oyster bar in Boston.) I was a little less impressed with the Eastern Standard (a service mishap that could have been fixed easily if we had asked about it, but we didn't, so no big deal), but the french toast I had there was delicious, so I can't complain too much. :) All said, our whole trip was just made that much better by the wonderful treatment we recieved at the Hotel Commonwealth. I'm not what you'd call rich, but sure I felt like I was somebody rich and important because the entire staff just treated me and my husband so well while we were there. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever used”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many of the very best hotels in the United States and abroad and think the Hotel Commonwealth equals or surpasses all of them, including the Carlyle, the Four Seasons, the Ritz Carlton, the Plaza, the Stafford, etc. The rooms are very well thought out, the decor is attractive and everything is clean and well taken care of. BUT, the most important aspect of the stay is the SERVICE. I have never had a wait staff that surpassed the wait staff of the Hotel Commonwealth. It will always be a must for us when we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “If you need a quality hotel near B.U. or Fenway, this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: hatsnjim
Reviews.Content: I have a son starting at Boston University in a few weeks, so I took my 2 teenage sons down to Boston for a night. I knew nothing about Hotel Commonwealth till that day. I was surfing, looking at hotels marked 4 stars or better, but most cost over $350/night. However, Hotel Commonwealth had rooms still available at under $250, so I grabbed one. Boy, did I luck out. This is a truly impressive 5 STAR hotel. We got a "junior suite", which is essentially one very large room. (They have a large curtain divider you can use to turn your jr suite into 2 rooms.) The room was very clean. Great view. The bathroom was very clean and had a separate room for the toilet, so I could still shave, brush teeth, shower... even if my son needed to use the toilet. Extremely comfortable beds. Excellent TVs (yes, there were 2...one for each boy!) The location of Hotel Commonwealth is perfect, directly across the street from Boston University and within easy walking distance of Fenway. When we arrived at 4 pm, the maid was inside "doing our room". We asked what she was doing and she replied, "Turn Down Service". My son asked, "Dad, did they turn us down?' Had to laugh and explain to the boys what "turn down service" meant, and the boys were thrilled to see the maid had left chocolates on the beds. The staff were great! Very helpful, very polite. The only problem is the rates can fluctuate by the day. If The Red Sox have a home game, rates go up. On Parent's Weekend for BU, I think my room would cost much more/night. Can't say as I blame the Hotel, it would still be a good deal at $500/night.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Advertised!”
Reviews.Author: pnkhm
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth is better than advertised, the beauty and charm of this place well exceeded our expectations and the staff's obvious, number one priority is making your stay there as pleasant and memorable as possible. The accommodations were very neat and extremely clean and comfortable. We were within walking distance from everything we wanted to do in Bostonâ€¦.Fenway, shopping, dining and nightlife. Eastern Standard and Island Creek Oyster Bar in the hotel are absolutely outstanding. Bring your appetite because the portions are more than enough. We would definitely return for a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “They get the big things right but details need work.”
Reviews.Author: dysphorichousewife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three day business trip. As others have noted this is a fantastic location, the rooms are beautiful and both restaurants on the property are outstanding. However, the overall experience did not meet my expectations because small but important elements were missing that I've come to expect in hotels of this class: only one bar of soap so had to keep switching it from sink to bath, no conditioner, 3 bath towels for 2 guests, poor lighting for bathroom vanity (I think light needed to be replaced in makeup mirror or something), no electrical outlets near the entry which would have been the best place to set up ironing board...I could go on but I think you get the drift.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 17Lovetotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took a trip to Boston and stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth. The room was great! Very spacious and clean. Location was great, right across from Fenway. The staff was friendly and very attentive. We will definatley be back! Only downside was parking at $42.00 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and a great experience all around!”
Reviews.Author: WalterandPerri
Reviews.Content: This place knows how to do it right! Everything from reservation to check out was first-class and professional all the way. The rooms are always extremely spacious and comfortable. I can't remember another hotel stay I've had where you had this much space. The front desk staff is pleasant and ultra-accommodating. They printed my concert tickets (twice) because I misplaced them. They'll send up a bottle of water, toothbrush or razor on request with a smile. Basically they are there to meet your needs with no hesitation. What more do you want in a hotel experience? The concierge, Dan, was as professional and effective as I've ever seen - and I have traveled far and wide! He was able to snag us a table at one of Boston's busiest steakhouses when I couldn't get one on my own. Highly recommend this place based on location, luxury and above all service!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Fenway Park getaway”
Reviews.Author: sdcrane
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Hotel Commonwealth taking my son to 2 Boston Red Sox games at Fenway Park. Hotel was impeccable, staff was gracious and extremely helpful, and the location is obviously perfect for going to the baseball stadium just around the corner. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and staff were great.”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been more pleased. Have no criticisms whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: AMHebert
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel (junior suite) in August 2011 with our 2.5 yr old daughter. Staff was very warm and welcoming. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. On both nights we had dinner at the Oyster Creek, the hotel seafood restaurant, and the food and staff there were amazing. Really enjoyed it. My only reservations would be : the bathtub was small for a suite, and the hotel is way too air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Monica S
Reviews.Content: The front desk staffs are extremely helpful and very friendly. Room is very comfortable. Very nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mitchell s
Reviews.Content: I liked the low key, but friendly staff that was 100% devoid of pomposity and pretentiousness, the size of room, and a location mid way between Brookline and the major sites of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to our annual trip to Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Danielle P
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I look forward to our annual trip to Boston. The Hotel Commonwealth has a lot to do with this. The hotel itself is beautiful and luxurious, but what makes it so worth while is the staff. The friendly and accommodating culture the staff creates makes you feel like family. Best of all is the restaurant Eastern Standard. The food is ridiculously outstanding and again the staff is friendly, personable and knowledgeable. Island Creek Oyster Bar also attached is unreal! Love Love Love...EVERYTHING

Reviews.Title: “You'll be sad to leave!”
Reviews.Author: dijas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Commonwealth for a long weekend for the Red Sox last regular season series - an annual tradition. However, this was the first time we stayed at the Commonwealth and we were very pleased. My review might be biased by the fact that it was some kind of nirvana for me to wake up in the morning and see Fenway Park outside of my window. But, I am a hotel dork (dork, snob, connoisseur...take your pick), so I'll try not to let my that cloud my assessment. The things you would expect to be exceptional for this level of hotel did not disappoint - comfortable bed, outstanding bedding that feels like silk, large bathtub with rainfall showerhead, quality bath products and, of course, a stocked minibar (for that ritual snickers and Heineken!). There was also a luxuriously large bathroom that allowed two people to get ready without bumping elbows and the restaurant (Eastern Standard) is quite a draw all on its own. We were eternally grateful they were still serving food at 1 a.m. when we finally arrived from the airport - a delightful gift of St. Christopher, the patron Saint of travelers. Everyone on the staff that we encountered was very nice and helpful. I needed to send some things back home which they cheerfully helped me with. The restaurant staff was great, and we never got that feeling like, "oh, you're just hotel guests." They treated us like regulars, but that could be because we spent a lot of time at the bar in between baseball games! The neighborhood is great. It just doesn't get easier to walk to the game, but it is really easy to walk down to the public garden, do some (window)shopping on Newbury St. or pop over to Copley Place. The green line is right outside the door to Eastern Standard if you don't feel like walking to the North end (we do, but we walk a lot). Overall, this is a great hotel...whether you decide to venture no further than your room or make it your base from which to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had more than one night to spend.”
Reviews.Author: NJcruiserEB
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for BU, Fenway , shopping on Newbury St. and the T. Felp pampered there, by the front desk, the doorman- everyone I encountered. A lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust126
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. I was there with my husband during a trip to Boston where he had a medical appointment at the Dana Farber Cancer Institute. How lovely to have such a beautiful place to stay under such stressful and difficult circumstances. From booking my reservation with the special reservations clerk, getting assistance with a special medical shuttle, to needing a bandaid for a small cut I incurred while I was there, the staff attended to our every need graciouslessly and effortlessly. I hope to return to stay there one day, but next time under better circumstances,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Boston - Our new favorite hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: FrenIrishW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for 4 nights with our family. The staff from the doormen, front desk, bellman, housekeeping were very warm welcoming and professional. You can tell they like their jobs and they represent the hotel very well. Our rooms were quite large and the beds were very comfortable, bathroom/shower were lovely. We are very fussy about cleaniless and this hotel was excellent! We used the concierge services several times and we were so impressed at how accomidating and informative they were - special compliments to the concierge Samuel who got us reservations at the Chart House with a special dessert ordered for us with his compliments. The kids really loved that! This hotel is great for families - young and old!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: donna j
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on Commonwealth Blvd, a stone's throw from BU, Fenway park with transportation in and out of the city at the location. The rooms were spacious, imaculate and very tastefully appointed. The service was phenomenal and friendly in the true spirit of Boston. It is a boutique hotel and has amenities located right at your fingertips from the Eastern Standard restaurant and the trendy Oyster Bar. Room Service is also available and the front desk could not have been more accomodating. A must stay in the Back Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: Greg M
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Commonwealth on a regular basis. Always great service and large comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We love it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bjf12345
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Beautiful, clean, wonderful location, staff was fantastic. I have stayed in some of the nicest hotels and Hotel Commonwealth was right with the best of them. First night we went to a game at Fenway and it was just a 5 minute walk to the game. I can't say enough good at about this Hotel. The subway is right next door and you can walk to all to the back bay shopping and resturants. It's a long walk to the Freedom Trail walking tour but it's can be done or just jump on the "T" and get off at Park Street and you are right where you need to be for the tour. Can't recommend this Hotel enough!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kpfedak
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved every single thing about this hotel! The room, the staff, the room service, the restaurant (Eastern Standard). We have stayed at many fine hotels all over the world and our experience here definitely ranked among the best - if not THE BEST. Would definitely look for an excuse to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Attentive Staff - Perfect for Red Sox Games!”
Reviews.Author: vt_travelers65
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location of this hotel for the purpose of our visit - Fenway Park! It also was great to be able to hop on the T for a quick visit to the Public Gardens and a pleasant walk back up Newbury Street to the hotel, visiting shops along the way. We opted for a Commonwealth Suite because we wanted the privacy that drawing the curtains between the two rooms allowed for sleeping - but would not do this again. The sleep sofa was very uncomfortable - it would seem that for the price of the room (which was listed as a 4 person room) they could have invested in a better quality sleeper couch. We had late night snacks at the Oyster Bar in the hotel and found the food to be delicious and the service first rate. The music was a bit loud and we would have preferred a quiet jazz sort of music - but the fresh local oysters almost made up for the noise level - not as relaxing as we would have liked however. This is a very clean hotel with a pleasant and attentive staff, and we did enjoy our stay and would stay there again. Frankie, the door man, was a gem!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is THE hidden gem of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Donna B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is THE hidden gem of Boston! The attention to detail and the fine service make it a place I will come back to time and time again. The rooms are beautiful, lush towels, the Fresh line of soaps and lotions in the bathroom, cozy robes......I can't wait to come back! We had an outstanding dinner at the Island Creek Oyster Bar and my friends are still talking about ! Thank you to each and every staff member who greeted me with a warm smile. I am already planning my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL COMMONWEALTH - A WAY OF LIFE"”
Reviews.Author: TASKNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Since the l940's,my husband and his family have been dedicated Red Sox fans. To love the Red Sox is a way of life. For many years, my husband and I have traveled to Boston to enjoy the city and our beloved Red Sox - it truly is a way of our life. A significant part of the Sox tradition is the Hotel Commonwealth. It is our home away from home in Boston. This 43rd Anniversary trip was a delight. We enjoyed a beautiful junior suite with all the trimmings and the best of attention by the excellent staff! The Boston Red Sox and the Hotel Commonwealth - a way of life!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Nicklas S
Reviews.Content: This was by far one of my best stays in Boston, the staff, the rooms, and the services available in regards to restaurants, bars, were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but..........”
Reviews.Author: ginamackey
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth many times, our sons went to school in Boston. We love Boston, love the Hotel, but this last visit wasn't as great as it should've been. One bar of soap per bathroom??? No hair conditioner??? A showerhead that droops and a taller person has to squat under??? And no room safe -- what???? We had an upgraded room, but you'd never have known it. We'll stay again, but with specific needs addressed before we arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent!”
Reviews.Author: Campcompass
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about the staff, accommodations and location relative to Fenway. Plain and simple we paid a good penny and every penny was worth it. In fact I'm saving my pennies for a return visit. We will stay at no other place when we head back. If my wife is smiling then u know it's quality.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: matt6497
Reviews.Content: Just what the doctor ordered.....Let me set the scenario for you......I'm in MFG in the USA...silly, I know, but what the heck, It was the only business my Grandmother had.....my shipper was out on vacation for the week, my secretary had Thursday and Friday off, and my Accountant left without any notice!!!!! Why me!!!! Arghhhhh...anyhow, hired somebody off Craigslist, she came in Friday, we did payroll together.....she seems really good.......Was going to cancel my plans, but needed to get away....We went to the Commonwealth, which we have stayed at before.....upon arriving, they graciously welcomed us, I was getting all the junk out of the car, as my wife, 13 year old son, and his friend ( Yankee fan, but we love him) proceeded to the front desk to check in....as I grumpily trudged up the stairs, this smiley dude, the manager I believe, decides to tell us he was going to upgrade us to the Fenway Suite, has baseball stuff, every kids dream...now me, being cynical by nature, was waiting for the, it will be only 200 dollars more.....it was at no charge!!!! I couldn't believe it!!! We asked him about 12 times if he was sure, he kept saying yes, never tried to upcharge us and continued to smile...he said they just like to make a persons day if they can...they certainly did!!!!!!! It was awesome...Central location, felt totally safe, and the Sox won witha walk-off double in the 10th...it was a magical night, and a magical stay......Thanks!!!! You have no idea how that random act of kindness affected a down in the dumps guy on that day......

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sriv726
Reviews.Content: Whenever we have Sox tickets, we always stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. We were able to get tickets about a week before the game, so we figured booking a room would be impossible. They were fully reserved at the time that I called, but we were placed on a waitlist in case of cancellation. We were called back the same day when they did receive a cancellation. Upon arrival, you are greeted by their friendly staff. Check-in took all of 5 minutes -- prompt, courteous and thorough. We had requested two rollaway beds for our room and they were in our room upon our arrival. They never fail to impress and we absolutely love their accommodations. We look forward to staying with them again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “It is our favorite Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: katiecasey
Reviews.Content: We had another wonderful stay at the Hotel Commonwealth....our only compaint was that it was just for ONE night. The proximity to Fenway Park combined with a beautiful and comfortable room is just one of the reasons we love this Hotel. Everyone is so friendly, the Eastern Standard Restaurant is great and the lobby is delightfully different. It is also one of the cleanest establishments that I have ever seen. We can't wait to return, and hopefully see the Red Sox win!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: RedheadTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for business several times, and would highly recommend it. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the rooms are spacious with high end amenities from Fresh (and even a professional grade hair dryer!) The location is perfect for either taking the T, or jetting in a car downtown, over to Cambridge, or out to the western suburbs with the Mass Pike right there. Plus Eastern Standard has amazing food right on site. The fitness center is in a small room with no windows, but there are several new treadmills with TVs and towels and cold water provided. I will definitely be back. The valet parking is $42/night with no self park option, but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect blend of convenience and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_san_11
Reviews.Content: With a five-minute walk to Fenway Park, this was the perfect place to stay. I travel often for alumni relations work and the accommodations and service were top-notch from the time I pulled my car up for valet to the room service breakfast to check-out. I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: allenfamily4
Reviews.Content: We make a annual trip to Boston for a Red Sox game, always staying at Hotel Commonwealth. Perfect location to walk to the game. Luxurious accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel , I plan on staying again”
Reviews.Author: Trin77
Reviews.Content: all your professional help were just great, they are freindly and helpful. This hotel you have is a class act, keep up the good work. and also when we booked the room I asked for a higher floor, well they gave me the top floor. The marble floors , nice bathrobe which my son really liked, the chocolates on the bed, comfortable chair in the room. class a hotel. Thank you again. Steven Tringali

Reviews.Title: “Elegant with all the amenities, without the "chain" mentality.”
Reviews.Author: sefcpa
Reviews.Content: Great city hotel right near mass transit, Fenway Park and Boston University surrounded by great dining options. From the doorman to the desk staff then to housekeeping, service was impeccable. Felt like the Waldorf or Plaza in NY without the highbrow. Room was spacious, immaculate, comfortable and beautifully decorated with all the amenities one would expect. We left an article in the room, housekeeping found it and our daughter picked it up later. We most certainly will stay again if we can get a good rate like we did. The Red Sox were away and it was not a College weekend so with the AAA rate it was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, Our Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeryl56
Reviews.Content: PERFect staff, rooms and stay. Our Hotel for trips to Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: geckogirlVirginia
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth was lovely. Very comfortable beds, immaculate, spacious room. It was perfect...

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Bailey92101
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next to a T subway station, Fenway Park and the beautiful Back Bay. Friendly staff and nice European decor room, stayed in a corner Kenmore room and literally had windows with views on 3 walls. Relatively quiet, even during game days. Both associated restaurants, Island Creek Oyster Bar and Eastern Standard were good as well.

Reviews.Title: “fenway tour stay”
Reviews.Author: purple271
Reviews.Content: great tour, nice stay clean room nice workout room. when to eat at beer work!!! Parking is extra didnt know til we got there. very nice staff. use the subway it is cheep and pretty clean and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: learmister
Reviews.Content: Our room had two queen size beds that were splendid. The beds were oh so comfortable. The room was extremely large and airy. The turn down service was excellent. The front doormen and bell hop personnel always greeted us in a friendly and professional manner. The front desk staff were also friendly , professional and made us seem special. The maid service was extraordinary. Close to Fenway Park, The Prudential Building and train transportation. All within walking distance. Liked everything about this hotel.
