Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: LaurieLin
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel! We have stayed here twice and not been disappointed. The service is unmatchable, the rooms are large and beautiful and everything is very, very clean. You will not be sorry you stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Well done will come back”
Reviews.Author: Wally85
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for business a number of times and liked it enough to come back with my wife which I have done so now a few times. The location is convenient. The rooms are well done and comfortable and the staff is pleasant and accomadating. I highly recommnend. Wally C.

Reviews.Title: “Good location specially for Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: Budgettraveler58
Reviews.Content: I spent three days with two of my daughters as we were on a college discovery trip. Hotel location is great to visit Boston College, BU, Bentley, Babson, and other colleges in the area; however, the $42/day valet parking fee is very steep. I guess it is a good deal if you are going to a Red Sox game at Fenway and have to stay overnight. In general, the hotel facilities are very comfortable and I would definitely return avoiding the car/valet parking issue...

Reviews.AuthorLocation: fort myers, Florida and Cape cod , Massachusetts
Reviews.Title: “Location, elegance and friendly staff all in one gorgeous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MaryW005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Commonwealth in Boston while visiting from Florida. The hotel has beautifully appointed rooms which are also spacious and very Comfortable. My cousins from Scotland were very impressed with my room. We had a fantastic dinner at the adjoining Island Creek Oyster bar and then caught up with all the family news sitting in the wonderful sitting area of my room. Everything about this hotel is far above average . There is even a cute coffee cart off the lobby with a very pleasant server. Boston is a fabulous city and this hotel is truly the best place to stay while exploring bean town.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: deannabond
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and area. Close to BU Admission Office and Fenway Park. Both areas we were planning to visit while in town. Subway and bus stop right in front of hotel. First day we walked to Boston Commons from hotel. No coffee in the room and room service pricey, but we got coffee near by at McDonalds. Dunkin Donuts, Brueggers and other choices close as well. We ate on the run most mornings, but ended up eating brunch once at Eastern Standard in the hotel. We enjoyed our meal. Rooms are spacious and very nice. Asked for a frig to be put in the room and was there when we arrived. I think you can request a microwave too. Didn't want to be tempted by mini bar. Closet had iron, umbrella and one robe. Bathrooms are modern and large. Water pressure good. No noise from other rooms. Staff was always friendly. Valet parking expensive, but nice to have and guaranteed for the hotel guests. We could actually see our car parked behind hotel in the lot and needed to get sunglasses out of the car once. Didn't need to move it until we left since public transportation is good!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location,comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: wetherbystripad
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff from start to finish. Fun location. We will be returning next year for our annual Boston vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Red Sox and Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: la3
Reviews.Content: This was a super hotel, spotless and a staff that was beyond helpful. This was a special trip for my son to see the Red Sox and when we got there there was a wonderful basket of red sox goodies which thrilled my son. The evening, and following day the staff asked my son for all the details of the game, the experience and shared the excitement and memory with him like it was the first time they had heard it. Wonderfully convenient for touring to the subway and walking.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience at the Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Steelangel
Reviews.Content: We had Red Sox tickets for consecutive days, so I looked for hotels in Kenmore Square. In addition to being literally around the corner from Fenway, the Kenmore T Station is practically at the door, so we were able to jump on the subway and visit all of the touristy places in other parts of Boston. The room was immaculate, the staff was ultra helpful, from directions to umbrellas when we needed them. I even saw the front desk staff go to great lengths to assist a family who was not staying there. We would highly recommend this hotel and hope to visit them again - we enjoyed Boston very much.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: Jim5982
Reviews.Content: Don't be surprised by the small amount of rooms. Will meet or beat all of your expectations of a luxury hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: adb09
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for a weekend trip to Boston and were given a Parlor Suite-a beautiful room with a king bed and a separate sitting area that can be closed off with curtains and has comfortable chairs, a table, and a second TV. Even though the room faced Kenmore Square it was absolutely quiet. The staff was wonderful; we even got an unsolicited "is there anything I can do for you" from a bellboy who had a good recommendation for breakfast on Newbury (Trident Bookstore-really a restaurant with books-serves 3 meals a day.) The location is great-very close to Fenway, to Newbury St, and to everything else. We would absolutely stay here again-this is a first rate hotel (free internet as well!)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - I'm a Four Seasons guy, but this property is my choice in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: only-talking-sense
Reviews.Content: Front Desk staff super professional and friendly. Rooms richly appointed but not overdone. Lobby organized, cozy, and efficient. The two restaurants connected to the hotel could not be more energetic, cool, foodie-friendly, with fresh seafood, creative new-organic style cuisine, and great drink selection. Well managed and worthy of serious loyalty. I visit this property 3x year and really look forward to it! Young, cool, but without the overwhelming the perfect for everyone from 25-65! Important Note: This is THE HOTEL if you are visiting Fenway Park. one block away. No Brainer!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slade M
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. Staff was great, location is perfect, and rooms are impeccable (both suites and standard rooms). Conference rooms are perfect as well - banquet staff is very friendly and accomodating. Whether for business (as I was hosting a group of 100) or pleasure, you will not be disappointed. THANKS HM and SD!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mballou78
Reviews.Content: Our group had a wonderful stay. The staff went over and above to make sure that we were well taken of. The hotel is beautiful and clean - very nice. The location is perfect - within walking distance to many restaurants, Fenway, Boston University, shopping, historical sites, and more. Plus, the T-stop is right in front of the hotel for extra convenience. We'll definitely bring our group here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Treatment”
Reviews.Author: fkpetersen
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to Ryan Burns and all of the staff for treating us so well. I would not consider another hotel in Boston without booking a night at Hotel Commonwealth first!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: TorBusTrav
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels all over the world and can't say enough good things about the Hotel Commonwealth. The service is excellent - they go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and provide a lot of amenities like DVDs, coffee makers, fridges. Special thanks to the Bellman Nick and front desk staff like Jessica and Josh. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the gym has great equipment. I can't say enough good things and hope to go back soon..

Reviews.Title: “GREAT MANAGEMENT AT A WELL RUN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bob411
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, only eight years old and beautifully maintained. Great location near everything with beautiful rooms and comfortable beds and all the tech amenities a business person needs to conduct their work. The highlight of the hotel however is the management at least the manager I spoke with who wanted to insure my stay was going well. His name was Ryan and he was the resident house manager. I have traveled millions of miles my entire career and tend to be loyal to the hotels that are managed well. This hotel is certainly in that category. Their management and staff are excellent, genuinely concerned that your stay is comfortable and that you will be returning. I am not surprised that they rank Number One on Trip Advisor. This hotel is five star, not just because of their nice rooms but you get a sense that they care and for that one can ask no more. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Absolutely wonderful!"”
Reviews.Author: jhbbmb11
Reviews.Content: First, I can't say enough about how wonderful our stay was at the Hotel Commonwealth. The minute we pulled up to the hotel we were greeted with smiles and kind words. That same care and concern was expressed from every hotel employee we encountered. We arrived several hours before the check-in time which meant our room was not yet available - but that did not pose any problems. We checked our luggage and off we went to enjoy the city. Later when we returned our room was ready. If you are a Red Sox fan you would have LOVED our view. We looked right at Fenway Stadium. If you have driven in Boston before, you know that it can be very tricky. This hotel was very easy to reach. We can't wait to return for a second visit!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably great experience in every way”
Reviews.Author: tmonjeau
Reviews.Content: It was quite pricey as it was graduation weekend, however, the service was excellent, the restaurant was outstanding, the room was beautiful the bed just right and when I took some stuff out of the minibar to put the wine I brought with me in to cool, I came back to find that the chamber maid put a mini fridge in the room and put my wine in it without my even asking. look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Tex-512
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, I rarely feel the need to post a review but this hotel was fantastic. I thought the service was beyond excellent and the rooms were very nice. I would definitely go back.... There is a reason that Trip Advisor has it listed as #1. Make sure you have a whiskey smash and anything off the dinner menu at "Eastern Standard" the bar/restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper_fl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth while visiting BU with our 16 yr old. ( Note to parents of BU prospective students or current ones, this hotel is directly across the street from campus. Very well located for visiting!!) From the moment we pulled up to the moment we departed, everything at this hotel was perfect! The front desk was wonderful, our room overlooked Fenway Park, and we had a huge room with two large beds and a sitting area as well! The women at the front desk were very friendly, helpful, and very welcoming. If I could live at Hotel Commonwealth, I don't see why I would live anywhere else! ha Book it now. You won't regret it. ( yes the parking is steep, but it is Boston. We paid a little bit more for NYC the next day.)

Reviews.Title: “the dictionary definition of love”
Reviews.Author: NICKVEINO
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in a beautiful part of boston, near all of the shops and restaurants you could ever want. when you arrive with the greetings of the friendly staff eager to answer any questions or concerns you have, and smell the fresh air in the lobby (unlike like stereotypical febreeze fake fruit smell you get in most hotels). The rooms were very clean, and the beds were SO comfy. i will admit i considered locking myself into the room so i could stay forever. The whole building offered tons of privacy, yet made you feel at home. The soaps in the bathroom smelled like heaven. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: bethkelsey
Reviews.Content: We were impressed from the moment the door man, Jeff, greeted us to moment we left the hotel. The staff was professional, concerned about our stay- eager to please us and ensure we were completely satisfied with everything! The room was beautiful and extremely clean and you can't beat the location. I was second guessing my choice because of the expense BEFORE I got there... but now it's the only hotel I want to stay at when we visit our daughter- I dont care how much it costs- IT'S WORTH EVERY PENNY! Thank you Hotel Commonwealth for making our trip to Boston that much more enjoyable- by the way this is the first time I ever felt compelled to write a review! Again- Thank you!!! Bethanne Hollis

Reviews.Title: “Treated my client like family!”
Reviews.Author: abevill
Reviews.Content: We send our clients around the U.S. and are always looking for reputable hotels that will go out of their way to accomodate our client's needs. Due to medical circumstances surrounding the nature of our business, we sometimes have additional needs that we are unable to assist personally with. Having the staff at Hotel Commonwealth step in and take over where we were not physically able, gave my client as well as our agency the peace of mind that no one else previously has even come close to. They treated her like royalty and truly went above and beyond with our requests as well as adding their own special touches without us initiating them. I wouldn't hesitate for a moment to refer Hotel Commonwealth and look forward to staying with them on our next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “"The best hotel experience ever"”
Reviews.Author: 41769Molly
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough great things about the wonderful stay my daughters (10 and 13) had the Hotel Commonwealth. From the time we got our of car to check in to the time we left have never experienced a more friendly, helpful staff. Truly top notch from top to bottom. Room was gorgeous and so comfy. Great location for our Fenway Park trip visit but would stay on any future trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A truly memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: jake123_11
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Commonwealth Hotel while taking in a game at Fenway Park. It is the perfect location for Fenway but it also provides its guests with an excellent hotel experience. The staff is friendly and professional and truly seems to enjoy what they do. We were celebrating a birthday during our stay and they went out of their way to recognize this very special event! The hotel itself is well maintained, offering comfortable and spacious accommodations. The Fenway rooms are great - we had a fantastic view of Fenway Park! All in all I would highly recommend the Commonwealth Hotel - it was truly a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: loretta061
Reviews.Content: We totally lucked out with this hotel. We didn't know much about Boston, but the Commonwealth Hotel was an excellent choice. It is centrally located which made everything easy to get to. The hotel itself is well appointed, very clean and the service was so professional and very pleasant. I will defintiley go back and will recommend the place to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Literally around the corner from Fenway Park, an excellent, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jennym711
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we attend a Sox game. It is conveniently located within like 5 minutes from Fenway Park and countless restaurants. The T station is the next door over so you can really tour Boston easily. Always have a perfect stay! Will be returning in August. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience and location”
Reviews.Author: BucknellWMBU
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston with our incoming BU freshman daughter. This luxurious hotel is conveniently located near the University, Fenway Park and the Kenmore Sq. - T. Our basic room was beautiful, very large, so comfortable and offered everything we needed for our stay. The service staff was very helpful and we had a great dinner at the Oyster Bar. Be Advised: bring your own soap and shampoo because the toiletries are expensive, as well as the mini-bar goodies!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: realitychecknm
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Boston and trusted TripAdvisor's reviews when I reserved a Kenmore room at Hotel Commonwealth. The hotel was clean, the room spacious, security excellent, service wonderful. And it was quiet - very important to me. The T is just a few steps and got us easily into the city proper. Beautiful walk to the Museum of Fine Arts and on Boston U grounds along the river. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: turboapples
Reviews.Content: The property is much nicer than the photos allude to. The staff can only be described as 'wonderful.' We had a room facing Fenway Park on the top floor and it was really great. Computers available are both Apple and Windows (nice touch). Many restaurant choices are available within only one block (the same block or across the street). Gotta return just to try out the Oyster Bar that we ran out of time for. In addition, there is a 711, in case you need something in the middle of the night. We truly enjoyed our stay. We will return and highly recommend this property to others.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: riverview99
Reviews.Content: From the time we pulled up out front to the time we pulled away, we were greeted by an extremely positive and helpful staff. The room was very nice and clean and the view of Fenway Park was great. We came to Boston to go to a Red Sox game and it was great only walking five minutes to the park. Also did some sightseeing and was amazed how close we were to the historic district of Boston. We felt very secure as you had to use your room key just to use the elevator. I would highly recomend the Hotel Commonwealth.

Reviews.Title: “Will return with family on pleasure since business trip was so nice.”
Reviews.Author: Flyfisherman00744
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth on a business trip a few months ago and had a great experience with the hotel being centrally located to lots of activities, the facility being tastefully decorated and extremely clean, and the staff being very friendly. I returned to Boston for a conference being held at a major hotel across the river in Cambridge, and I still decided to stay at the Hotel Commonwealth and commute across the river as I enjoyed my previous stay at Hotel Commonwealth so much. The staff again was extremely friendly and the baseball suit I stayed in was one of the only rooms I have ever stayed in that lured me to remain in the room for a few hours when I could have been out sightseeing due to the cool baseball cards, autographed balls, and other baseball related items. I am anxious to return and stay with my family as my kids will love the feel of the baseball suite and I enjuoy the personalized service delivered by the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here”
Reviews.Author: Brian41466
Reviews.Content: From start to finish the Commonwealth is a treat. Pull up to the curb and they'll take over from there. Check in is quick and relaxing, like the rest of the hotel. No matter what room, it's very quiet, even though you're in the middle of Kenmore Square. The restaurant "Eastern Standard" is another treat for this location. Great bar, nice meal seatings, food and service are a great match. This time around we had a late lunch in their other restaurant "Island Creek". If you like fresh seafood, and fresh oysters, make sure you stop in. All of this, just a 5 minute walk from Fenway, and 5 minute walk from the top of Newbury Street. This is an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: nearbrook
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing, and so helpful with everything. We enjoyed everything about our stay. There was one problem with our TV remote and they took care of that right away, service was very fast when they had to call the engineer to fix things. The bathtub didn't drain too well, but the water pressure was great. I really enjoyed the free-wifi and the ipod hook-ups/charging stations in the room. The bellmen were really great and helpful when asking questions about the town. One draw back was no pool but seriously Boston is such an amazing place, don't spend your time there at the hotel pool.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, Great Location, attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: MMCCnEWjERSEY
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay when in Boston and we will be back. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful. We travel a great deal and this is one of the best hotel staffs we have ever had. The room was lovely and the Eastern Standard Restaurant attached to the hotel is terrific. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff that aims to please!”
Reviews.Author: crisco58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth as our son was going to a summer study program in Boston. Wow, everything about this hotel was top-notch, from the service, cleanliness of rooms and the amazing view of Fenway Park. They really go out of their way to make sure your stay in Boston is a memorable experience. We'd highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karaberg0788
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! Great location to Fenway, subway & restaurants. In a nice, safe area. Beds were extremely comfortable making for a good nights sleep & staff was friendly & accomodating. Room service food was wonderful & reasonably priced. Will definitely stay here again! A must if you're going to a Red Sox game. We booked a Fenway room, so we could see the ball park from our room. A quick hop on the subway took us to the north end where the historical sites & Italian eateries are located. If we're ever back in Boston, we will definitely stay here! Just a note that the bar in the hotel is extremely expensive - much cheaper to drink at a bar right around Fenway Park.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, you must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: maliota
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing as was the service. The room was spacious and immaculate. With daily cleaning service and nightly turndown service we never had to worry about a thing. The bathroom was not only beautiful but had all the ammenities. The location was jsut a few blocks from Fenway and a short walk to shopping and dinning, not to mention along one of the prettiest blocks in Boston. As if that wasn't enough you are just a few blocks away from the Charles River. Couldn't have been more thrilled with the experience and we cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations in every way!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel23451
Reviews.Content: Great stay from the minute we arrived and valet took the car to the doorman who treated us like old friends to the front desk who asked about our plans and then sent up a welcome packet specifically tailored to us. Requests for the car were easy and super quick. The customer service ethic here is above and beyond. Room was beautiful and extremely comfortable. Room service was prompt and delicious. Eastern Standard for cocktails and dinner was fantastic, worth every penny. Would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, would return for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Peg13lrc
Reviews.Content: Nick and Franky were great door men/bellmen. They were friendly and kind. They helped us a great deal with information around the city. The night time front desk, Jeff was a great help as well. This place was clean and friendly! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Trip #2 to the Commonwealth - wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: BWolfenson
Reviews.Content: We are a Philly-based family of rabid Red Sox fans. A few years ago we decided to goto Boston and see a game at Fenway Park. After some thorough research, we found that the Commonwealth Hotel was the nicest hotel with the closest proximity to the park. We stayed there for a few nights and had a great time. So, when it was time to plan another trip to Boston, we went straight to the Commonwealth. Our experience was just as good as the first. We stay in the "Fenway Park" rooms, which give a great view of the stadium right across the street. We had two adjacent rooms (my wife and I in one, kids in another). I have to say, knowing how loud my kids are, the rooms are very well sound-proofed as we did not hear a peep. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The staff was amazingly nice and helpful (restaraunts, kids' activities, etc...). The excercise facility is not the biggest in the world, but has all the basic equipment, all in good shape. From a proximity perspective, if you are interested in being near Fenway, you can't beat this hotel. Right out the front door through Kenmore Square, over the bridge along with the rest of the people going to the game (a very fun atmosphere) and you are at the stadium in less than 5 minutes. I have a ritual of running along Commonwealth Ave in the mornings, which is a beautiful run within a scultpure garden along the way to Boston Public Garden. If you keep on going, you hit Fanieul Hall and then the aquarium and the Italian section of town. Of course, you can hop on the Green Line T at the station just a few steps away from the hotel and go basically anywhere. Very reasonably priced, this is the only hotel for our family when we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we all will return again...we have already made our plans”
Reviews.Author: frankie054
Reviews.Content: From the door man "Franke" to all the extra special features it was a perfect stay. we did not mind tiping everyone because they all were so very helpful to all of us.We loved the location and their dining. Everything was perfect from start to finish. We all cannont wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Maine800
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth exceeded all of our expectations! The staff was professional and went out of their way, our room was spotless and spacious, the proximity to Fenway could not be beat! We stopped in the Oyster Bar to have cocktails and an appetizer before heading over the the Red Sox game and ended up staying for dinner and it was delicious! Breakfast outside at Eastern Standard was the perfect way to wrap up our stay. We travel extensively and this hotel is top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Establishment”
Reviews.Author: thorvald16
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel. Outstanding staff...unfailingly friendly and helpful. Very nice rooms...clean...well appointed and well maintained. I was there with my wife to make our first trip to Fenway Park, and things could not have gone better. There are two restaurants attached to the hotel...a seafood place and another which was more of a traditional meat & potatoes kind of place. I ate in both and thought they were quite good. I just can't say enough about this hotel. I found it on the internet, and sometimes when you do that, you come away disappointed to some degree. This time, I feel like I got all kinds of lucky! Once you figure in all the tax, I paid about $300 a night, so it's not cheap, but in the world of first class hotels, I thought that was a very agreeable price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: shoshanasmom012
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling to Boston for almost 20 years and have generally stayed at Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons but I have to tell you that the customer service and rooms here far surpassed and experience I've had in a hotel in Boston in years! It took me almost 7 hours to drive to Boston from NJ (it was the most grueling trip I've had yet due to horrific traffic) and I was fit to be tied when I arrived. The staff at Hotel Commonwealth were so kind, empathic, professional and helpful that I couldn't stay upset about my long car ride. They gave my daughter and I a gorgeous room on a low floor, which we requested and immediately got us into one of the restaurants on their premises, a seafood place that was wonderful. From concierge to management to front desk people, the customer service was nothing short of unbelievable. We are returning again with my husband at the end of July. From a hugely picky traveller, please be assured that this is a wonderful hotel where you will be made to feel more comfortable than you every would have imagined, or I can say that we certainly were!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: mattrney
Reviews.Content: Great service, amazing restaurants, and great rooms. It was a perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, friendly people, clean rooms,very comfortable. We will return!!”
Reviews.Author: booksri
Reviews.Content: We randomly choose this hotel because it was within walking distance to Fenway Park. We were very happy with our choice and we will return. It was very clean and employees were very nice and and very helpful. It is decorated beautifully and the rooms are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We were meant to feel like the most important guests in the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rscalise
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay. The staff treated us like the most important guests in the hotel. We travel with our bulldog puppy and they were very helpful in finding a pet sitting service for us while we were sight-seeing during the day. We had the opportunity to eat in both restaurants and both the food and service was top notch. The location was also a plus: walking distance to Fenway Park & Newbery Street with a T stop right in front of the hotel. We will definitely be back for our next stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: PAB3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed two nights at this lovely hotel. The rooms were spacious, the bed huge and comfortable and the bathroom lovely.It is a great place to stay if you are going to a game at Fenway Park.Staff very friendly and helpful. New Oyster Bar downstairs is great.

Reviews.Title: “We were blown away by everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda2929
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we were greeted by smiling faces and prompt service. The room was so clean and had the best pillows! It was quiet and relaxing and anything we needed was a phone call away. The food at the restaraunts was incredible from the appitizers to the drinks to the breakfast. The staff was equally as friendly and attentive. We were on a 3 day break from reality as we never get away and couldn't have been more pleased. If you want to treat yourself to a little bit of heaven stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. You won't regret it I promise.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: lectrongrl
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. From the friendly, professional service at the front desk. to the concierge assistance to the extraordinary Eastern Standard restaurant, this was a five star stay. They say first impressions are important, and I have to confirm, the front desk employees set the bar high. We'll be back, Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was wonderful and we plan to stay there when we come back to Boston.”
Reviews.Author: judyf5304
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located to Fenway. Our room was nicely decorated, clean, and comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. A great travel experience!

Reviews.Title: “A wealth of service which is anything BUT common.”
Reviews.Author: Alfonsus_Bluepenny
Reviews.Content: We searched for bars and found none better; we searched for food and found none better; a beautiful room and excellent service. Search no more.

Reviews.Title: “Solid stay”
Reviews.Author: ehsim
Reviews.Content: Terrific staff and great location. Would stay here again for sure. Only thing that was irritating is that we had a Fenway view room which really turned out to be a view of the scoreboard. Perhaps it would have been a real view if we were on a higher floor. But since we didn't spend much time there and there wasn't a game that evening it wasn't a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accommodations, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Kelmarie1024
Reviews.Content: Had such a great time! Everyone was so friendly and accommodation- the staff truly went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay. The location and views were amazing and the decor and rooms were so classy and elegant... Definitely the perfect place to get ready before a wedding!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KNK-Simon
Reviews.Content: Sad to say, we are flying back from Boston as I type this review. Our stay at Hotel Commonwealth was exemplary. As others have stated, the staff is all very attentive. We had a "junior suite". Aside from a shower that had the force of a fire hose (seriously) the room was amazing! Super quiet and comfortable, especially the bed which I never wanted to get out of. Also worth noting: the drinks next door at the Eastern Standard are amazing and the hotel is very convenient to the Kenmore T-Stop (Green Line) and Fenway Park.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service”
Reviews.Author: Theresa117
Reviews.Content: From the moment I drove up until I drove away everyone had a smile on their face and extremely friendly. The hotel and my room was so beautiful, comfortable and clean. It was my first time there, but it will not become my Boston Hotel. A big thank you to Shane and Jeff. Great Guys!!

Reviews.Title: “I can not praise the Hotel Commonwealth enough.”
Reviews.Author: mwp23
Reviews.Content: I am an university medical researcher and I travel a lot professionally. I was in Boston recently and stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth. Here is an excerpt of an e-mail that I sent to the hotel concierge (who was extremely pleasant and helpful making dinner reservations for my group): "My room was spacious, the bed extremely comfortable, and most importantly the room was insular from any noise from the hallway or adjoining rooms. My colleagues raved the same and all of us wished more hotels were like the Hotel Commonwealth. I am sure I will stay there again and will pass along my recommendation to family, friends and other colleagues."

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: RockyWood1959
Reviews.Content: What a great location - right above the Subway line; 5 minutes walk from Fenway Park. Staff are the most professional and friendly I have ever come across in 33 years of world travel. The Business Ctr needs to be larger - two PCs constantly being used by people who wont hand them over. The rooms are unbelievably luxurious, the beds comfortable and restful. Strange situation with no restaurant, but a set of internal stairs leads to an external restaurant from which you can bill back to you room. Dinner excellent but be dead sure not to have breakfast there - its woeful food and coffee, embrassing really. So, if you want to stay in Boston this hotel is tremendous

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: KWinOKC
Reviews.Content: When we are in Boston, we only stay at the Commonwealth. From Frank who greets us at the door and helps us with directions, to Nick who brings our bags up, to Josh our concierge par excellence, to Mike Curtin at Eastern Standard, the staff has an outstanding attention to detail and customer service. This hotel has the most polite and well trained staff of anywhere we have stayed. Congratulations to all the staff at Hotel Commonwealth.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CCLife
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Can't wait to go back. Beautiful room, attentive staff, Fresh amenities, and a fantastic meal at Eastern Standard. Complimentary room upgrade upon check in was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: My second stay at Hotel Commonwealth and it is still as wonderful as it was in April. Staff is very friendly, service is speedy and gracious and the bed is as comfy as can be. My daughter starts at B.U. in the Fall, and I'm so excited to have found a great hotel right next to the campus.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Critiqued4U
Reviews.Content: The doorman, bellman and front desk service all added to the pleasant ambiance of our check-in experince. The lobby had a quality of old fashioned luxury with a modern flair. Even on an overcast day, the hotel seemed bright, clean and fresh. I didn't inspect the baseboards and corners, but I had the impression there would be no dust accumulation even thorugh this was an older building. The rooms were also fresh and clean. I felt I could safely walk on the clean carpet barefoot. The pillows were wonderful. The bathroom sparkled, everything appeared new, including the lighted magnifying make-up mrror. The in-room coffee service was Kurig, brought by the bellman after an inquirey regarding our interest. There were a few little slip-ups: On arrival, we had shower gel, but no soap. No cream rinse or mouthwash was provided, so we had to buy these items and leave them behind due to airport rules. Soap was left in our room for day two. And coffee supllies with the Kurig were ample for one day, but only replenished after a call for the second day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: enviro011
Reviews.Content: Although not quite as close to the center of Boston as I had thought, the hotel was wonderful. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful; I had to stay another day and they were most accommodating. The breakfast was delicious too. I was surprised at how quiet the hotel was despite being near the Interstate.

Reviews.Title: “one of our most enjoyable stays in Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: rsukolsky
Reviews.Content: Our experience was wonderful from the moment we pulled to the curb until the time our car ws brought to us and we were assisted on our way. The accommodations for the price was well worth the visit. We'll be coming back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MassTraveler
Reviews.Content: Attended a business meeting at the hotel including an overnight stay. Right at Kenmore Square. We walked to Fenway Park for a Sox game in the evening. Rooms were nice and spacious. Service was very good. Staff friendly and helpful. And you cannot beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, decor, location...we will definitely stay again when we return to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: haveSheriwilltravel
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was within walking distance to Boston University. The hotel itself has been completely refurnished and is in wonderful shape. I love the Frette linens on the beds. The in-house bath products are made by Fresh, one of my favorite bath products. I left some clothes in the room after I checked out and the hotel sent them back to me at my home. There are two restaurants on the premises. The Island Creek Oyster Bar was really a hit for the evening...many varieties of fresh oysters and great clam chowder. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and brought us six varieties of oysters. Everything he told us about the flavors of the oysters was correct! A very fun culinary experience. Eastern Standard was very tasty for breakfast. The morning coffee bar serves a delicious Illy coffee.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: skykinggoshenky
Reviews.Content: this is by far the nicest hotel i have stayed in. from the door man to front desk, everyone was wonderful. i spent at least half the year on the road, and you are the best. hilton, marriott and sheraton could learn a lot from you. thanks again and see you next year. go soxs

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great in all respsects. We cannot wait to visit again.”
Reviews.Author: Michael5253
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Commonwealth was absolutely wonderful in all respects. The hotel staff was attentive, professional, friendly & helpful. The service we received from the hotel staff was absolutely first class. The staff always greated us by name & with a smile & responded to all requests for assistance promptly & professionally. They did everything they could to insure that our stay at the hotel was a wonderful experience & they succeeded with flying colors. We had two Fenway Rooms which were absolutely wonderful. We were in Boston for the weekend to go to a couple Red Sox games & being able to sit our rooms & look out at Fenway Park only enhanced our overall baseball experience. For any baseball fan, young or old, it is an absolute treat & thrill to be able to sit in your hotel room & look out at Fenway Park. The fact that the hotel is a five minute walk to Fenway made going to the games incredibly easy & a wonderful experience. The hotel is also within walking distance to the great restaurants & stores on Newbury Street. That being said, the two restaurants in the hotel, Eastern Standard & Island Creek Oyster Bar, are both great. We ate at Eastern Standard this trip & at Island Creek Oyster Bar during our prior visit. The rooms at the hotel are large & very clean & comfortable. The water presure in the showers is great! All in all, our experience at the Hotel Commonwealth could not have been any better. The accommodations & amenities were great, but the staff was even better. An absolutey first rate operation in all respects. We cannot wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for Fenway Park Games”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelers68
Reviews.Content: Great staff!! Always helpful in pointing us in the right direction for whatever excursion we had planned. An unexpected birthday gift was left in our room with a card signed by all staff members. Very nice touch!! Will always consider the Hotel Commonwealth when traveling back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A nice splurge”
Reviews.Author: kerpb
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location ! Pricey but worth it as we have paid more in downtown Boston and gotten a lot less. Great Oyster Bar, all staff very courteous, will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: cmcathome
Reviews.Content: We were recently in town for a Redsox game with another couple. We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth that night after the game. It was so convenient, elegant, and quiet. It was so nice to just come back after supper and relax in our livingroom watching TV(and the fireworks on the Charles). We had breakfast downstairs it was wonderful, great food, great service, and beautifully decorated. I would recommend this hotel to anyone comming to the Fenway area( if they can afford too). The Valet Parking was so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, comfortable, generous”
Reviews.Author: JohnMcA
Reviews.Content: Comfortable sheets, plenty of good towels. very roomy, good location (write over the subway), good water pressure...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - clean, courteous and convenient”
Reviews.Author: fjmgem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth while attending a conference and it was a great place. The staff was friendly, the hotel rooms were clean and it was conveniently located to Boston University, Fenway Park and other local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time as always”
Reviews.Author: Torcboy
Reviews.Content: We come out to Boston every June for the Gay Pride festivities. Every year but one we stay at the Hotel Commonwealth and have a really excellent stay. Super service. Wonderful classy rooms. Near everything we need. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: ShelOt
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I came into the city for a concert at Fenway Park. This is THE hotel to stay at when going to the Fenway area. Everything from reservations to check out was top notch. The valet and check in staff were very friendly and helpful. Even the gentleman who assisted us with turn down service was friendly. I look forward to returning again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: DavidHaup
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Commonwealth for fifth time all on business. It is a class hotel, feels very homey and comfortable. Staff is amazing and friendly. Feel like I know them as friends. Price is not the cheapest but good value. Love it and will be back!! only negative, $42 to park car for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Cowboygin
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for 2 nights. From the moment we hit the carpet at the front door the hotel the employee's were outstanding. They were so nice and helpful. We had a Fenway room and couldn't have been happier with the view. . The only con was the room was very dated, old carpet and furniture. The bed was very comfortable tho. Would we stay there again? Maybe, price being the deciding factor. If in town for another Red Sox game we may try other nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Boston or maybe anywhere”
Reviews.Author: dmcack
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth in Boston just about every time we travel to Boston. The hotel is quiet (while being located on a main street), safe and the location is great, within walking distance to Fenway Park, shopping in the Back Bay and local hospitals. And if you're not into walking, the T is located just below the hotel. We've stayed for Red Sox games, New Year's Eve and recently for a few days before and after surgery. While the rooms are great and the bed is so comfortable, it's the staff that makes this my favorite hotel. From the valet, to the excellent doormen (Z and Frankie), to the front desk and everyone else that works at the hotel, they are some of the best in the business. Always friendly and helpful, with a kind word and a laugh, every hotel should be so lucky to employ a staff like this. During our recent stay during which I was to have surgery, we got into Boston about 4 hours before check-in, and while this wouldn't be normal practice, they let us check into our room early where they had already placed the microwave and refrigerator that I had requested. And when they found out that I was to have surgery the next day, they called the room a few times to make sure I was comfortable and scheduled the hotel car to bring us to the hospital the next morning!! They asked my husband for updates while I was in the hospital and went out of their way to be so nice upon my return. One last thing, upon our departure from the hotel, we forgot our keys with the valet (I had the extra key fob in my purse) and the manager (thank you Shane) tracked us down and offered to drive the keys to us (at least an hour away), knowing that we live on an island and would be catching the ferry home soon. We declined since we had the extra set on us but we had the keys in our possession in a few days. You can see why this is my favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Fenway Trip”
Reviews.Author: Ambiepony
Reviews.Content: I'd been in to the restaurant quite a few times before (the Eastern Standard is always great), but it was my first stay at the hotel. The service was excellent and the room was wonderful; the highlight was the view of Fenway. Fantastic! Would highly recommend for your time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurants good, room service bad . . .”
Reviews.Author: CitasDash
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel because I had really enjoyed its 2 restaurants on previous trips. It is close to Fenway, but also close to the freeway so you get a lot of vibration in the hotel. The room was fine, good space, okay furnishings, bathroom was good size, room service horrible. You can get a good rate at this hotel, and you will probably sleep fine, just remember to go downstairs for your meals. The oyster bar restaurant is especially good.

Reviews.Title: “Red Sox Trip”
Reviews.Author: Orr1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenietly located for baseball games, shopping, eating. Fenway Park is 5 minute walk from hotel. You can walk just about anywhere historic from the hotel. There is a T subway train stop right beside hotel. The staff and service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and cannot wait to return”
Reviews.Author: CherylCDW
Reviews.Content: Great location and most of hotel staff very friendly. The front desk very responsive to special requests. We only wish there was in room or complimentary coffee or tea at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cressly
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was fabulous. We loved it and we'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, next to T; great staff; lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: RonDelAgua
Reviews.Content: Really great restaurants associated with hotel; easy access to anywhere in Boston; wonderful walking neighborhoods nearby; Fenway Park 5 minute walk; Commonwealth Rooms have separate sitting area. When checking in, asked what brought us to Boston...40th anniversary. Found champagne & chocolates in our room that night. Every restaurant concierge booked for us, we were congratulated. Thoughtful and helpful staff at every level!!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: RPayne69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. If you're going to a game at Fenway, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best”
Reviews.Author: gmillertime
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth several times and will do so every chance I get. Excellent facility, great location, and friendly, professional , courteous staff .

Reviews.Title: “Best Boston hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: NDH430
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth is reliably excellent time after time. Rooms spacious, well-decorated, and spotless. Every technology need met, including charging pad for phones, iPods, etc. iPod dock. I stay here 3 - 4 times a year for business, and now stay here for personal travel as well as I am a Red Sox fan and Fenway Park is just steps away. Easy access to public transportation and lots to do in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Next to Fenway, Convenient, and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Canteena
Reviews.Content: Thank Goodness we stayed here. I have never been to Boston so I wasnâ€™t sure what neighborhood to book our hotel in. I couldnâ€™t have picked a better location. We were within walking distance to Fenway Park and Boston U. The T-Line located right outside the hotel. Staff was friendly. Hotel was beautiful. Room was large and comfortable and quiet. Take a moment to look at the gallery of art in the hall leading from the lobby to the restaurant, beautiful photography. The only downside we couldnâ€™t find any good breakfast place nearby (we tried the hotelâ€™s restaurant â€“ too expensive for a fried egg). We resolved this by getting on the T and went to another neighborhood. My tips to you for your Boston Vacation: Wear comfortable shoes and bring a spare to switch to. Ever hear that Boston is the â€œwalking cityâ€�? No think about all the uneven cobblestones that you will be walking on. Get a Charlie Card (pass for T line) â€“ Unlimited travel on subway, local bus, and commuter rail for $15.00 a week. We took this directly from the airport to our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: bella123108
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within walking distance to Fenway Park which was exactly what we wnated since we had tickets for the baseball game that night. The staff was friendly and extremely accommodating.We needed a refigerator brought to our room 10 minutes before the ball game started; the front desk said they would have it to our room in 5 minutes and they did! Excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Boston”
Reviews.Author: eileenkb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Commonwealth for 4 nights and 5 days and what a pleasant surprise it was! From the moment we pulled up to the front door to the moment we pulled away to return home, our experience with the Commonwealth was first-class! To begin with, the bellmen were helpful, friendly and professional. When we got to our room, we needed ice for our cooler and the bellman offered to fill it without us asking. The room was beautifully decorated including the art work, window treatments, furniture and bedding. Immaculate condition! We stayed in a Junior suite and enjoyed the separate sitting room, with the curtain for privacy, if needed. The bed was very comforable and loaded with extra pillows. The bathroom was spacious, very clean, and equiped with everything we needed including bathrobes and a hair dryer. Check in was a wonderful experience as well. Everyone was very friendly, helpful and always gave us a smile or greeted us each and every time we passed by during our stay. The hotel is conveniently located near Fenway Park, only a 5 minute walk to a game, and right near a T subway stop so it was easy to get into town. If you are thinking of staying in Boston, and want a quality hotel for a nice price, look no further than the Commonwealth: The best kept secret in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: OrtepBA
Reviews.Content: A hotel that just oozes Old World charm and elegance, but at the same time is warm and inviting in an intimate, friendly way. The front desk staff, concierge, doormen, and valet parking staff are unfailingly polite and helpful. Having two wonderful restaurants located adjacent to the hotel is an added bonus. My significant other and I stayed in a junior suite, which was beautifully appointed and had a very comfortable bed. Best of all, it was totally soundproof -- you'd never know busy Kenmore Square was just 4 floors below. Having the subway station located very close by also makes it easy to access the other areas of Boston that you might like to visit during your stay. We had beautiful weather during our stay so opted to take a very pleasant stroll all the way from the hotel to the North End, passing along Newbury St. and through the Public Garden on our way. We're looking forward to staying at the Hotel Commonwealth on many more occasions and would highly recommend it! Our only word of caution is that valet parking is the only practical choice and it is a bit pricey at $42 per night.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, fabulous views, and attentive staff. 5 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: echorton
Reviews.Content: We had our small wedding reception at the Hotel Commonwealth and all of our guests stayed there (including us) as well. The food, which was provided by the neighboring Eastern Standard, was phenomenal, as were the staff, who ensured that everything went smoothly throughout our ceremony and reception without being intrusive in any way. All other staff--from valets to reservations to bellhops--were exceptionally friendly and helpful, even with our multiple special requests. The room in which we stayed had a lovely view of Kenmore Square (we heard that some of the other rooms offered spectacular views of Fenway Park!). The room was impeccably clean, beautifully decorated, and had a palatial bathroom with a huge spa tub and well-lit make-up table. Although we were in the middle of all the action that Boston has to offer, the room was almost completely sound proof and the curtains blacked out 99% of the outside lights--we slept like babies. Overall, we'd highly recommend this hotel for a small event or for a Boston vacation. It truly deserves all of the accolades it has received from various travel mags.

Reviews.Title: “Great room; easy walk to restaurants, subway, grocery.”
Reviews.Author: cindy98075
Reviews.Content: The room was large, comfortable and clean. The hotel is right next door to the subway entrance and a taxi stand is out front. Doorman was great and very knowlegeable about what was close by. Easy walk to lots of restaurants, a small grocery and very safe neighborhood. Bus terminal is across the street. Fenway Park is right behind the hotel as is the House of Blues. Despite this, not noisy at night. Would definitely stay again. Parking is steep ($42 per day.)

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ctroi1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we puilled up to Hotel Commonwealth, to our departure the next day, we were treated with friendly, courteous service. We had an appointment after check-out so we left our bags with the bellman who tagged them and stored them safely for us. When we returned, our bags and car were promptly retrieved. The jr suite was very spacious, clean and comfortable We will definetely recommend Hotel Commonwealth to our friends, and will stay there during our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was as it should be.”
Reviews.Author: rmpatek
Reviews.Content: Top to bottom, the hotel experience was outstanding. The concierge staff was attentive and helpful and spot on with recommendations. The hotel was quiet and the beds were extremely comfortable. The staff was very professional, friendly and extremely helpful. We will recommend it highly and will make it our destination hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Fenway, MFA, Newbury St., and sleep in the lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: robinr1070
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Boston to see the Chicago Cubs play the Red Sox at Fenway. A travel agent recommended the Hotel Commonwealth because it is walking distance to the ballpark. It completely exceeded our expectations. We had a huge, gorgeous corner room with tons of windows, a sitting area, desk, and big lovely bathroom. Everything was impeccable: the staff was friendly and helpful, the Fresh brand toiletries were a treat, and we even got a little chocolate cookie at turndown. It was also a bonus that the hotel is attached to the classic Eastern Standard -- named this month in Esquire's "Best Bars in America." We also had terrific drinks and appetizers at Island Creek Oyster Bar -- a modern place with a friendly staff. The hotel is in a terrific location. We walked to the charming shops on Newbury Street, and also to the Museum of Fine Art, where we saw an amazing Chihuly exhibit. Boston hotels are expensive, and this one was no exception. We got a better rate through an online travel agent. We thought it was completely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: fotochik22
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth was a sheer pleasure from the moment we pulled up out front. Absolutely beautiful hotel. Fabulous room with a view of the Citgo sign. Choices of 2 fantastic restaurants and a wonderful photographjy gallery, Panopticon Gallery (stop by and see Jason Landry, he is a great guy). My next trip to Boston will definitely be hosted by the Hotel Commonwealth. I highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “A Boston Jewel”
Reviews.Author: rosinapell
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small, clean and well located hotel this is the one. I had events at BC which having the T a few steps away was amazing. The walk by Fenway Park, through a park and ending at the Museum for Fine Arts was fabulous. I wish I would have discovered this lovely hotel four years ago. Do not recommend the Hotel restaurant, but the one next door is very nice and always full.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: Brancy7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Commonwealth during the occasion of my daughter's graduation from Boston University. Despite the hectic environment of the city and environment, the staff was extremely courteous and extremely accommodating. The manager of the front desk went out of his way to make sure all of our rooms were perfect. The accommodations/rooms were superior. He was extremely polite, courteous , helpful and made our weekend so positive. He is terrific. Additionally, the bell staff, doormen, and front desk were all terrific. I have always had a positive experience at the Commonwealth, but this trip was more important to our family as we had many days to stay there and also a graduation to manage. This small, boutique hotel has always been directed towards delivering excellent service to it's guests and I have to say- the goal was certainly met and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mdck2
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel online. We weren't sure what to expect but we were very happy once we arrived. The room was clean and very nicely decorated. The two restaurants we very nice. We would definitely go back again. I would highly recommend it if you are going to a game at Fenway or want to shop on Newbury Street. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our exspectations”
Reviews.Author: Phil_Anita
Reviews.Content: Every hotel we stay at in the future will be compared to the Hotel Commonwealth. Absolute luxury! My wife and I are not used to being treated like we're special. A member of the staff named Tim always greeted us by name, and took the time to chat, and he gave us great suggestions of places to visit or eat in the nearby area. On out way back from Fenway Park, while everyone else was waiting in line to get on the T, we just walked a few feet and had the door opened for us to a beautiful hotel. Like Tim, everyone in the hotel was so friendly, and made us feel so welcome. A special thanks to the concierge, on the morning that we checked out I realized that I had left credit card at a nearby restaurant. She promptly called the restaurant, confirmed it was there, and made arrangements to have it picked up. We can't wait to plan our next trip to Boston, so we can stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. You get what you pay for! It's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN BOSTON!!”
Reviews.Author: AWT1897
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing experience at Hotel Commonwealth. The service was outstanding and the rooms were spacious, clean, and elegant. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible opportunity to feel pampered, every detail made me feel wanted!”
Reviews.Author: crahlborn
Reviews.Content: The space is beautiful, the location is perfect, everyone made us feel special and that it made a difference that we stayed there. Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Family or Business”
Reviews.Author: MMR08
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Hotel Commonwealth. Traveling with our infant, we need a hotel that is service-oriented and friendly. And we found that with Hotel Commonwealth. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The location is excellent with 2 wonderful restaurants adjacent to the property. We will be returning to Hotel Commonwealth for our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: greys123
Reviews.Content: my sister and i traveled to boston to go to fenway park, we were greeted by a most friendly staff, our rooms were spacious and clean there were \docks for i phone and ipods 2 a desk with plenty of outlets and usb 's. the shampoo and soap was wonderful the turn down service was a nice extra touch. The beds were very comfortable and we were tickled by being able to see literally into the park from our room. we walked to shopping which the concierge was gracious enough to give us brochures for indoor and outdoor shopping.We will definatly stay in this hotel again when traveling to Boston, only the weather did not comply. '

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: bonbon527
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel, great showers, bedding, and large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buck60_Ogunquit
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth on three different occasions. Each time has been a pleasure. From the moment I arrived at the door, the door, bell and valet service is smiling, welcoming and pleasant. checking in is a breeze and the staff friendly and gracious. Room service was also on time ( if they gave me a time frame, they matched it) and also very pleasant to deal with. also, I am a single woman and safety is always an issue for me. I not only felt incredibly safe in this hotel....after a few nights...I felt like I was with family. the staff called me by my name and there "good nights" when i arrived home each evening were quite wonderful. I think this hotel is one of the best I have stayed in and I travel A LOT!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: bjoy408
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is perfect! The service begins as soon as you drive up, and continues through your whole stay! The doormen, the front desk staff, the cleaning ladies, they are all impeccable. The morning room service coffee is delicious! Don't miss out on the incredible restaurants either. Eastern Standard and Island Creek Oyster Bar are first class. Their food, wine lists and service are a perfect fit for a perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very charming, romantic and the service is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLeslie_22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth due to its proximity to Boston University where our daughter is a student. The hotel is very charming and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. This is real old-world boutique hotel with all the updates and modern conveniences. The room was a comfortable size, there was a new flat screen tv, a very comfortable bed and newly updated bathroom with excellent products. It was a great experience and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly the best experience always!”
Reviews.Author: Creasians
Reviews.Content: Because of work, I travel to Boston twice a month and stay at this amazing place. This is not just comfortable but everything about this place is unmatched. The service, the luxury, the rooms and the amenities: a class apart! If i were to pick up on something, it would be the internet connectivity which becomes overloaded and unreachable with the number of guests lodged.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet suite”
Reviews.Author: doliver1949
Reviews.Content: Elegant room, spacious seating area, king bed, generous bathroom. Better than home.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel in Kenmore Square”
Reviews.Author: Playaneuron
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth is a Kenmore Square, at the Kenmore Square T station, across the street from the Citgo sign. The hotel has a great staff, comfortable Junior suite rooms with a nice separation between bed and work area, comfortable bed, and a wonderful location. A few quibbles - the breakfast in the hotel restaurant was not great, and the hotel sold better coffee in the corridor. I ate breakfast once and was the only person in the restaurant lat 8:00 AM - I guess others felt the same. There is, luckily, a Dunkin' Donuts on the same block. There was no coffee maker in the room. There is a little fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nj12345
Reviews.Content: I travel to boston 3 or 4 times per year and this is my favorite place to stay. The staff is very helpful. The rooms are very nice and always clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth is a beautiful hotel and has wonderful, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: vnoyeslnl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth is a beautiful hotel and has wonderful, friendly staff. The staff were very attentive and the room was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: JayJayZee
Reviews.Content: Thank you for Hotel Commonwealth for making an Excellent 'home base' for a weekend full of friends and fun. It was close to beautiful parks, fun lively bars and restaurants, easy transportation options, and great shopping. The Concierges, Sales Staff, front desk staff were highly attentive and responsive to all our needs. Our Commonwealth Suite was large, spacious with every ammenity we could ever need, including a great night's sleep. We enjoyed the food at Eastern Standard for Brunch very much, especially the cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: acerasi
Reviews.Content: I very much appreciated the front desk calling the room - I believe her name is Anika - and asking how i liked it. That was something extra, and it was a nice gesture. She was very helpful in getting me a room on a Friday afternoon, and ensuring my stay was as comfortable as I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Paul34731
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked into this hotel, it was a great experience. The entire hotel staff couldn't have been nicer, more accommodating & helpful. The rooms were immaculate. The beds were comfortable & the bathroom was beautiful. The location was centrally located to everything we did. There wasn't one thing we didn't like about this hotel. We would definitely stay there again in the future. Best hotel experience ever & would highly recommend it to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: travelingwannabe13
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel many times these past few years visiting with our daughter. With her continuing studies at Boston University and our son soon starting at Tufts University, we look forward to many future stays at this wonderful hotel. We are always welcomed with excellent hospitality, friendly and informed staff, and top amenities. The rooms are very spacious and clean with all up to date amenities- I especially love the convenience of the charging dock. The new restaurant on site, the Island Creek Oyster Bar, is an added bonus serving fabulous food in an atmosphere of casual sophistication!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: flflowers
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have been visiting colleges therefore traveling a lot this year and I have to say this was our best hotel experience yet! Beautiful little hotel close to everything in Boston. The lobby was inviting, food delicious and the staff very friendly , upbeat and professional. We will stay here again soon since our daughter has decided to attend Boston University!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: summersoff
Reviews.Content: We often stayed that the Hotel Commonwealth when visiting our daughter at BU. Our stay during Marathon weekend was fabulous. Our son had booked accomodations outside of the city, and then asked us to inquire about an available room at the Commonwealth. A suite was available and we stayed in the beautiful suite for a mere $100 more than the other rooms we had booked. Our other 2 rooms were exactly as we requested and, of course, beautiful!! Prior to the marathon, we were asked if we wanted a custom complimentary sign for the window! The day of the marathon provided beautiful views as well as complimentary sports drinks and bananas. We have always had wonderful food and service at Eastern Standard restaurant & were pleased that 3 years later it remained high quality. The Oyster restaurant was fantastic as well, as was it's late night bar. My sister's room had a view of Fenway Park and she was thrilled. Loved the We will return next time we are in Boston! Thank you for a wonderful stay; so happy the high quality remains!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LMD24
Reviews.Content: Great place in a beautiful location and really nice staff. Also, two great restaurants on either side of the hotel. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “"easy, nice, quiet!”
Reviews.Author: filippob50
Reviews.Content: easy. accomodation was good both restaurants are nice. fitnees room could be improved ( no spa ?)

Reviews.Title: “Simply a superb urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: tedhistory
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived, from the care of the doorman and car attendant, a marvelous Front Office Manger Ryan Burns who extended every possible courtesy, Nancy and I totally love the warm friendly atmosphere, meticulous tasteful rooms, two wonderful restaurants right in the building, and the proximity to Fenway Park. We make this trip three or four times a year from Connecticut and marvel at the fact that one Hotel can be consistently excellent in every phase of evaluation. It is one of the nation's great hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calibre57
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We stayed here for the Columbus day weekend as a get-away. The front desk and concierge service is top-notch. They go out of their way to make their guests feel welcome. The rooms are fabulous for a big city hotel. Spacious, attractive and spotless. Wonderful queen beds in the double room that we stayed at with our college student daugther. We ate two meals and had outdoor cocktails at the attached restaurant because we enjoyed it so much. Cannot say enough good things about the Commonwealth. Hats off for hotel management and staff hospitality done well~!

Reviews.Title: “Thanx for making us feel so special, from start to finish!!”
Reviews.Author: StevenKSouthDennis
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Hotel Commonwealth. The only problem (which isn't really a problem) was that we thought parking was included in our fee. We were surprised to learn that it was extra.

Reviews.Title: “A FAMILY HOMERUN AT THE HOTEL COMMONWEALTH”
Reviews.Author: TASKNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Our April 30th stay with our married daughters and their families was a homerun memory for our family! The adults and the children thoroughly enjoyed the wonderful accomodations and the luxurious amenities. The cookies and milk with the welcoming baseball-themed gift bags that greeted the 4 children were a thrill. The Sox may have lost the game, but the Keating grandchildren were winners! A sincere thank you to the Commonwealth staff for a wonderful, family experience. You're the best! Looking forward to our next visit, Susan and Tom Keating, Monroe, NJ.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been happier with choice!”
Reviews.Author: goseeg
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel online and it exceeded my expectations! Do not miss the Oyster House Restaurant. The combination of beautiful decor, fabulous beds and an outstanding restaurant made this visit memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all around hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: economytraveler59
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Hotel Commonwealth several times and will be back every time we visit our son at Boston University. Good for any visit to Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: telegirl68
Reviews.Content: I picked this place because of great reviews on TripAdvisor. I was there to pick up my daughter from the Berklee summer program, and to visit colleagues there as well. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Berklee, and quite close to BU. I got a very good rate by calling the hotel to book. The room was spacious, pretty, clean, comfortable, with very nice linens and toiletries. It was also quiet. I think they had free internet, but I always bring my little hotspot, so I'm not positive. The staff were fantastic, polite and helpful without being icky. In the morning, I walked across the street to barnes and noble, had a latte and read the paper. I loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I travel a lot and my stay at Hotel Commonwealth was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Markwell5
Reviews.Content: Every aspect (service, cleanliness, food, location, etc) of the Hotel Commonwealth (HC)is great. I have been to Boston many times but my first stay at HC makes me want to not stay anywhere else on my return. The staff are so courteous and friendly. The food at Eastern Standard was excellent. The rooms are the best too..comfortable beds, clean and spacious. Great location at Kenmore Square too. Boston is a great city and HC made it even better. I travel a lot for work so I feel I am a bit of a critic on accomodations. You can't go wrong by staying at HC.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: genkinice
Reviews.Content: I alway stay at this hotel every time I visit Boston. I just love the location and everyone is so friendly. It's close the the Green Line so it's easy to get to the North End, Fenway is just over the bridge and therefore you can walk to the game and it's walking distance to great shopping on Newbury Street. Great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, large room”
Reviews.Author: arrowfield_13
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and felt compelled to write a review (my first Trip Advisor review). It was the best customer service experience that I have encountered at a hotel in a long time. The staff was always smiling and willing to help out with any of our needs - from getting us museum tickets to a postage stamp, even ran ahead and grabbed us the elevator when my husband returned with takeout and didn't have a free hand. I ran the Boston Marathon and was shocked to get a visit from hotel staff after I returned to my room with a quaint little frame with a certificate inside, congratulating me on finishing and listed my finish time! The hotel not only knew we ran it but they took the extra step of looking up our results and congratulating us. We had 2 snafus at the hotel that were promptly handled in an efficient, quick manner. Our neighbor our first night was the loudest talker - had continuous conference calls during his stay including one at 10pm and 5:30am. Needless to say, I was not impressed when I was woken up so early by his call. I immediately rang the desk and they sent up security to deal with the situation. The next day I was informed that the conference caller was no loner next door to us, which was a huge relief. I was worried that it was uber-thin walls and this would be a problem throughout our stay, but we never heard our other neighbors. Problem #2 was fire alarm going off at 9:30pm one night. We were informed promptly what to do and that the situation was being investigated. Turned out to be a mal-functioning alarm so we never had to leave. We awoke to a very nice letter from management explaining the situation and apologizing for the inconvience. The location is perfect - right above the T so easy to get pretty much anywhere. Plenty of nearby food options and if you like baseball, you can see Fenway from your hotel room or floor. I would def. recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to returning when I am in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: esther1257
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! A great location, near Fenway, the Art Museum, Newbury Street etc. The staff were really perfect and the room was clean and beautiful. I have never written a review before and DON'T want this hotel to be busy the next time I want to go there but they deserve accolades. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Commonwealth a Must!”
Reviews.Author: bellaparole
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Boston due to college search with our teenage daughters. It was everything a 5 star hotel should be. The rooms were clean; service was efficient and courteous; and the location in respect to Boston University was extremely convenient. The hotel is a bit pricey but well worth it. We highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again when in Boston's downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable with superb service”
Reviews.Author: Leslie037
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Bathrooms elegant. Sitting area separated from sleeping area by drapes. Very comfortable bed and pillows. I'd return for sure.
