Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you're visiting BU”
Reviews.Author: digimom98
Reviews.Content: I came with my daughter to visit Boston University. This hotel couldn't have been in a more convenient location, just one block from campus. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. The rooms were clean, very accommodating and comfortable. I also felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST EVER!”
Reviews.Author: reluctanttraveller63
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for this year's Boston Marathon: she ran, I was the pit crew. Special attention was given to runners - early breakfast, bananas in lobby, etc., and after the race, a framed, printed plaque commemorating her run - including finishing time - was presented as a gift. In our suite, it was possible to watch the race from the room. At approximately the time she was expected to pass by, I was at the curb to cheer her on to the finish. Staff was extraordinarily competent and gracious at all levels, the door, the desk, the concierge, housekeeping, and room service. A stellar experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Simply T!!”
Reviews.Author: hospicerunner
Reviews.Content: This wonderful spot welcomes you in every way; from the moment you walk in, to the fabulous and attentive service through, to the absolutely best in class rooms. If you're seeking a classy place, which manages to take care of your every need, but without bothering you, this place is it. It is our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Karen172
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Commonwealth with our children ages 5 and 11. It was a very busy weekend with the Red Sox in town and the Boston Marathon on Monday. The hotel staff were very helpful with tips to navigate the crowds and activity outside in Kenmore Square. The room (Fenway 2 beds) was very spacious with a great view of Fenway Park. The staff was very friendly to our kids. We ate at Eastern Standard for breakfast - the food was very good but service was very slow. Other than that our experience at Hotel Commonwealth was wonderful and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “First rate service”
Reviews.Author: tmanousos
Reviews.Content: First of all the location of the Hotel couldn't have been more perfect as we had tickets to Fenway Park to see a game on Sunday. Not only was the proximity so close to Fenway Park but, the hotel staff assisted us in choosing seats and helped us buy tickets to the game before we even arrived at the Hotel and had them at the Hotel for pick-up. On our late arrival, we were surprised by having our room upgraded to your brand new suite. The suite was beautifully decorated and was equipped with a gas fireplace and a flat screen televsion. The cleanliness was par non and the attention to details from the cookies in our room to the gorgeously folded washroom towels and washcloths were nice touches. Our rest that evening was wonderful. The bed and the bedding in the bedroom were so comfortable. In the morning, I called the front desk to purchase 2 hotel robes and I was surprised at how quickly the matter was handled and the robes were delivered to my room. The Manager was kind enough to give me two complimentary umbrella's as I had also asked to purchase two umbrella's. My family was celebrating my husband's 53rd Birthday and the Commonwealth Hotel and staff made it a Birthday to remember. We will highly recommend this Hotel to others and would definitely consider staying again. Thank you, Tina Manousos

Reviews.Title: “Came to run the Boston Marathon and ended up running in style by staying at the Commonwealth.”
Reviews.Author: dennisharrison
Reviews.Content: Great service and staff...we'll be back next April for the 116th Boston Marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ktf265
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We had a "Fenway" room which overlooked Fenway Park. Very cool with tons of room. Great location with close proximity to colleges, subway, shopping, sports, great restaurants, etc. Not in the heart of the city but in reasonable walking distance or subway ride. If you don't like crowds, don't book it during a Red Sox game.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to Fenway!”
Reviews.Author: GrantHoule
Reviews.Content: Stellar service from the staff. Excellent in-room amenities (docking station, free internet, mini-bar) and an overall high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This hotel was tops in all the categories!”
Reviews.Author: ktebenezar
Reviews.Content: For an early anniversary trip we got tix to the Red Sox and decided to make a night of it and stay at a hotel nearby. Forgetting it was Boston Marathon weekend our options were limited and we booked on of the last rooms at the Hotel Commonwealth. We were thinking that this hotel was probably a little too much for what we needed but again we were celebrating so we went with it. I have to say I am extremely glad we did! As someone who has worked in the hotel hospitality business I was overwhelmed by the staff's friendliness, efficiency and customer service. From the moment we pulled up outside the hotel we were meet with staff who immediately unloaded our luggage then valet parked our car. We knew our room would not be ready (came in the morning for a day game at Fenway) the guest service agent offered to hold our bags and also congratulated us on our anniversary (the rez agent had noted it on our reservation). Upon returning after an amazing day at the ballpark, we were warmly greeted by the doorman and promptly checked in and our bags were quickly delivered to our room by another charming staff member. Our room was spacious and VERY clean, I give high marks to their housekeeping staff. The pillows werelike clouds, lol! The bed was a little too firm for me but my husband loved it. When walking to and from our room during our stay any staff member we came in contact with was friendly and always looked us in the eye and said hello. I put alot on customer service and even though the cost was a little more than we typically spend, I would stay here again just based on the service alone. We had brunch at the restaurant attached and it was excellent! Had the Cinnamon french toast and my huband had the eggs benedict and we ate it all! The hotel is next to the Kenmore T station and a 5 min walk to Fenway, bars and other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay when going to Fenway!”
Reviews.Author: KConnors
Reviews.Content: By far, the best place to stay in Boston when going to Fenway. It's a 5 minute walk to the park and a 10 minute walk to Newbury Street. The Hotel is quite comfortable and the entire staff, from doormen, front desk and maids are extremely friendly and accommodating. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “great location next to Fenway”
Reviews.Author: timb59
Reviews.Content: It's the only way to go when you are going to a Redsox game.....They park the car for you, great food from room service, very nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kacmcweeny
Reviews.Content: Great Boston location with outstanding on site restaurants. Hotel was beautiful and clean. Staff was very professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance on Kenmore Square, finally"”
Reviews.Author: hepadoc
Reviews.Content: An elegant, well appointed hotel with quiet, attentive service and a great location. The room was large and comfortable. Great to have a first class hotel near the Harvard Medical Complex and Fenway Park. Only one complaint - why charge $10 to bring a small pot of coffee to the room in the morning?

Reviews.Title: “Hakuna Matata!”
Reviews.Author: Cookiess
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped into this hotel I knew I made the right choice. The entire staff was always ready to meet my request and with a smile that was genuine! The hotel far exceeded my expectations. I travel to Boston quite often and I have never stayed here before but decided to give it a try. Josh handled my reservation. Of course I had my list of what I wanted the room to be like. It was exactly how I wanted it and then some. Right down to a bottle of NY water! Nice touch Josh! (knowing I was from NY) It just made me smile. At that moment, I knew my stay was just going to be fabulous and it was just that. They even had an umbrella in the closet so I wasn't caught off guard with a downpour! The Hotel Commonwealth is definitely worth the price if you want no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel in Kenmore Square, near Fenway Park with two happennign restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Conseiller99
Reviews.Content: Really nice new hotel with excellent rooms; friendly service; accomodating staff; at Kenmore Square near Fenway and BU. Two really nice restaurants: Island Creek Oyster Bar which is spanking new with fresh oysters from Cape Cod Bay as well as a happenning bar and complete seafood list with some steak and burger choices as well; and Eastern Standard, another hip bar with the feel of a Parisienne brasserie with a nice mix of French brasserie and New England cuisine--they obviously have a great place to get fresh oysters! Definitely a winner of a hotel/restaurant mix.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be back!”
Reviews.Author: bzsaindon
Reviews.Content: I had an outstanding stay at Hotel Commonwealth. I stayed there with my parents and they also were amazed at the level of hospitality accomplished by all the staff, from the front desk workers to the house keepers. I believe it was Josh's first greeting that set the tone for our stay there. My mom couldn't stop talking about his pleasantness. The room was really large and it was set up very nicely. We had dinner at the oyster bar downstairs, and the waitstaff was awesome. They knew their oysters and the food was delicious. If you go there definitely try the oyster bar for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: SILK3
Reviews.Content: I have not been to Boston for leisure in years. This was my first time back and I really enjoyed my experience. It all started and ended with my stay at Hotel Commonwealth, From its central location to the wonderful amenities. I couldn't ask for more. But the excellent customer service is why I would recommend this hotel to everyone. You can not beat good people and good service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: amber045
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally clean beautiful rooms. Fabulous location-my daughter was attending a college event nearby. Attentive staff. Excellent restaurants. Will be planning all my stays here while my daughter attends college for next 4 years.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant, conveniently located boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: barnstablerw
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth is elegant. There are different types of rooms but all quite large. Parking tends to be on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Ok.”
Reviews.Author: Annasmithiscool
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel was nice and all, but it didn't really fit my needs. I mean, yeah it was clean, and had good places to sleep, but I just didn't like it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little disappointed based on the TripAdvisor reviews”
Reviews.Author: CodyDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and very clean. Free Wi-Fi was great and it sits right on the Green MBTA subway line. It was real easy to reach from the airport. Once at the airport MBTA station, I was at the hotel in less than 15 minutes. I upgraded to a Fenway room, but was disappointed in the quality of the view as it was not worth the extra money. The bed was nice but I had hard time sleeping because of the white noise coming from the air control system in the room. I probably would not stay here again if I was only visiting Boston, probably would try another location. But, if you are going to see a Boston Red Sox game, this is the place to stay and would stay here next time I go a game. As it is an easy work to the ballpark. I also walked to the Museum of Fine Arts - which is about 15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid hotel. No complaints. Not outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: mw180
Reviews.Content: Park your car somewhere else. It is too expensive to park at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: anniegoodrich51
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about Hotel Commonwealth. The room was incredible, with a jacuzzi and all the extras. We had dinner at the restaurant attached which was also excellent. The best part of this hotel is the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff. We were most impressed with the front desk staff, especially the enthusiasm and helpfulness of one woman, Hilary Whyte. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dvciliberto
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth is a lovely hotel in a great neighborhood with expert staff. I have stayed several times at the hotel and enjoy the friendliness and wonderful service they provide. The rooms and beds are extremely comfortable and this boutique hotel operates with high standards. I was pleasantly surprised to find out the hotel has a car service available for guests going to local destinations - as a service they provide between 7-9am going to a business destination.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: hockeymama2
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Commonwealth is such a joy. The rooms are spaceous and very comfortable. The staff is friendly and always willing to make our stay perfect. I would recommend Hotel Commonwealth to anyone staying in Boston if you want to feel l royality!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: pahome
Reviews.Content: Whenever we stay in Boston, we like to stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. We have stayed at least a half dozen times. We love the rooms, bathrooms, service and restaurant. As a matter of fact, on this trip, my husband said that he finally realized what was wrong with this hotel. We use it as a comparison for all other hotels we stay in and no other hotel ever measures up!

Reviews.Title: “If you have the option - choose the Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: pwforson
Reviews.Content: An absolutely wonderful boutique hotel. It was everything I needed at the end of a long week of travel. I had a huge headache otherwise I would have enjoyed it more. But, the strongly brewed black coffee, turn down service, and comfortable amenities helped an awful lot.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel well located near Boston University/Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: travjunky
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, and was not disappointed. My son and I stayed one night while we were touring Boston University. The room was very large in my opinion for a city hotel, and was very nicely decorated. The bathroom was also large and modern. Really convenient location -The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the administrative offices of BU, and a 20 minute walk to the farther end of the campus. The Kenmore T-stop is a few feet from the hotel entrance, very handy for quickly getting to the downtown area. The staff at the Commonwealth were very friendly. We ate breakfast in the attached restaurant and found it to be excellent. Free Wifi in the room worked great. I definitely plan to stay there again the next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Commonwealth, would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1MD
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a superb long weekend at the Commonwealth recently, while attending a conference in town. We had booked a Fenway room and found it amply sized, spacious, comfortable, clean, quiet, and most of all, someplace we looked forward to retiring to at night. The staff, doormen, and concierge were incredible, being very helpful, friendly, and accommodating. We were always greeted with a smile both when we walked in and at the front desk, and all questions were answered. (Special thanks to Ms. Isel Tavico, who was especially kind, helpful, and friendly.) The location was excellent; right in the heart of Commonwealth Avenue and very convenient to public transportation. The surrounding neighborhood felt vibrant and safe to us, making for a great place to take a walk in the evening. Unless you plan to visit any areas outside of the city in general, you won't need your car or a rental car, and taxis are plentiful around the hotel as well. We did not have a chance to try the hotel restaurant, visit the Gallery, or use most of the other amenities, but just from the exceptional service and beautiful accommodations, I can easily recommend this hotel to all traveling in Boston. Our stay was very enjoyable, and we look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Feel's like Boston!”
Reviews.Author: DJE04
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday afternoon, greeted by exceptional valet, bellman. Room was spotless, decorated beautiful, but simple. Bed was incredibly comfortable. Despite being at a pretty busy intersection, the room itself was silent...what a great night sleep. The Eastern Standard Bar is amazing, both in atmosphere and beverages, and you have access to it from inside the hotel. The next day after my friend and I checked out, they happily held our luggage so we can spend the day shopping. They also were happy to let us keep our cars parked in the their garage, for a MUCH lower rate than any other garage around. We got back to the hotel about 9:15pm, and w/in minutes...our luggage and vehicles were right in front of hotel! Can't ask for anything better than that!

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend getaway for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha12
Reviews.Content: Our whole family had an excellent stay at the Hotel Commonwealth during the hotel's Bedtime Stories Weekend. From the special backpack each child received to the magician and bed time story, which included hot cocoa (and wine for adults), our children had a blast! The next morning at breakfast, the kids helped make their own pancakes with the hotel chefs. The hotel made such an effort to make them feel special! The Hotel Commonwealth is such a lovely hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Our room was spotless with nice amenities (Fresh toiletries, an umbrella that came in handy and DVD player). We love staying here and recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom562
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the IC4As at BU. We felt pampered staying at this hotel,yet it's a great value compared with other hotels in Brookline. It is well worth staying here! Stayed in a Fenway queen room - room was huge, and clean! Asked for a quiet room, and had the most restful sleep ever in a hotel! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Eastern Standard restaurant was excellent, and it was so nice to have a great restaurant right in the hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect! The Kenmore T station is right next to the hotel doors, very convenient! Our room and bathroom were both spotless. Having a clean, quiet room is very important to me, and this was the best! Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back cause it was that good.”
Reviews.Author: calex5628
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, captures the essence. The physical accommodations are excellent and the staff is very professional. It is a rare when I can say that everyone that I came into contact with seemed to really understand their job, and was superior in accommodating a guest. The hotel was grand, beautifuk design, lovely gallery, great restaurant and had it all..., updated, clean, spacious,and I had lovely accommodations, the location was great for me, Greenline T was next door. Parking was expensive-but it was Boston. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Commonwealth provided a relaxing, wonderful place to rest my head.”
Reviews.Author: LCLeahy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this hotel. The rooms are always well kept and large. The staff is always polite, pleasant, and helpful. The two on-site restaurants are lovely, but the hotel staff was willing to make a reservation to a nearby restaurant for. Overall, I would highly recommend Hotel Commonwealth.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with large rooms, clean, easy access to the "T"”
Reviews.Author: csotwoVirginia
Reviews.Content: Convenient location right on Commonwealth Avenue. Very good complimentary wi-fi in rooms. Beds very comfortable. Only thing missing is in-room coffee/tea maker.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel Commonwealth!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bonnbonn70
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for the night for my husband's 50th birthday. I wanted him to feel really special and the staff at Hotel Commonwealth went above and beyond to ensure that! We went to Quincy Market for a couple hours and when we got back, there was an ice bucket with a couple of beers in it for my husband along with a bowl of honey rosted mixed nuts. The hotel also set us up with a wonderful driver for the night. He picked us up in a black Escalade an waited at the resteraunt while we ate. All in all, it was a wondeful night and it was exactly what I wanted for my husband! Thank you Hotel Commonwealth for everything. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing local vacation for the kids!”
Reviews.Author: VivianandPete
Reviews.Content: Last weekend my family had the opportunity to attend the Bedtime Stories event at the Hotel Commonwealth and we had the most fantastic time. When we arrived the Hotel Manager was greeting guests with champagne in the lobby and the front desk staff welcomed both my children by name with a special backpack filled with LL Bean Slippers, a cute Curious George book, a flashlight.... Our room was so beautiful and the beds were so comfortable and relaxing - even sleeping in the same room with the kids! In the evening the hotel provided a bedtime stories event with a magician and a hot chocolate bar for the kids. They even had wine/beer and cheese and crackers for the adults which I thought was really a nice touch. In the morning the children were able to make pancakes with the chef and then we were served a delicious meal in the cafe. Overall it was a great trip. It was the first time we had taken our kids to a fancy hotel and in their eyes it was better than Disneyland. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling - with or w/o kids. The staff made us feel so welcome and it was a pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Comfort, Peace”
Reviews.Author: Magdalene6127
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth when in town for a college visit. The location of the hotel is wonderfully convenient, the staff is extremely helpful, the rooms are beautiful and comfortable, the appointments thoughtful. I would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to Boston who was looking for a very special experience,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: AndiEatsALot
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. We went to a show at the House of Blues on Landsdown Street and were able to walk there which was great since parking is very difficult in the area. It would also be perfect for a Red Sox game. I was very impressed with the friendliness of the staff. I called and asked for a steak knife and it was at my room within five minutes. We had breakfast at the attached restaurant - Eastern Standard - and it was excellent. The french toast was fabulous!! Parking is an issue, take the T if you can (entrance right next to hotel). The walls are a little thin so if you're a very sensitive sleeper ask for something at the end of a hall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, attentive staff, great location, my favorite hotel when in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Wozzies
Reviews.Content: I love staying at this hotel when visiting my sons at BU. The staff is friendly and quick to respond to requests. It is beautifully decorated and clean even when it's snowy and slushy outside. It's a shame there isn't better shopping within the hotel, but it certainly is available nearby. The rate for parking your car is outrageous, but I have come to learn that is what to expect in this city. The night time cookie delivery appeases the traveler a bit, as well. Hopefully, this hotel will continue to keep up the good work and not compromise on the "little extras" that make it such a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely courteous hotel staff!”
Reviews.Author: suesabel
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in a great area. There are two fantastic restaurants downstairs from the Commonwealth. My only discrepancy would be that there was loud music playing during both nights of my stay until 2:00AM. Aside from that, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with great, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pilotgirl_17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for their PJ Stories night and the special family package. The package was a great deal, with valet parking included, as was a buffet breakfast the next morning, where the kids got to "make" their own pancakes. When we checked in, they gave us a backpack for my daughter, filled with all sorts of fun things for a kid at a hotel. The room (Commonwealth Suite) was really nice- a heavy curtain to separate the "bedroom" from the "sitting room", which worked really well with a 4 year old. Fantastic gym, with nice equipment. And the service was great too--- everyone was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding accomodations”
Reviews.Author: pawalther
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth is a first rate facility. My husband accuses me of being high maintainance and the HC meets all my needs and expectations. From the extremely professional staff to the immaculate rooms to the overall ammenities and restaurants, the HC is an outstanding facility. While this hotel is on par with other high end luxury hotels, the atmosphere is not stuffy or pretentious. I highly recommend the Hotel Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: mjoneill
Reviews.Content: While visiting our daughter at college, we decided to splurge at the Hotel Commonwealth. From the second the door was opened to us until we left the next day, every detail exceeded our expectations for an absolutely beautiful stay. We ate both lunch AND dinner at Eastern Standard and now have a new favorite in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Gateway to Boston”
Reviews.Author: HokieEli
Reviews.Content: A great hotel ideally located between Boston's splendid colleges and universities. A welcoming environment with nearly omnipresent doormen eager to assist in any way. The rooms are elegantly appointed and most comfortable. I wholeheartedly recommend Hotel Commonwealth to all of Boston's visitors.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Commonwealth!”
Reviews.Author: loveboston1
Reviews.Content: We've tried several other hotels in the Boston area but we always go back to the Commonwealth. We love the friendly service and the great location. Have a son at BU and it's just the most convenient. Also so quick to the airport and the T stop (Kenomore Square) is right there - no need to rent a car. Rooms large and well maintained. Just a great place to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “they went out of their way for me”
Reviews.Author: mlemley
Reviews.Content: I was very sick while I stayed there. The hotel staff was amazingly supportive, not only extending my stay but sending someone out to buy Gatorade for me and sending up free food unsolicited.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Kenmore Square Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bbellissimo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I first stayed here a year ago when visiting Boston University. The staff is very welcoming, the rooms, beautiful and spacious. Since then, my husband has stayed once, and we are both booked two more times in the next few months. The location is perfect (easy access to Storrow Drive and the T), and you can walk to plenty of shopping and other attractions. The Hotel Commonwealth has become our go-to hotel in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “I dont write reviews too often..”
Reviews.Author: SeanSEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We travel quite a bit and this is a great hotel. I can bore you with details but I wont. For me a great hotel is one that "feels" great. (And its not about the product - which in this case is A+) You just know its got great leadership, attracting the right employees and people are happy, responsive and helpful. I felt this too, maybe not able to put my finger on it but its there, perceptible in small details as much as the bigger items. The Eastern Standard and new Oyster house are both strong parts of this hotel. I gather they're separately operated but if I didn't ask, I wouldn't have known. It's innovative too - a little Illy coffee stall pops up in the morning, a great photography exhibition and a rare thing - a camera store that sells photographic paper. Overall, well-designed and relevant services. Nice warmth in the design too. If you want to feel good at a hotel in Boston and not pay the huge city center prices, this is the hotel for you. Outstanding and among the best hotel experiences we've had. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: abmm
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and have had great experiences both times. Rooms are large, clean, nicely decorated and updated and the beds are comfortable. This past stay we got a large top floor room with two walls of windows overlooking Kenmore Square. It is not the most central location if you are sight seeing in Boston, but the T stop is conveniently located right in front of the hotel and Newbury Street is a nice walk (4 or 5 blocks away). Great place to stay if you want to be close to Fenway. We enjoyed returning from dinner elsewhere in the city and having a night cap at the Eastern Standard connected to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great girly fun”
Reviews.Author: tripfi
Reviews.Content: very feminine hotel with all the touches including nightly turn down service with cookies, bath robes lush bath products, black and white dvd collection. right next to kenmore T and great coffee downstairs too,

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: rupacked
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay and would stay again. Room was lovely, service was top notch (bellman called reception so they knew us by name when we approached the front desk â€“ nice touch). Room service is from the hotelâ€™s Eastern Standard and the burger was just what was needed after an evening of bar hopping. Room key must be swiped to activate elevator, which I appreciate as the restaurant shares the hotels lobby rest rooms. FYI bar at E.S. is fantastic and food is very good. Only negative - there was a reunion at the hotel and guest returning from the party could be heard (they were loud!) in the rooms until 4 am. I will not take any points away from my rating as front desk assured the group would be told to take their business elsewhere and drinks from room fridge were deducted from our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: hospicerunner
Reviews.Content: Since our daughter moved to Boston, we have stayed here and will continue to. The facilities are fabulous--rooms, common areas, fitness center, restaurant; the staff are knowledgeable, and VERY friendly, always aiming to solve problems ASAP. It is as close to "home" while not actually being at home as you can get in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Overnight Stay at the Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: grumpyoldguy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for an overnight stay with our 18 year old son to rest & recover from any jet-lag before staying with friends outside Boston. The hotel is a little old fashioned but very stylish. Check-in was quick & efficient. They had upgraded our room to a junior suite free of charge. The room was clean and well furnished, had a nice bathroom with a bath/shower and WC. Even though we were overlooking Commonwealth Av. the room was quiet. This and a comfy bed meant we had a good nights sleep. Breakfast was good but as usual in a hotel, a bit pricey. Staff were efficient and pleasant to us all. Check-out was quick and hassle-free. One complaint though; no tea or coffee facilities in the room! Other hotels offer this and so should the Commonwealth. Please sort out this minor irritation asap. Otherwise, a nice overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & convenient, but with disappointing snags”
Reviews.Author: SoloTravels1234
Reviews.Content: This was my second multinight stay in the past 4 months. The rooms are comfy; the staff -- from the doorman & valet to the desk staff -- are kind, friendly, & sincerely looking to make guests comfortable. Rooms service staff was exceptional with prompt delivery of delicious food. A a few snags, but essentially out of staff control. In short, it was a very busy weekend, so the hotel was filled with a cross-section of guests. Some rowdy guests behaved very rudely, diminishing the stay for others. First, someone apparently had a blaring TV, causing security to knock on each successive door, waking guests after 11:30pm while searching for the cuprit. Just after midnight there was repeat as some guests woke the entire floor again, shouting in the hallways in their revelery. Not what one would expect for the premium lodging fee for this wekend (yes, approximately twice the nightly rate in July!). While the noise was not something the staff could control, it seems that some accomodation should have been to address these interuptions since these "snags" adversely affected other guests. Great food at Eastern Standard and its new sister restaurant, Rock Creek Oyster Bar. The back wall is beautifully built with oyster shells, akin to a modern shell midden, if patrons are keen enough to actualy see it.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel - close to BU”
Reviews.Author: late74C
Reviews.Content: Was staying at this Hotel while attending a week long class at Boston University, BU negotiated a special rate and it appears that this hotel has worked well to keep its guests happy. Proximity (about 5 to 10 minute walk) made it ideal to get over to BU S Of M center easily in time for classes. A few restaurants close by as well as the hotel itself has an excellent one (Eastern Standard); room very spacious, very nice desk/chair setup to do work before and after as well as free ethernet (cable provided) access to the internet to stay in touch with the office. Very, very comfortable beds, great shower and the toiletries (shampoo, etc.) were spa level class. The whole staff seems to really enjoy their jobs, very friendly and always there to help without being overly so --- saw a fair number of parents of BU undergrad's (my last day I believe was the start of parents weekend) who had been repeat guests from the conversations in the lobby as I was waiting for my son to pick me up, tells me that it's very popular. Overall, would rate it excellent -- and if I take another exec course at BU this will be the place to stay. Only lost a point on value -- I still take exception to the high cost of hotels, but this one was at least in the same league as other 5-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, with a great restaurant, but overly pricey even for Boston.”
Reviews.Author: shlevine
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth is the closest hotel to my Boston client. My boss always stays there, so I wasn't going to argue with him. The hotel is nice, but really nothing extraordinary. It's pretty pricey too, even by Boston standards. The location is great if doing business with Boston University, but for the average tourist, it's not at all centrally located. The gym is ordinary, but if you're a runner and it's not too cold (or hot), lace up and head down Commonwealth Avenue; it's a lovely route in this lovely city. The hotel attached to the restaurant (I think it's called East West) is very good, both for a pricey client dinner and a quick casual breakfast. Thanks, I'm sure, to the proximity to BU, there are numerous very affordable/cheap and fast dining options right nearby as well. My room had a view across the awful Mass Pike toward the Redsox stadium. There was no road noise, which is commendable. All in all, not bad, but definitely nothing special either. I'm going back shortly and staying at the DoubleTree Suites. It's a five or 10 minute cab ride away, but half as much money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - large clean rooms and super efficient desk”
Reviews.Author: kappatraveler
Reviews.Content: Speedy check in. Fast elevators. Room was large with bed and sitting area. Desk is a dream for business travelers. Phone has great conference call/speaker capabilities so you can multitask while on the phone. They have a universal charging station ready to go with preloaded charging tips for iPod/phone; mini and micro ports. All three can charge at once. Wireless a little slow so used the cable line and it worked like a dream. Free internet was great. Bathroom really clean with terrific "Fresh" brand products. Large bars of soap were a welcome surprise. Front desk sent up a small box of handmade chocolates; two bottles of water ; and a handwritten thank you note 10 minutes after I checked in. Surprise and a welcome one!

Reviews.Title: “great first class hotel...bed was awful”
Reviews.Author: JoyceinNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nites, only real complaint was that each morning I woke up with a broken back...beds were too soft, husband did too......Other than that this is a really nice hotel, with great service, elegant yet comfy lobby, free wifi, free business center with 2 computers ( 1 Mac and 1 Dell), free newspapers ...Globe and NY Times...Toiletries provided were shampoo, bath gel and lotion...no conditioner....We were upgraded to a minisuite..large room with a king bed and then curtained off sitting room facing Commonwealth. 32 in flat screen TV in each area....Very quiet.. Fitness small but with very up to date machines...Lots of dining options with in a stones throw....as well as 7-11...Hotels sits on top of The T Kenmore station.... Would definitely return again if the price is right ..paid $756 including parking and all those taxes for a 2 nite stay...big weekend in Boston..parents weekend at Boston colleges

Reviews.Title: “The concierges saved the day!!!”
Reviews.Author: KingKongGurgaon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth is excellently located right next to the metro station with loads of restaurants, pubs, a 711, and ofcourse, Fenway Park, the home stadium for the Boston Red Sox team. The rooms are fabulous...large, quiet, luxurious and very comfortable. But the one thing that makes this place the absolute tops is the staff...we landed there around 9pm and my colleague discovered that he had left his cellphone in the cab that brought us to the airport. Samuel, the concierge got into action right away, calling up all the cab companies in Boston to check whether the cab was theirs. Fortunately, the phone was located and all was well! Then on the day we were leaving, I discovered that British Airways would not take a golf club unless it was packed adequately to prevent any damage to the Club. Again, the concierge, this time it was Bryan, who told me to head off for my sightseeing tour and not worry about it, because he would make sure that it was packed securely. And sure enough, when I got back to the hotel, it was all done...he had got hold of some fedex containers and bubble wrap and packed it super securely!!! Thanks guys, you prevented the trip from being a disaster and turned it into a wonderful one. Hope to be back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “A great night at Fenway”
Reviews.Author: foodieMA
Reviews.Content: My partner and I go to one Red Sox game a year - tickets are expensive! We have stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for the last six years. The buzz on the street pre-game is great fun. (We stay in Boston 4-10 nights a year and choose our hotel based on location) The rooms are lovely - old Boston. The beds are comfy. This year I booked the room through Jetsetter which gave us a great deal on a suite. My partner is disabled. The hotel is very accessible. The staff is wonderful. Our typical stay includes a late lunch/early dinner at Eastern Standard. I'll write a separate review for that. Anyone going to a Sox game or visiting a BU student or shopping on Newbury Street (which is totally inaccessible) should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Commonwealth!”
Reviews.Author: jtfs792
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel with extremely comfortable, clean rooms and great service. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The location is very accessible to everything. Fenway park was right across the street and I had a view of the stadium from my window. Very close to action and restaurants. Very roomy hotel room. Could not complain, excellent stay and a pleasant surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay at the Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: tinat168
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Commonwealth for only 3 nights, and it was fantastic! We arrived late from the West Coast, and we were hungry, so we grabbed a bite at the Eastern Standard around 11:30pm. Good thing that their kitchen is open late! It was a Thursday evening, the bar was crowded and lively, and there was a great DJ spinning some tunes. We got a great deal and booked the Commonwealth Room, which was incredibly spacious and comfortable. Contrary to our original plan, we did spend a good chunk of time in our room, since my husband came down with a cold. My favorite part of the room was the Fresh bath products!! I happily brought some extras back home. The staff was gracious and warm. I loved the location of our hotel -- it wasn't smack in the middle of all the touristy spots, but it was super close to the amazing shops and cafes on Newbury St. We ended up walking from the hotel to the Freedom Trail, but we cabbed it back when we were at the North End. Cabs are readily available, and Cambridge is right across the river. Overall, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: RobinDanielson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right around the corner from Fenway and within walking distance to restaurants, a convenience store and most anything else you would need. A great place to stay if you are taking in a Red Sox game.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a Red Sox Game!”
Reviews.Author: thomasclan4644
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with the Red Sox Destinations group, of course to take in 3 Red Sox games. We drove in as we live outside of Boston, and was pleasantly greeted by Jeff, the valet. We carried our own bags in, no one asked to help, but no problem as they were easy to carry. Check in was easy. The elevator has a secure feature, which is good, but hard to get used to. When we got to our room on the 2nd floor, my husband noticed right way, double beds!! We reserved a king bed room. Went down to the front desk and they asked us to wait a little while, about 20 minutes and we had a room on the 5th floor!! I happen to prefer rooms higher up and the view was of Fenway Park!! The room was very spacious and very clean. The desk area was a plus with easy internet connection and chargers. We could not understand why there was no coffee maker in the room or coffee in the lobby??? Luckily there is a Dunkin Donuts nearby. Neither of us thought the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom shower was the best, large, adjustable, rainshower and plenty of pressure! We loved, loved, loved the restaurant/bar downstairs, Eastern Standard. We had drinks after the game Friday night; late night eats Saturday night and brunch Sunday AM. Staff was superb and the food was very good and reasonable for the area. Going to a Red Sox game? This is the place to stay, quick walk to Fenway!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay at the Commonwealth!”
Reviews.Author: Riverwood
Reviews.Content: From the moment the bellman opened the door, we were wowed by the Hotel Commonwealth. The staff are exceptionally attentive and very friendly. Each time we walked through the halls, lobby and out the front doors, no less than 3 people said "Have a nice day." Each time we came back, everyone said "Welcome back." The check in and check out process was effortless. Our room was on the second floor and faced none other than...Fenway Park. We were there for a game, so this view was wonderful. Mind you it overlooks a roof top, but the view beyond that was wonderful. And considering that I-90 was right there...it was extremely quiet. The room has a welcoming and comfortable decor. The lobby is beautiful and very upscale. The rooms have a charging station for phones and iPods and a mini-frig, stocked with beverages and snacks. This was a classy room. The turn-down service with the chocolate wafer was a nice bonus. We did not have our car with us this trip, but the hotel is 15 yards from the Kenmore Square "T" stop. This made getting around Boston convenient. If you needed a cab, a bellman was right there to hail one for you. We strongly recommend that if you are going to be in Boston this is a wonderful lodging choice. If heading to a Sox game...you can't get any better than this for a nights lodging after the game. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty fab hotel in good location!”
Reviews.Author: lovetohikeRI
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for one night to celebrate our birthdays. A few minutes after we had arrived in our room, we received a plate of homemade cookies and spelled out in chocolate on the plate was "Happy Birthday." Fun:) The hotel was really cool, and our room with two double beds was spacious, and had a nice view of the "Green Monster" in Fenway Park...spacious bathroom and great smelling toiletries. The hotel also had a beauiful gallery of photos in one of the hallways which leads you to Eastern Standard, the hotel's restaurant. Great grilled cheese on rye with french fries!..and we loved the fact that it was open until 1:30am...our waitress even brought us a little piece of cake with a candle in it! This hotel is super close to Fenway Park, and House of Blues. It is only about a 5 minute walk to Newbury Sreet which is great for shopping and little sidewalk cafes....Trinity Booksellers has an awesome breakfast! The hotel is about a $20.00 round trip cab ride to the North End which has amazing restaurants and pastries. You are really not far from much because Boston is a great city for walking...everything feels so connected and quaint. We found the hotel to be a decent price (for Boston), and we were splitting the bill:) The hotel staff was also very helpful! ...and must not forget comfy beds...down comforters and pillows:) The valet parking was 42.00 for one day which was worth it for us, seeing as though we would only be there for one night, and it beat looking around the city for a parking space....lots of traffic! We checked out at 9:30 am and were able to eat breakfast and walk around town until 2 which is when our time would be up. After that I believe the charge is 18.00. I am not sure what an extended stay would be for valet. If you are looking for a hotel close to Fenway Park, Newbury Street and the Boston Commons, this is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saint22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this beautiful hotel in early August with my wife and two young children as we were visiting nearby Boston Children's Hospital. We pulled our car up to the entrance of the hotel and we were greeted very warmly and energetically by the valet and doorman. Our bags were placed on the rolling brass rack and we proceeded inside for check-in. It was 1:30 pm on a Monday. I knew the Red Sox were out of town on a road trip. I surmised that the hotel would not be full at this time. I hate the firm 3:00 pm check-in policy that some hotels strictly adhere to and I was curious to see what would happen here. The lobby area was up one dramatic flight of stairs (there was also an elevator on the side) and the word I would use to describe the lobby area would be regal. Gorgeous red floor covering, multiple pieces of ornate furniture and high ceiling made the space feel like a large room in a European palace. Anika, who greeted us, was warm, personable and professional. She said our room was ready and our bags would be right up. Our room was on the 3rd floor of the 5 story hotel. Our room was a Commonwealth Room which was like a junior suite. The room was in shades of browns and golds and was relaxingly inviting. The marble bathroom was beautiful and was a nice size. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable and the sittiing area had the pull-out couch/bed for the kids. The view out our window faced north out onto Commonwealth Avenue. The famous Citgo sign (another Red Sox reference) was there also. The bags arrived and we got ready to head out and see the city. We took a cab over to the Children's Museum. Our kids, 7 and almost 3 had a ball for a few hours. My son was so proud to have climbed to the top of the 3 story climbing maze at the front of the museum. My daughter loved the Arthur exhibit. After an ice cream break at the huge Hood milk bottle outside the museum, we grabbed a cab over to the Public Gardens. My daughter loves the book "Make Way for Ducklings" by Robert McCloskey, so we took a ride on one of the Swan Boats in the Public Gardens and saw the little island where the ducks finally settled. She loved seeing the setting of one of her favorite books and we loved it too. Afterwards, we hailed a cab back to the hotel. We relaxed in the room for about an hour and dressed for dinner. We dined at Eastern Standard Restaurant within the hotel. We sat inside and dinner was excellent. Thanks to our Ipad, our kids were entertained enough so that dinner was mostly relaxing. After dinner, we retired to our room and bathed the kids and put them to bed. I did not hear any street sounds from Commonwealth Avenue and the climate control was quiet and effective. I slept perfectly all night. The next morning we had breakfast at Eastern Standard again but this time, we sat outside in a beautiful garden area facing Commonwealth Avenue. It was fun to people watch and I had french toast that was delicious and memorable. Check-out was friendly and courteous. Our car was brought around and we departed for the hospital. The hotel was beautiful. The service was impeccable. The restaurant was great. We even had complimentary wi-fi. A fabulous stay at a beautiful hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The service was rediculously good!”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at lots of four star hotels and even some fives, and Hotel Commonwealth is up there with the best of all of them. The moment you get there, the doorman greet you like you are the most important person in the world. Every other time they see you during your stay they will greet you by name. The rooms are beautiful and bathrooms very luxurious. The location is right next to Fenway Park, with plenty of restaurants in the area. I loved this place from start to finish. And my wife may have liked it better than I did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtteach52
Reviews.Content: I researched this hotel on tripadvisor and ended up booking it for our trip to Boston. I was not disappointed. Everything was wonderful and it is a great location. It was right next door to the subway and there were a lot of great restaurants close by.The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. I will definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: acek
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth the past two years for the Boston Marathon. It's a wonderful hotel and a great value. The rooms are beautiful, especially the Commonwealth suites. The staff is uniformly gracious, friendly, and helpful. This past stay, the doorman went way beyond the call of duty to help me retrieve my cell phone after I inadvertently left it in a cab. The location is mixed. It's literally on top of a T stop, which is super convenient. There's also a Dunkin Donuts right next door, which is great if you're a caffeine junky. It's just a couple blocks to the Charles, very nice for a run or stroll. You can walk to Newberry Street, the Convention Center, and Copley, but those are all a solid 10 minutes plus. Kenmore Square is not that appealing, and the restaurant selection is limited. It's also a pain having Fenway right there (unless you're going to the game) because it's kind of a zoo before and after the games. The hotel restaurant (Eastern Standard) is a disappointment. The menu features lots of heavy food which in my experience is not particularly well executed. I've had consistent problems with the service at breakfast. Nonetheless, I love this place, and will be back for Boston 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb, and matches expected SLH quality”
Reviews.Author: l-globetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for couple of nights in junior suite for excellent price of $206 plus tax, booking through hotel was surprisingly the cheapest rate obtainable, particularly as hotel was full. Excellently located, away from the husle and busle, 10min cab drive to Boston park, but 5min walk to anywhere in Back Bay area, with fab Newburry Street and the shopping stretch of Boylston streets short walk away. It was excellent to go for a walk on a warm night to Newburry street and have dinner in one of its numerous and excellent bars and eateries. The small sitting room adjacent to the bedroom faced onto the Commonweath Ave and the large bus stop, but due to double glazing and superb furnishings and sun block out, it was super quiet. The aircon system was the quietest I have ever encountered, made for super pleasant sleep on a hot summer night. It is rarely that I give 5/5 to any hotel I stay in, Hyatt in Milan being notable exception, but Commonwealth was simply excellent, due to its attention to detail and superior service touches, including: - preprogrammed numbers in the phone, super easy, and super efficient; - one of the most helpful directories ever encountered, particularly one called "At Your Service" - selection card for 5 choices of newspaper; - jogging map and a walking map of Back Bay souvenir worthy with its charming old world look, but most importantly useful; - taking "super clean" to a new level; - thoutful design, such as hooks for hanging your bathrobe net to (small but cute) bath; - choice of spa and massage services, including for expectant mothers as well as busy executives; - small room service menu, but tasty and reasonably priced meals, and pleasant surprise inclusion of "dining out" section in the in room dining folder; - efficient complimentary WIFI and free document printing; - Ipod stands, etc. - lovely gallery of photography for your enjoyment, fab breakfast room in their restaurant, excellent service and cosy art deco features, to name just a few. The only thing that would make this hotel perfect is multi (adaptorless) international powerpoints which the best hotels are increasingly installing (at least at the business desk area). Excellent hotel, beautifully appointed, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Commonwealth was first class”
Reviews.Author: amanda1969
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth was not the cheapest option in Boston, but I am glad we spent the money and stayed here. I was traveling with my mother, sister and daughter for a "girls weekend" in Boston. What was nice about the Commonwealth was that their double rooms actually had two Queen beds.The beds were SO comfortable! Also, there was a lovely sitting area, and the room was so spacious. The "Fresh" products stocked in the bathroom were first class, and the service was excellent. The location cannot be better- you are right near everything you need to be. The doorman and bellhop could not be more accomodating, and the front desk gave us excellent advice on where to eat lunch, dinner, etc. I would not hesitate to go back to the Commonwealth. It was a great place to stay for a weekend in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, service very slow”
Reviews.Author: Laura6446
Reviews.Content: The greeting from the doorman was wonderful. He was very pleasant, and probaby the only person at this facility who smiled, other than the housekeeper who came to vacuum our room at 1:30 in the morning due to an ant problem we had in the room. It took 2 hours and 2 phone calls to get room service on a pre-ordered item and 1 1/2 hours and 2 phone calls to get someone to come and deal with the swarm of ants in the room. Despite the vacuuming in the middle of the night, the ants persisted and the person at the desk in the morning did not seem interested in this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Compare!”
Reviews.Author: jjayne09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth last night for the July 4th celebration and to celebrate our anniversary, which I put in my online reservation. We were greeted at the front desk with, "Welcome and happy anniversary", and were told that we were upgraded to their nicest suite. The suite was beautifully appointed and enormous. The staff, from the doorman to the front desk, were so friendly and gracious. Eastern Standard was fun and the drinks were amazing. When we returned from the Pops and the fireworks, we found a bottle of champagne and chocolates in our living room, with an anniversary card!! What a wonderful way to end an incredible day. We will never stay anywhere else in Boston again. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service Above and Beyond the Call of Duty”
Reviews.Author: janegw
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth during my daughter's orientation session to Boston University and my parent orientation. The hotel is perfectly located right next door to the campus and a T stop. My room was spotlessly clean, extremely quiet (even though I looked onto Mass Ave) beautifully decorated and had great toiletries in the new, all marble bathroom. They are attached to a wonderful restaurant called Eastern Standard that will not only let you sign the check to your room but provides 24 hour room service to the hotel. The staff and the service however were AMAZING! Beyond the call of duty. When I got to the airport upon departure, I realized I was missing a carry on bag which contained my perscription medicine and other important things. The manager, Victoria, actually pored over footage on the hotel security cameras and she found my bag! I was certainly not expecting that. Even the housekeeping staff was friendly and attentive. I will definitely stay at the Hotel Commonwealth again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: ceemo
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in every respect - helpful and attentive staff, terric room at reasonable price, great restaurant. The rooms are much larger than is typical (>500 sq ft) and seem freshly redecorated and immaculate. Bathrooms are very large and seem recently redesigned. Very tasteful decor throughout with many, many touches of home. The room is well set up, split between a very large, highly functional desk and small living room area; the bedroom can be screened off if desired. I utilized staff more than I usually do, including needing service to one of the two TVs, plus I asked the concierge to help me plan a day of sightseeing, plus a small dinner for 6 colleagues. All staff were the ultimate in friendly and quite helpful. While the location is a little further from the busiest areas of Back Bay than I thought, it was quiet and quite near Fenway. This is my new place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel In Boston”
Reviews.Author: douglas12345
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for 3 nights. I had a great experience! The hotel staff was very friendly and my room was large and very clean! I would definitely reccommend this hotel to others! I didn't think that the restaurant next door had the best selection of foods, the menu too was simple and small. However the restaurant was comfortable, it had a nice bar area and I would probably reccommend it for drinks only!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a surprisingly large room”
Reviews.Author: cityspy
Reviews.Content: I had a very short stay at Hotel Commonwealth, just one night, but will definitely return on my next trip to Boston. The room was large with a desk and sitting area. Also a large bathroom with separated toilet room within the bathroom. Check-in and check-out was quick and easy, staff was friendly and accommodating and the room was very clean and comfortable. I loved the crisp white linens on the bed and the mattress was superb. The room was very quiet given that it faced a busy street. I enjoyed an excellent meal at the adjoining restaurant, Eastern Standard. After my one night here, I went to Cape Cod. When I returned to Boston I stayed at another hotel and the room there was tiny and dark, so I appreciated the size of the room at Hotel Commonwealth and wished I had booked the remainder of my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ChiefGunsRetired
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our two adult daughters stayed at the Commonwealth while taking in a Red Sox game. From the moment we arrived to the minute we departed we found the staff to be nothing short of outstanding! To a person, they were friendly, helpful, and attentive without being intrusive. The staff at the Eastern Standard, where we had dinner after the game, were equally as skilled and pleasant. The room was large, clean, bright, and well appointed. We also had room service breakfast in the morning which was also very good. The food at Eastern Standard was excellent and the service was friendly and prompt with no pressure. The sommelier assisted us in selecting just the right wine to go with our meal. She was incredibly knowledgeable about her craft and also very personable and friendly. The wait staff provided about the best service we have ever received. All in all, we had an outstanding time and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DownSouthUS
Reviews.Content: I know there are grande dames in Boston hotel circles. . but for comfort, location, staffing, and facilities, the Hotel Commonwealth cannot be beat. I stay at the property each year during a baseball trip. . . and Fenway Park is just around the corner. . but even if you weren't doing baseball, this hotel has the best of all possible worlds in a great location. If I have one complaint and it is minor. .. food service is not particularly to my tastes. . why not just good food but efforts are made to modernize and make it trendy, which seems to distract what otherwise would be a great dining experience. All hotel groupies should try this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Best Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Jon143
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth because it was one of the few hotels available in Boston during my stay with a room rate near our corporate max of $250/night. (It was slightly more expensive here.) Other hotels in town were going for $350/night and up. I was wondering what I was going to give up for that $100 less. Well, let's just say that I've stayed at those more expensive hotels and the hotel here was better from start to finish. The service from the first moment I pulled up in front of the hotel was efficient and friendly. Even better, the room was simply exquisite. Much larger than your ordinary hotel room. So large, in fact, that there was a second flat screen TV in front of the couch to go with the one in front of the bed. I was on the top (5th) floor overlooking bustling Kenmore Square but the windows are sufficiently sound-proofed that I didn't hear any sounds from the street below. Kenmore Square and nearby Fenway Park are great areas offering a full range of dining options. Nonetheless, the hotel offers 24 hour room service. And would you believe, free Internet (albeit a little slow)?! I come to Boston often and while this hotel isn't particularly convenient to our office in the Financial District, the T is about a 30 foot walk from the front door. I'm trying to think of a negative for the hotel. The lobby's on the second floor, requiring you to walk up the stairs with your suitcase (or take the elevator)? If this is the worst I can say about the hotel, you get the point. Great hotel at any price. At the price I got it for relative to the competition, a huge bargain.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Commonwealth is elegant, family friendly and we all enjoyed our stay immensely.”
Reviews.Author: Samantha12
Reviews.Content: We had a great time visiting the Hotel Commonwealth for the Kids Weekend Event! There were planned activities and treats for the kids, starting from the time we checked in and got fun filled kid backpacks. The kids loved their stuffed animals, books, slippers, flashlights, and all the other goodies they were given. Our room was spacious, well decorated and had all the amenities we needed, such as high speed internet and multiple televisions. It also had a thick curtain that we could pull shut so that the kids could sleep on one side of the room while we read/watched TV on the other side. We enjoyed our view of Kenmore Square. That evening, in one of the ball rooms, we went to a bedtime book reading that benefitted ReadBoston. The readers not only read books, but acted out some of the stories and sang songs with kid participation. After the event, the hot cocoa bar was a nice way to end the evening. The next day, there was a pancake cooking session with the hotel chefs. It went really smoothly and the kids were proud that they helped make their own pancakes. Everyone who worked at the Hotel Commonwealth was friendly and helpful- not only to us, but also to our children. We all had a great time and would go back and stay at the hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely room but request room away from lounge”
Reviews.Author: jenifoo
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston so that my daughter could tour and interview at Boston University. It was incredibly convenient for this purpose. The room was lovely and the staff more than helpful. Valet parking is steep, $40 per day. We checked in too late to take advantage of the wine store next door. My husband asked how much the wine in the convenience frig was - $16 for a half bottle. Once we returned to our room, the bellman came to our door with a complimentary bottle of wine with glasses. Lovely. Unfortunately, our room was on the third floor just above a night club within the same building. We had to listen to the boom, boom, boom of the base till the wee hours. I suspect we were given the wine so we would sleep through it. We didn't even the thought he beds were quite comfortable. Ask for a room on a higher floor and away from the front of the building. Otherwise, we really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: leti003
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with friendly staff. Loved every bit of it until we came back late one night. There's a lounge with the same entrance as the hotel and suddenly the staff get very pompous and rude. It's one thing to be rude to people entering the lounge but not people who are staying at the hotel. This was a huge disappointment and they ought to do something about it. The lounge is also nothing to write home about. Overall- too pompous and full of themselves, a right shame!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: beanerOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both work in the hotel industry and travel frequently for business and leisure. We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth on NY Eve in a jr. suite on the 4th floor. Check-in was smooth and friendly. The valet and door staff were great. The room was phenomenal. The space was well thought out, pleasantly decorated and the bathroom was spacious with plenty of room for toiletries (the hotel provides Fresh brand amenities which are fantastic); the bed was cozy (great blanket) and the sitting area was as comfortable as one I'd have in my home. The linens all smelled like they'd been washed in nice detergent, not the normal bleachy smell of hotel linens. The showerhead was great. We had a great night's sleep. The hallways and service staff were quiet and we did not hear any street noise at all. Room service was very, very good and Eastern Standard restaurant was very good for breakfast the next day. There is a "T" stop right outside the entrance to the hotel so it was easy to get around the city. It was a great stay and I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful event staff and clean, nicely appointed room”
Reviews.Author: Verndale
Reviews.Content: My company recently held a holiday party at the hotel on a rather last minute basis. The event team was quick to accomodate us and the party went off without a hitch. The facilities and staff are both first rate. My wife and I spent the night in a suite overlooking Kenmore Square. Clean comfortable room was modern and well appointed. Particularly enjoyed the 'fresh' shower products and excellent water pressure/shower head (Seinfeld would be pleased). Valet parking is expensive - but expected in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: dallasdr
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in Nov. 2009. Room was large and divided into two with a dense curtain. Quiet, cozy and comfortable in the midst of bustling Kenmore Square. Subway stop immediately beneath hotel. Valet parking extremely efficient. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful (I acknowledged at least a half-dozen "good mornings" each morning). Room was immaculate, linens and pillows comfy. Excellent restaurant on premises, and many more within two blocks. Not to mention Fenway Park. Rates are reasonable considering location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: VGMHawaii
Reviews.Content: My 5th trip to Boston and 5th stay at this Hotel. The Hotel is immaculate, the entire team is friendly, courteous, extremely helpful and professional. This Hotel is a very big reason that I keep returning to Boston year after year. This hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Dropped off college son at school”
Reviews.Author: silverpepl
Reviews.Content: We have been to Hotel Commonwealth a number of times this year. Our experience has always been excellent. We highly recommend this Hotel for travelers. The service is always helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Caters to young children”
Reviews.Author: jesseroo
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip with are 8 month old son, and the Commonwealth went the extra mile to make our stay comfortable. They supplied a crib and mini bar fridge for food and even asked whether we had a boy or girl to colour co-ordinate the sheets and blankets. They gave us a mini pack of supplies from Johnson & Johnson which included baby wash, shampoo, powder, cream and a sample of Diaper rash cream. To top it off, they even gave my son his very own teddy bear for the crib. Excellent customer service and we highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay near Fenway”
Reviews.Author: nhvthiker
Reviews.Content: We had tickets to a game and decided to stay over, go for dinner in the North end, and walk around Boston. We chose the Hotel Commonwealth in order to leave our bags and pick them up after the game. The hotel was wonderful! Clean, roomy, comfortable, high speed internet, great beds. Fast food type places nearby. We would stay again. Our only complaint - getting a taxi to get to South Station. The Bellman was no help and we waited a long time to hail a cab on his advice - on the other side of the street.

Reviews.Title: “class and courtesy in the heart of the back bay”
Reviews.Author: tom_redlaw
Reviews.Content: While on a hybrid business / college evaluation trip I spent one night here, and found everything to be fantastic. The location is ideal, at the heart of things around Kenmore Square. The staff was friendly without being overbearing, the gym was above expectations. I did not eat at the hotel and the Red Sox were not in town so my experience is the room and the staff and the location. All were fantastic, and at least when I stayed, paying less that $200 for a Fenway room, for Boston this was actually decent value as well, considering also that the internet was free. I will return, particularly if I am going to the House of Blues or even Fenway or BU, but even just to walk around Kenmore and then the Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “An almost perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: extraspecialbitter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth as part of a "Red Sox DestiNation" package. The proximity to Fenway and the Kenmore Square T stop were far beyond convenient. The furnishings in the room and throughout the hotel are tastefully luxurious, the staff helpful and friendly, and the amenities (two TVs, free high-speed internet, iPod docking station) first-class. A sweep of the Yankees would have made it a perfect weekend, but as it was it was awfully close...

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: mickib
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews, and once again Trip Advisor came through! Everyone that worked in the Hotel went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. At night they give you cookies as part of the turn down service and they called up to see if our kids would like milk with their cookies. They were helpful to us even when we came back from our trip to the Cape a week later and were no longer guests at the Hotel. They allowed us to store our bags at the Hotel for the day and helped us return our rental car, and we weren't even staying there anymore! This is the type of service that makes your entire trip a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Commonwealth is a "no frills" experience, but their service is impeccable.”
Reviews.Author: btbrug
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hotel Commonwealth for a little less than a week for my brother's wedding. As best man, I had to run back an forth handling minor but important tasks for the groom (my brother) and the wedding party. The front desk at the hotel did everything they could to provide me even the most bizarre requests. Also, I left several important gifts in my hotel room. The lost and found department quickly found the items and we worked out a way for me to have them delivered. At first glance, the rooms are simple with few amenities. For instance, there is no coffee machine. I do guarantee that if you wanted one in your room, all you need do is ask. I had a small refrigerator delivered to the room. The truth about the Hotel Commonwealth is that it prides itself on its customer service. The beds are wonderful. The location is perfect. Even the restaurant is fantastic. I've visited many hotel sponsored restaurants and this one is probably the best, especially for the price. the drink specials are amazing. I recommend the Bloody Mary. The only thing if at all I would want changed is the silly cordless phone in between the beds. It would be best to switch that with the more traditional phone that sits on the office desk because it is much simpler to operate. Also, the complimentary internet was incredibly slow.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - luxuriously comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cnk4
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor and the luxurious vibe this hotel gives off. It was a great stay. The rooms are spacious and cozy with great amenities. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great small luxury hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MABorntotravel
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for one night to attend a Red Sox game and celebrate a retirement. Upon arrival we accidentally hit the curb and got a flat tire right in front of the hotel The door man was so helpful and gracious to us as we felt a little embarassed. We didn't have to lift a finger he immediatly said don't worry we will change the flat and you just go and check in and go to the game (which started in about 15 minutes). When we returned from the game we realized how beautiful and clean the hotel was. As we walked to our room every employee greeted us with a friendly hello and welcomed us to the hotel. When we got back to our room much to our surprise there was a bottle of champagne chilling on ice with a box of chocolates, and a very nice card with wishes for our retirement celebration. At that point it really hit the spot. We check with the front desk and they told us the the car was just fine and again not to worry about it. I would deffentatly reccomend this hotel if you plan on going to a Red Sox game or you just want to have a quick get a way to Boston. The room was clean and the hotel was spotless. We live in Mass and we plan on staying here many more times. The hotel is so close to many great restaurants as well as Fenway Park. And the subway station is in front of the hotel. Again I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jockbrown
Reviews.Content: I am joining the chorus for this hotel. Large, comfotable, rooms and bathroom, interesting decor, clean, etc. Front Desk very polite, professional, accommodating and friendly. We chose the "commonwealth" room, a mini-suite with curtained sitting area, and were very pleased. Good rate through hotels.com; 2 young laides at the front (Crystal and ??) weekend of 7-18 were especially gracious. Left jacket which was promptly delivered.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Beautiful Hotel Rooms in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: gentlydownthestream
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms here for a three night stay in Boston. Picked the Hotel because it is pretty close to Children's Hospital of Boston where we needed to take our child. The ultra-nice and professional staff at the front desk upgraded our rooms to Commonwealth rooms on arrival. WOW! I have been to many upscale destinations, but these were absolutely the most beautiful, luxurious, clean, plush, huge rooms I have ever had the privilege to stay in. Elegant, yet with all the modern conveniences imaginable. The ambience at this hotel is stylish, classy and sophisticated, yet the staff were so welcoming and helpful with every request. Thank you to everyone at Hotel Commonwealth for making our stay with you as pleasant as possible. You are the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rlhivdr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great rooms! I think one of the most comfortable I've had, they are spacious and quite. I found the service to be friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DewdropCt
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. The staff were helpful and friendly (in fact, the bellman drew us a map for one of our destinations); the room was spotless and spacious. We have absolutely no complaints or reservations about recommending the hotel to friends and family. The location was perfect for our college tour. It was terrific from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dfranko
Reviews.Content: I visit Boston often and love to go to Red Sox games and have wanted to try the Hotel Commonwealth for a few years now but for various reasons never did. This trip I was able to stay there for 2 nights over the July 4th weekend and all I can say is that considering location, location, location, price, service, and cleanliness, this was the best Boston hotel I've stayed in yet. Location was ideal, especially for going to Fenway Park or Boston University.
