But since there's a T-stop also right at the hotel's front door, this hotel was so nice that it's worth staying here almost no matter what you have planned in Boston. I had a Fenway room with a great view of Fenway Park, I felt like I was camping out in Fenway Park's back yard. I went to two Sox games while there and could not imagine a better hotel situation if you're a Red Sox fan. The hotel itself is very clean with a great atmosphere. The room was big, extremely clean and modern. The staff I dealt with (front desk, concierge, room service) were all exceptional. While not the cheapest hotel in Boston, it was actually cheaper than a lot of the other hotels I've stayed at in Boston (I paid average of $284 per night for the Fenway room on a holiday weekend; Kenmore room was cheaper). The location and convenience to Fenway make it worth every penny. I ate breakfast in their restaurant one of the mornings and was pleasantly surprised for a hotel restaurant. There are more than enough good restaurants in the immediate area also that give you lots of choices. The modern 7-11 next door came in very handy also. It's also a very short walk down to the Charles River where there's some great scenery, walking and running trails. Now that the construction on Kenmore Square is finished, it is also scenic in front of the hotel. It's actually only a short run along the river up to Harvard too. If you're going to the Aquarium, Fanueil Hall and that area, this hotel isn't the closest to that stuff, but with the convenience of the T you should still consider it; but if Red Sox games are in your plans and you can possibly afford it, you'll not be sorry you stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travellor06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days over the 4th of July weekend. You couldn't ask for a better location to see a Red Sox game. The fact that the T station is in the hotel's basement makes it the perfect place to reach anywhere around Boston also. The staff is very attentive, and the rooms are clean and spacious. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay!”
Reviews.Author: sunny0
Reviews.Content: Went to a Red Sox game, the hotel couldn't be in a better location, takes about 5 minutes to walk to Fenway. Close to all stores on Newbury too. Hotel was clean, and beautiful. Room (we stayed in a Fenway room) was large, and had a nice view of Fenway. Got room service, it was fastest I have ever seen. The staff were all very friendly. I would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Family loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenn012
Reviews.Content: When I recommend places to stay in Boston this is always the hotel I suggest. So my family stayed here for a couple of days. Everything about it is wonderful: comfortable beds, spectacular service, luxurious, high-quality linens, gracious staff, perfect location for sightseeing. My family truly enjoyed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: travelbeeCt
Reviews.Content: The staff, service, and quality of rooms were exceptional. If you are going to be in the back bay area for any reason.. this is the hotel.. a few blocks from newbury st. , a 2 blocks from fenway, and a 10 min. walk to copley square. The kenmore square T stop was right next to the hotel's main entrance. The staff was the most friendly and cooperative staff we had encountered in a long time. For the overall price per night and the service.. ... a secret in boston!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience - Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: adavici
Reviews.Content: There really isn't anything negative to say about this hotel. The staff is friendly, attentive and available. The elevators are fast and quiet. The Linens are high quality. The rooms are spacious and clean. The valet service is fast and friendly. The attention to detail at every step is fantastic. Located on Commonwealth Avenue, you are around the corner from Fenway Park and The House Of Blues - an easy and safe 10 minute walk, tops. A longer, but very feasible and beautiful 25 (or so) minute walk gets you to the Boston Common and the heart of the city. The hotel smells great and everything is in complete order. It is not a budget hotel - you will play more that most chains - but I feel that the rate was very reasonable and worth every penny. We felt very comfortable there and would glady stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: ireneau
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel & the service was excellent. Well located with the "T" @ our door step & walking distance from many attractions. I would stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Valentine's Day getaway”
Reviews.Author: dsb2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here over Valentine's Day weekend. Our room was spacious and comfortable, and we heard almost no outside noise. The turndown service was wonderful, including the special Valentine's Day treat. The staff was wonderful, too. They have an excellent collection of DVDs that you can get for free to watch in your room, which we took advantage of during our stay. The location is also excellent, as it's right next to a "T" stop if you want to use mass transit to get around Boston. It's also within walking distance of many of the top sights in the city. As a newspaper lover, it was great being able to pick up a free London Times, NY Times or Boston Globe at the front desk, even on a Sunday! Even though we didn't have a laptop with us, it was nice to see that there is free Internet access in the guest rooms, which isn't always the case at the pricier hotels. A friend who lives in Boston told us the restaurant located in the hotel was excellent, although we never got a chance to sample the cuisine. If I got a good rate, I would definitely come back. I'm afraid this place is out of my price range with its normal rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phillagirl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Great service and VERY clean. Large room and nice views. Great if you want to see a ball game. Be careful of the taxi cost to hannover st...$40!!! Close to Newberry St and shopping. Part of the SLH chain. I alomst always book SLH when I can.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline07
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth is a fantastic hotel. The staff were wonderful from check-in throught to checkout. My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December 2008. Our room itself (one of the Commonwealth Rooms) was very lovely - huge comfortable bed, separate sitting area with couches and a second flat screen panel TV and DVD player, great bathroom with separate toilet. It was really a mini-suite and was a very comfortable place to relax. The location was great - there is an underground station right below the building. The hotel is right on Commonwealth Avenue, and strolling abck from the city centre took us only about 20 minutes. The are some great take out restaurants right across the road, and the hotel is only a couple of blocks away from the cosmopolitan Newbury St. The staff were very helpful - even accommodating our need for a late check out - , and the included breakfast was great (a great system where instead of the usual hotel breakfast room, we were given a voucher for the attached restaurant, which was also great). The really impressives service, though, came when we arrived home a week later and found we had left some items behind in our room. The housekeeping manager responded promptly, with an itemised list of what they had found, and made arrrangments to post the items to us, keeping us informed of the progress along the way. I can't say enough good things about this hotel - I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Fenway/BU location”
Reviews.Author: mem3184
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the Commonwealth in the past year and we find no reason to try anywhere else. A new hotel, it sits right on Kenmore Square and is one block from Fenway Park and at the east end of the Boston University campus. There is a subway station below the hotel/square and we walk to all parts of the Back Bay, including Newberry Street (about 4 blocks away). Since we have a child attending BU, it is a perfect location for us. Also great if you are going to Fenway Park. Otherwise, there may be better located hotels to Boston in general. However, the Commonwealth is extremely clean and upscale with an excellent staff. The rooms either overlook Fenway Park or Kenmore Square. Not much of a Fenway view (the back of the green monster and some seats) and it also overlooks the parking lot and freeway. The Kenmore rooms are a little larger but also cost more. Also, if you need two queens, they tend to be the Fenway rooms. Having stayed in both, I actually think the Fenway rooms are preferable if price matters to you. The rooms are all well decorated and the beds are very comfortable. Hotel amenities are very good. Internet access is easy, maid service and turndown service with great sweet wafers on your pillow were flawless. The gym is small but looks brand new. Room service is excellent and prompt. The front desk staff is very helpful and the dinner recommendations have been excellent. There are two highly rated restaurants in the hotel but we have not tried them. They have a parking lot in back for your car, a rental car counter in the hotel, the subway/bus station in front and we have never had to wait for the doorman to get us a cab. The umbrellas by the front door have come in handy as well. If you have a need to be in this area of Boston (or Boston in general), this is a near new, upscale hotel that we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: kh55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a wonderful weekend there. The room and bathroom were spacious and very well appointed. The bed was very comfortable and the linens lovely. There was quite a bit of noise going on at the street level the night we arrived but we didn't hear any of it in the room. The staff was friendly and very efficient with the exception of one young woman at the front desk. She was very sweet but completely incompetent and as a result we waited in our room for our car for 40 minutes when it had been pulled up within 5 minutes. There were a couple of other mishaps involving the same girl. It is within easy walking distance of the Newberry Street shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: quincycat
Reviews.Content: Travel a good amount for business, including to Boston and Cambridge. The Commonwealth is now my new top choice. The location is great. Kenmore Square is very active, and an easy walk to Fenway, Longwood Medical campus, etc. The extras are also great. Take advantage of their complimentary car service within 3 miles of the hotel. That does not get you to Logan, but does get you through most of downtown (including South Station). The staff was very friendly and accomodating. More importantly the room is perfect. Clean. Very comfortable work area. Free wireless internet. Nice views. Good water pressure in the shower. But most important -- the sleep. Comfortable bed. Quiet room. Easily able to set the "right temperature". Room was not too dry. A good night's sleep. (Getting the right temperature in a room is under-rated. It is diffficult to find a hotel room where you can set the temp, have the room keep the temp, have it keep the temp without making a ton of noise, and do so without creating a room so dry you worry about brush fires. The Commonwealth got it all right.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: mrslosa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always stay at the Hotel Commonwealth when we visit Boston. The hotel is conveniently located to Fenway Park and is an excellent choice if you are attending a baseball game. The hotel and guest rooms are beautifully decorated! The hotel is very clean and the restaurants located in the hotel are both excellent! Great place for couples, families, or a fun weekend with friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Best! Should be #1 in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Loldia
Reviews.Content: I am a very critical Hotel guest, after 30 years of business and personal travel. The Commonwealth is one of the best Hotels I have stayed in over the years. We had a room overlooking Fenway Park and it was very spacious. In the six nights we stayed, we never heard a sound from other rooms or guests. We did not book a bed and breakfast package (just bed), but there is tea,coffee and scone/biscuit in the Lobby every morning with compliments. The Hotel is right beside a subway station and within easy walking distance of Newbury Street for great restaurants and small shops. The hotel offers guests a free car transfer to most places within the city. All Hotel staff were most helpful and friendly. I have a particular tribute to pay to Brian and Andrew (Concierges). When our travel plans changed unexpectedly, they were extraordinarly helpful. They made new arrangements for us, while we shopped! They are the most helpful concierges I have ever met. Thank you Hotel Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Commonwealth is more comfortable than home”
Reviews.Author: lovealltravel
Reviews.Content: We were working on a film in Boston and had the pleasure to stay at the Commonwealth for an extended stay. This 1st class hotel really out did itself day after day. It's location to Fenway Park is awesome. The restaurants attached are top notch. The service is spot on. If you are going to Boston you must stay here! Luxury and comfort are defined at the Hotel Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: JillyBoo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Commonwealth was simply wonderful! I just stayed there with several family members and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating - the doorman even greeted us by name each evening. Turndown service was exceptional (the cookies...yum!) and the location was perfect (for those who are interested in the Fenway/university area). There is a T stop right downstairs and the rest of the city is easily accessible from there. The Eastern Standard restaurant was delightful! The bar tenders and wait staff were knowledgeable and attentive. I was traveling with my 3 1/2 year-old niece and they were very wonderful about the special requests she made for dinner. Overall, a fabulous experience! We loved this hotel and will gladly return. If there is a down side (and I don't think there is), it's that they don't have in-room coffee makers or a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Plus!”
Reviews.Author: Wurking_Girl
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a lot on business and I have to say that this was one of the most comfortable hotels I've stayed in. In fact, when I tried to think of what I would change about it to make it perfect, there wasn't much I could come up with! The bed was wonderful, lots of nice, thick towels, TWO flat-screen TVs with DVD players (that was definitely overkill!), lots of space... There was no coffeemaker in the room, but they had wonderful coffee available in the lobby OR they would deliver a coffeemaker to your room upon request. They actually asked whether or not I wanted a paper (I hate wasting it at most hotels, but rarely have time to read one) and the staff was very welcoming and courteous. The ONLY issue I had was the inability to get the room temperature just right, but I am pretty picky about that. Overall, it was a fabulous experience and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Upscale Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: intlfoodtrvl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth twice recently for business and was very impressed. From the moment we first pulled up to the valet parking attendant, we were blown away by the friendly and professional service. We entered the gorgeous foyer and climbed the split staircase into the lobby. The hotel was decked out in classy colonial furnishings that give off an air of sophistication and style. During my first stay, I enjoyed a Commonwealth room, which a view of the major street of the same name. This suite was on sale at the time and priced the same as the smaller guest rooms. The main room had a large king-sized bed, huge closet, flat-screen TV, mini-bar, etc. Then, there was a massive lounge area with desk, second flat-screen, and comfortable chairs. They offered a huge number of cable channels, including 3 different HBOs. And the large marble bathroom was spectacular, with a separate toilet area off to the side. On my second stay I entered my smaller room to find that my bed did not look made. The decorative pillows were stacked on a neighboring chair and the bed pillows were all arranged on a 120 degree slant. It looked as if they stopped mid-bedmaking. I called the front desk and they sent someone right up. The person agreed the bed was not made, and they switched me to a handicapped room across the hall. When I saw the flat floor of the shower, I asked the bellhop if the bathroom was going to flood when I showered. He said no and quickly left the room. Well, he was wrong because it was like the Great Flood in there. Also, there was no closet, but only a very low bar to hang clothes from. My bathroom was relatively large, but the room was nothing special. On my second night in the handicapped room I came back to find my bed had been made the same way it had been in the first room. Apparently that is just the style they use sometimes. So, basically, I could have enjoyed my original room if the bellhop had told me that in the first place. In terms of amenities, the gym is decent, but pretty small. It offers 2 treadmills, a stairmaster, 2 ellipticals, 1 bike, and some weights. There are also two restaurants - the more casual Eastern Standard and the fancy Great Bay seafood house. The Foundation Room Lounge is supposedly popular on Wednesday evenings. I would definitely stay here again now that I understand their bed making style...

Reviews.Title: “Good but things should improve”
Reviews.Author: Rijswijk
Reviews.Content: This was our last stay in a hotel during a three week's tour through New England, before returning to Europe. And I must be honest it was the most unpleasant experience of all places we stayed in. Is this because all the others excell and this hotel does not? Our complain was that the front desk did not agree with a rate plan which is offered by the 2008 platinum directory of the Small Leading Hotels of the World. If you like 'comedy of errors' or 'fawlty towers' or a rude front desk go to this hotel. I had to phone AE before reluctantly it was agreed I could have a late check out. But according to the hotel "Continental breakfast' which should include juice, fresh fruit etc was just some coffee in the corner next to the check in desk. On the other hand the hotel room was fine and spacious, the concierge was very helpfull and a complimentary car was arranged to bring us to the BMFA. Also others at the hotel were helpful and friendly. But the front-desk is the face of the hotel and that seems to be forgotten here. Next time we will find another hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Red Sox Game - First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert_Greene
Reviews.Content: Chose the HC because of previous reviews and proximity to Fenway Park. Requested "high floor, Fenway Park view" and got exactly that on the 4th floor. Front desk check-in folks were a little pretentious as most folks staying there were "baseball fans" and not high powered business folks, but maybe thats the "Boston" way. The Mass. Pike is between the hotel and Fenway Park, but we never heard any road noise because of excellent hotel construction and sound-proofing. Room was excellent with great a/c, and top of the line bedding and bath items. Requested a fridge and box fan (for white noise) and both were delievered promtly. Valet parking was quick and efficient. Only downside was concierge's lack of help with obtaining boarding passes, which he said he would do and then didn't and the $10 fee for internet use. At $300+ for a hotel room, internet access, (which costs the hotel NOTHING) should be comp as it is at every Marriott property. Bottom line is that you can't get a nicer hotel with better location when in town for a Red Sox game. The front desk staff and concierge could be a little less uppity and a little more helpful though. Although these folks acted like THEY were the high class people in the place and the guests were somewhat "lower" class, I would be happy to compare paychecks and bank accounts with any of those young folks. More substance and less "style" would be good.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty - but blips”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: The experience at Hotel Commonweath had pluses - but also minuses. On the plus side: --The rooms are nicely designed and well-furnished --Linens and bath towels are good quality --Size of hotel is comfortable But - minuses made this less than a four-star experience: --Cleaning equipment of staff left in bathroom --Movies (DVDs) offered as available upon request (but titles were not available) --Items ordered through room service were missing from the tray on *two* separate orders. This is to be weighed against the cost -- which is "much more than moderate." One can do better in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Elegance in Kenmore Square!”
Reviews.Author: Lafemmegiselle
Reviews.Content: As I often receive VIPs from across the country and worldwide, I want their first impression of me to be positive. The major academic center nearby - for which I work - attracts some of the most demanding physician-scientists who are accustomed to having things "their way". At the Hotel Commonwealth, that prescription is filled perfectly. Since Fenway Park is a scant two blocks away, I had worried that the venue itself would be inappropriate for our clientele. I questioned whether the rooms themselves would be noisy, the streets would be overrun with zealous fans, and whether the ambiance of the adjoining outdoor cafe would be ruined by foot traffic. So I stayed there on a Friday night to test the waters. Whatever perceptions I had originally were quickly cast aside by the incredible service and amenities offered by the first class staff. Check-in was efficient and professional, and we were wisked up to the room on an upper floor, as I had requested. Opening the doors everything was fresh and clean smelling, with wonderful French accoutrements throughout. Details: start with the oversized tub in the bathroom, continue to the Frette towels and bathrobes, and toiletries from a famous French line. Having stayed at other luxury properties I will say that nothing was skimpy in comparison. The beds were some of the most comfortable I've slept in, with luxury sheets caressing my skin while the pillowtop mattress welcomed my weary body. I may have snored I slept so soundly - without any noise from other rooms nor from the street traffic below. The state of the art phones would appeal to techies; as would the flat screen TV and wireless internet access. But I digress: in between check-in and tucking myself in, dinner at the attached restaurant was mouthwatering. Great Bay has received great reviews locally but had not been subjected to this admitted food snob's discernment. I will review this separately, but one word describes my feeling: KUDOS! Ditto for the food and owner-operated (as in on the floor) East Standard, located on the opposite side of the building, which raises the bar. Do you adore Paris? The only Boston spot where you can relax in the true Parisian style (heated year-round outdoor patio) is attached to this hotel. Somehow the awnings made one feel like a voyeur, separated from the masses. In a nutshell -- go there to be pampered like royalty! It really ranks in the top five Boston luxury properties.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: GGardner11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Commonwealth and had an excellent time. The rooms are very spacious and immaculate. My 9 year old son loved waking up every morning and opening the drapes and seeing Fenway Park from our 5th floor window. What a view! It is only a 5 minute walk to the Park. If you are planning on going to a Red Sox's game then this is where you want to stay. But it is also very convenient to the rest of Boston with Kenmore Station right outside the front door. The staff was also very efficient and friendly. Thank you, Hotel Commonwealth, for a great first trip to Boston!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexkhimich
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly personal work hardly and well. Good guest rooms, comfortable bed, nice bathroom everything seemed new and very clean. Carl and Samuel at the front desk on the weekend shift were excellent. Very personable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - good service”
Reviews.Author: JBond214
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, located just two blocks from Fenway Park and within walking distance of the Prudential Center and other good Boston locations. Good guest rooms, comfortable bed, nice bathroom everything seemed new and very clean. Carl and Samuel at the front desk on the weekend shift were excellent. Very personable and helpful. I've stayed many places in Boston (Westin, Juries, etc.) and the small personal feeling of the Hotel Commonwealth is the best of the bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: golconda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Commonwealth two years ago and enjoyed it, so booked again for a college visit trip with my 17 year old daughter. I can't say enough about how wonderful the hotel is! Upon our arrival, we were told we could use the complimentary hotel car to go to our dinner reservation. When we returned from dinner, we were asked if we wanted to check out a DVD (from a library of 100 titles), and when it arrived to our room, it came with a bag of popped popcorn! When I asked if I could pay for a rollaway bed for my daughter's friend who stayed one night, I was told it was complimentary! I could go on and on about how friendly and helpful everyone was. This, of course, would mean nothing if the hotel and room facilities weren't great, but they also were----large, quiet, beautifully decorated room and bathroom, comfortable beds, flat screen TV, large desk and two lounge chairs. We travel a lot and like to stay at luxury hotels, and I have to say that the Commonwealth exceeded our expectations in every way. This property is one of the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel! Should be 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: musicmama28
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from my 2nd stay at the Hotel Commonwealth (HC) and I highly recommend! I travel to Boston often, and usually stay at the Four Seasons because it is closer to my headquarters, however, decided to return to HC for a change from my usual routine. Honestly, I believe this hotel to be very close to that of the Four Seasons quality. The Commonwealth Room (jr. Suite) is huge and comfortable. 2 TV's, 2 phones, huge comfy king bed, Wi-Fi, great decor, extremely clean, (especially enjoyed the L'Occitane products, again, same as you'll see at the Four Seasons). The setup of the room is especially nice, as you can separate the sleeping side from the "Business/lounge" side with a huge curtain if necessary. Also, loved that the bathroom has a door separating toilet from bath/sink/dressing area. The service was impeccable. Front desk extremely courteous and helpful. Loved the nice touch of a personalized letter at turn down, thanking me for returning, along with some yummy treats. Gym is a tad on the small side, and that is the only partial negative I have of this hotel. The location is great, too. This hotel really feels like top notch luxury, with a bit of a twist (decor is not your average hotel decor). I can't wait to return during my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel, Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: TileKiln
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commonwealth, Boston Back Bay area. We have just returned from our third visit to the Hotel Commonwealth, and it is just as we remembered. It is superbly managed, every request is met with charm and professionalism. The Director of Guest Services organised every aspect of our trip brilliantly, thoroughly professionally and with care and consideration. The Reception staff are excellent, informative and friendly, likewise the Concierge and Doormen . The rooms are huge, with L'Occitaine products and a lovely comfortable bed with soft linen sheets and quilts. House keeping is excellent and the rooms are spotless . DVD's are available free, and arrive with a bag of popcorn. Turndown service arrives with cookies, and any other products you may require. We ate breakfast in the Eastern Standard each morning and were very well looked after. It is a first class hotel in every respect and we can't wait for our next visit. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Minnesotan
Reviews.Content: Overall stay very good. Hotel decor beautiful, service very good, location (directly above Kenmore "T" station) convenient. Restaurant in hotel (Great Bay) is awful -- avoid at all costs. Hotel exercise room small, and treadmills of low quality.

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: next2none
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Close to everything. I absolutely loved the decor, the service and the luxury rooms. Will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: RumJumbie
Reviews.Content: This review is somewhat delayed, but I wanted to be sure to share what a great experience my husband and I, along with another couple, had in Boston, including our stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. We came up from South Carolina to see both a Red Sox game and The Police at Fenway. Our room looked right out onto the Green Monster. The stadium was an easy walk from the hotel and filled with other Sox/Police fans starting hours before event time both evenings. And, the Eastern Standard restaurant was a great place to grab a quick bite and some drinks prior to game time!! We plan on going back next season!!! Maybe our next visit we can try the hotel's more upscale restaurant -- Great Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly nice (except for a little paint thinner!)”
Reviews.Author: jenlion
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. The room was beautiful and looked out directly onto Fenway, which was pretty neat. And even though you're right over the Mass Pike, you don't hear road noise. No problems with the room itself or with the bathroom. Both are put together very well. We had a crib in our room when we arrived. Check-in was easy. We had a problem with the valet. When returning one afternoon, we wanted to just park, run upstairs, change clothes, and run down again -- we didn't have time for them to park the car (we'd have had to immediately call and say we needed the car... and we were already running late... we were literally inside the hotel less than ten minutes). The stupid doorman or valet or whoever he was did not understand that we were guests of the hotel and was pretty rude about wanting us to leave until we spelled it out for him and showed him our room keys. Not like we were dressed strangely, either -- my husband was in a nice shirt and tie after an interview all day! No idea why they treated us that way! Guess if you want the rifraff kept away from your hotel, that will happen! Had a much bigger problem with the paint fumes. Our last night there my husband woke me up at 3:30 am because of the terrible chemical smell. I got up and found it unbearably strong in the hallway and called downstairs. The guy on the phone informed me that yes, they were painting the service elevator, but it "shouldn't" be a problem for me. Ummm... would I be on the phone with you at this hour if there wasn't a problem?? Turns out it was paint thinner and no ventilation was set up. We were on the top floor, maybe the fumes collected there at the top of the shaft, or something. In any case, my eyes were burning, I was coughing, had a headache. Was online for 30 minutes trying to figure out if it was OK for our 6 month old baby to be in those fumes, or if we needed to make a run for it! But, the hotel did immediately get things ventilated somehow. Within two hours it was all cleared out and you'd never know it happened. So, while I'm mad that they did that, they did take care of it as soon as they knew it was a problem. (IN the meantime, we put a wet towel over the air intake for the heater. Hope that didn't wear the motor -- but it did work to clear the fumes more quickly from our room (I think), and it fixed the dry air too)! We had a small problem with the breakfast menu -- the menus are old and they just substitute things at random and hope you like it. Seems it would be better to print new menus. No real harm, but at those prices, seems to me the thing to do. Overall, though, it was a nice place to stay. Some things are over-the-top (borrowed movies arrive in gift bags), but I guess that's the type of hotel they want to be. The Eastern Standard restaurant was quite good too. Would definitely stay again, once I confirmed that NO painting was planned during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: coolteach
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading such great reviews of this Hotel, I decided to book it for my weekend away to celebrate my anniversary. We booked a junior suite, which is a large room with a separate living room and bedroom. It had two televisions, a huge desk and comfortable chairs with an ottoman. The rooms are separated by curtains. It was nicely decorated, had great comfortable beds and super linens. They put a down comforter in between two high thread count sheets-what a great night's sleep. It wasn't too busy in November but the rooms were really soundproofed. When you walked into your room, you had your own little foyer with a closet. The bathroom shower was great with a shelf, immediate warm water and a separate toilet room Service was great. The location was as well. Some have said it is less than desirable due to it's location, but the Kenmore T stop is right outside the door of the hotel. Also it is close to Fenway, Newberry Street and the Back Bay area is very safe. You have to ride the T to get to the start of the Freedom trail, but I prefer not to stay in such a touristy area myself. It is well worth it to upgrade to a suite, by the way. For about $20 we had more space, and the extra curtains kept it really quiet and dark for sleeping. My husband had to wake me up one morning because I just kept on sleeping. It is classy, has restaurants on site, is near convenient stores, and we walked to the movies from there (that's our kind of nightlife fun). The only negative didn't have much to do witht the hotel-The T is a little confusing, sometimes you have to be careful not to take the wrong train on the same line, pay attention to the final destination on the outside of the car. Plus it can be crowded on the weekends. Overall, a great city and a great hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5-star hotel at 4-star price”
Reviews.Author: pokerpro05
Reviews.Content: A quick browse through downtown-area Boston hotels will reveal one thing: Quality doesn't come cheap. Any decent hotel approaches $300, while the very nice ones all exceeed $400 per night. Hotel Commonwealth is the exception to that rule. Everything about Hotel Commonwealth is first class. The staff is extremely friendly and courteous. The rooms are beautiful and suit both the tourist and the business traveler. Even the internet is great -- you have both wired and wireless connections in your room, and both are free. Best of all, Hotel Commonwealth doesn't set hit you in the pocketbook like other top-rated Boston hotels. I got my Fenway view room for $265/night (before tax), while comparable properties were charging $150-$300 per night more. The location is also great. You are literally across the street from Fenway, and you're right next door to the T (subway) station. Only complaint: No self-parking, and valet parking was a pricey $36/day. I will be returning to the Commonwealth on my next trip to Boston. This is hands-down the best high-end hotel value in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: whatever999
Reviews.Content: Brought my son to a couple of Red Sox games and stayed here for two nights. Service was exceptional (except the restaurant, stay outta there) and everything was juust perfect. Great location by fenway and by the T station.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Eloquent.”
Reviews.Author: nic1047
Reviews.Content: My 2nd review of this hotel and for good reason. During my last checkout I requested a refreshment centre item that I had not taken be removed from the bill, and so the bill was amended, re-printed and placed in an envelope and I was on my way. Later when I looked at the bill instead of zero refreshment centre items there were now 2! which were cheekily added at check out knowing full well I would not re-open the envelope there and then. I still had the copy of my first bill. I rarely use hotel mini-bars so this hit a raw nerve. Hmmm. My previous stays have been more honest affairs and this hotel is very pleasant with friendly staff throughout. The rooms are very nicely furnished and the hotel being only 4 years old are still in fine decor. The windows are on the small size so the rooms are a little dark but this does a good job at keeping out the din of busy Kenmore Square at the front and the Highway at the rear. I once had a room above the bar that was not so quiet. Rooms have complementary wireless internet access and a DVD player with free DVD's from reception, but don't expect any blockbusters. The alarm clocks are quite useless and there is no coffee maker but there is free morning coffee in the lobby. The air conditioning has always been very effective and the bathrooms are quite spacious, nicely fitted out, include a bath and the soaps are top quality. The large Eastern Standard hotel bar with its high ceiling, long bar, open kitchen is to me one of the better bars in Boston but it can get very busy so finding a seat at the bar is not always possible, mind you the last 2 meals I had were served luke warm but this is not the norm. There is a further very smart separate restaurant which again serves excellent food and then there is The Foundation bar in the basement. Fenway Park which you can see from some of the rooms and the many night clubs are a 5 minute walk so the place really gets packed out on game days. There are several moderately priced good restaurants very nearby such as India Quality and Thai Dish with its tropical fish tanks that both serve excellent food. For wings and burgers there is The Beerworks brewpub and over the square there is a very popular home made burger joint. As an alterantive to the hustle and bustle of the city you can jump on the C subway line just 1 stop to St Marys or beyond and there are some real gems. The only nearby coffee shop is across the square in the book shop but this opens quite late so you may have to visit the Eastern Standard for that early morning Latte ($4.20 + tip so $5). Kenmore green line subway station is just 30 seconds away which you may choose to use to reach the finer parts of Boston such as Newbury Street, Copley Square and Downtown which are 10, 20, 35 minute walks respectively. A 7 day $15 subway pass is a snip for a ride on the oldest subway in the USA. Jump on at the head of the front carriage for a drivers eye view as the tram snakes along. Getting to the airport on the green and blue subways takes about 45 minutes. Taxi is typically 20 minutes and $35.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeZDallas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Hotel Commonwealth and loved it. We came for a Red Sox vs Yankees game. The hotel was beautiful and the room was clean and elegant. It was also great to be within walking distance to Fenway. The only complaint I have is, we booked this room months in advance and reserved a room facing Fenway Park. When we checked in, they said they didn't put us in a Fenway Room, and that "it wasn't that big of deal anyway to have that view." We wanted to be the judge of that. We wanted the Fenway view. Instead, we got a view of construction on the street side. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. Our room was very luxurious and spacious. The toiletries in the bathroom were fabulous and the beds turned down every night.....I don't know what more we could have wanted. The location may seem a bit outside of the main area however there is loads of restaurants and bars around it is only a short walk into the main area and taxis are cheap. We absolutely loved this hotel (and it is very reasonably priced) and we will definitely be going back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rising Above in a Competitive Market”
Reviews.Author: Fiveoclockcaptain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to a Red Sox/Yankees game and stayed here one night in a Commonwealth suite. Check in was a nightmare - not the hotel's fault, when the Yankees are in town all of Boston become chaotic. 100 parties checking in in less than two hours. We had to wait two hours for our room, but we were upgraded due to the delay. The room was 5 star, every feature was at our finger tips and the furnishings were all top shelf. The food from Eastern Standard was excellent and surprisingly affordable for a big city hotel. The room service attendant was in a major rush, but again the hotel was sold out and the wait at the restaurant (where he worked) was two hours when we asked after the game. All in all a good effort. The food was hot and fresh. Parking was fine with the valet, but impossible if you did not use the valet. Kenmore Square has little or no public overnight parking, but should not be a surprise in light of Fenway. Except for Boston University, hospitals and the Red Sox, this hotel is oddly located for tourists, there's not much to do without a cab ride, not really walking distance to anything. This hotel competes hard with the Taj, Ritz, Four Seasons, etc., but its location is really inferior for business or touring. We will stay here again for Red Sox games, but would prefer Copley Plaza Fairmont or Taj or Ritz for weekends on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience”
Reviews.Author: arb59181
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about a dozen times and every time it exceeds my expectations. The rooms are clean, spacious and well furnished. The staff is friendly, accomodating and helpful at all times. I couldn't ask for a better place to lay my head when visiting my old stomping ground. Another added bonus, the location is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Homerun”
Reviews.Author: wofford79
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay. We were here for 4 days, the service at the hotel could not have been better. Subway stop right outside, so very easy to get everywhere. If you are a baseball fan like us, this is a dream come true. Every morning we woke up to the beautful site of Fenway. The staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant. We had 2 rooms, 2 adults, 2 college kids and a 9 year old. Everyone was happy, try to do that somewhere. Great place

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Luxourious”
Reviews.Author: mmagner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Hotel Commonwealth for our honeymoon. We arrived at the hotel and the bellman promptly took our bags, parked our car and we were allowed to check into our room early. We had a Fenway View room and it was a quick walk to and from the Red Sox game we went to. The hotel is right next to the Kenmore T stop so it is really easy to get around Boston. The Hotel consierge was extremely helpful when it came to finding a restaurant. He directed us to a great spot with a spectacular view and delicious food. I cannot wait to go back to Hotel Commonwealth. It was the highlight of our vacation and I was so sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHAB
Reviews.Content: It was in 2005 that we stayed here for a break before our wedding back in the UK and before a flight out to Nantucket. Rooms were nice and big with 2 TVs, clean and staff were sufficiently attentive. Room service was prompt and food was hot. As a Londoner the proximity to Fenway park was initially lost on me, but seeing the stadium lit up behind the hotel and then seeing the game live on TV nearly converted this Brit to baseball - if you count buying a Red Sox cap, that is! Not the most central of locations, but we like to walk our destinations so enjoyed the walk into the centre. As others have said, the tube is next-door for those who don't fancy the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a very good stay”
Reviews.Author: skipop
Reviews.Content: This is actually an update of an earlier review I did on our stay at Hotel Commonwealth to take into account follow up actions by the hotel after our stay ended. We specifically selected Hotel Commonwelath for the Fenway View rooms for my kid who is a huge red sox fan. Unfortuantely, upon arrival, we were told there were no such rooms available because "someone had extended their stay and Mass. law precludes eviction." So we were put in a different room that required us to put two persons on a sofa bad. Wasn't thrilled about paying $300+ bucks a night and having two of us sleep on a sleeper sofa. The front desk person assured us that he would send an e-mail to the morning desk agent to set aside a Fenway room if one became available. The next morning, I checked with the specific person at the desk who was supposed to have received the e-mail from the night desk manager and she had not received any such e-mail. She was rude, but was not exactly the most apologetic about the situation either. She said she would try and grab a Fenway Room if one became available. Ultimately, they were able to move us to a Fenway Park view room, and the stay picked up greatly from that point. [Please note that after our stay, we received a terrific letter from the Front Desk manager who sinceerely apologized for the mishap and also included a certificate for a discount on a future stay. The certificate was a nice touch, but the letter is what truly mattered. This was not a one sentence letter saying "sorry, here's a certificate." Instead, the letter was a several paragraphs apologizing profusely and encouraging us to come back. It was very well written and unsolicited on my part. In short, it was a class act.] Other than the initial mishap, the service was excellent. From the doormen, to the bell staff, to the housekeeping staff - all were top notch. Very helpful, very friendly, always around if you needed them. The convenience to Fenway cannot be overstated. (A reletively new restaurant near Fenway, La Verdad, was a highlight. They have a corn and cheese appetizer that was truly amazing. The rooms were reletively large and we enjoyed the view of Fenway. No, you can't see in the stadium, but we didn't expect to be able to see in the stadium. It was still great to see the stadium lit up at night outside your window. But for the first night screw up, the stay was very nice and we will stay there again. Unlike previous posters, I didn't find the location for non-Fenway events to be a problem at all. The T station is right outside the hotel and we took that downtown everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Sox game”
Reviews.Author: OHSoxFan
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at the Hotel Commonwealth and enjoyed everything about the hotel. The location is great for a Red Sox game and the staff was professional and friendly. We had a Fenway Room which was fairly large, very clean and attractive. This is our new favorite hotel for games but I prefer the Copley Square area for sight seeing visits.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Know Of Better Option For Fenway”
Reviews.Author: lkar
Reviews.Content: This is really an excellent option for a Fenway trip. If the Sox are not your sole or main reason for going to Boston, though, I might consider something a bit closer to downtown or near the Prudential Center, where there is much more happening. Everything is easily accessible by the T, which has an entrance, quite litterally, just steps from the lobby. And on game days, and for games, it's exactly where you want to be. But if you like a greater choice of restaurants and activities very close to your hotel, this might not be top choice. The room was outstanding, and the amenities are very nice. Quiet rooms, despite the hustle and bustle (and turnpike) right outside the door. The restaurants are fine, although the types of dining styles are not extensive and a bit pricey. There are a couple of places in immediate walking distance, but you'll want to take the T for some variety. (Although Boston Beer Works turned out to be a very great option, and no wait except before and after games.) The fenway view room was as advertised, although it's not exactly a view into the park. But it's still neat to look over there on game nights, particularly. You can sit at your window and watch the tours on the Green Monster. At the end of the day, the staff was great -- we're not demanding but the few requests we had were easily accomodated. I did notice, however, a little bit of indifference by the front desk staff (some were very young and seemed to be in their first service industry jobs -- I guess that's par for the course in a city of so many college kids). I happened to be in the lobby a few times right around check in time, and got to witness the handling of guests being told their rooms weren't quite ready yet and it was clear that this is both a common occurrence and one to which the staff has heard everything so often in terms of complaints that they are a bit tuned out. Still, by 5:00, the lobby was clear. Lots of great touches in the room. (Would have liked a coffee maker, though -- is that permitted in Mass?) Housekeeping staff was great. Bell service for storing luggage was immediate and easy. I'd definitely stay here again if the Red Sox were the key reason for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for a game”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: A young, attractive, accomodating staff, well appointed furnishings, 3 bars, 2 restaurants, the Kenmore T stop right outside, Fenway 5 minutes away by foot...what else could one need for a stay in Boston for a game? Also, I screwed up the reservation by booking the wrong weekend and they still honored the quote given! This on a very busy weekend (Giants-Red Sox). We still got the Fenway view, awesome...furtherest away from the elevator....very quiet. The gym is nice: barbells up to 50 lbs., weight machine with multiple exercises, 2 each of elliptical, treadmill and stationary bicycle and 3 TVs. Only complaint is that they are not yet fully non-smoking and the smoke from people's rooms can permeate the hallways. Will definitely come back and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: tabedwell
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth and absolutely loved it. The junior suite was VERY spacious, beautifully decorated, and spotless. The marble bathroom was gorgeous. The Kenmore T station is directly outside of the front door of the hotel, making getting around Boston on the T extremely convenient. The turn down service was really nice and the bed, adorned with upscale linens, was very comfortable. My only complaint is that there is only complimentary coffee M-F until 9 am. For as much as the room cost, there should have been at least coffee when you wanted it.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay at excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fudgeman
Reviews.Content: We stay here when we go to a Red Sox game. Large rooms, some looking down into Fenway Park. Very comfortable overall, convenient valet parking. Superior staff.

Reviews.Title: “wonferful Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: sendmetoprovence
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely stay at The Hotel Commonwealth. The location is terrific. Having never stayed in Boston I was delighted to be located within walking distance to many poplular destinations but not so close to be bothered by traffic noises, etc. The hotel is steps away from the T for further venturing. The staff was wonderful, quite accommodating. The rooms are classic and stylish, request one with a view. We were there for the marathon which runs right in front of the hotel...perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: KMS777
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13yo son, and I decided to take a last minute trip to Boston for spring break. I had been to Boston on two other occasions to visit colleges with my oldest daughter and told them both how much I loved Boston. My son loves history, so he was very excited to go. I am very particular about hotels and spend a considerable amount of time booking and re-booking. After reading the reviews on this website, I decided to stay at the Hotel Commonwealth. We had a junior suite, which worked out very well for us. The service was excellent and we ate at the Great Bay Restaurant twice, also very good. The subway was literally steps from our hotel, which made everything in Boston extremely accessible. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Boston. It had the beautiful furniture and decor of any upscale hotel, but had more of an intimate feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: stasiakay
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for anything more from a city hotel. Great location with T stop at the front door. Couldn't ask for better service. Pleasant and accomodating. Rooms were large, airy with wonderful beds. Restaurant is added plus. Late night and breakfast. My only gripe. For the price I am paying for the room $36 per day to store my car is a bit much. You don't even pay that much in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sox Location!”
Reviews.Author: howe7032
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went up to Boston (Sept 2006) to see family and take in a Sox game and we stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth. We stayed in one of the Fenway Rooms, which don't provide views "into" the park, but if you're a die hard Sox fan and don't live in Boston, ANY view is great. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The location is outstanding. You can walk over to Fenway and there's a T stop right next door (along with a Dunkin' Donuts - very handy in the morning if you don't want to pay hotel prices for a quick breakfast). If you are there during baseball season expect crowds - the T stop is where just about everyone gets off for the game and there will be a lot of fans staying at the hotel as well. Over all though, I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again (hopefully the Sox will win next time I see them!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: momo3bigD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth while visiting colleges in Boston with our daughter. The hotel itself is lovely from lobby to the guestrooms. The staff was wonderful-- printing off college info that they had gathered. We booked the college exploration package for two rooms which came with small day packs, water bottles and info about Boston University. The package also came with breakfast for two which was actually a gift card to Eastern Standard restaurant. Each card (one for each room) had around $52 in value which not only covered breakfast for the four of us for 2 days but also a glass of wine one evening for my husband and myself. The location of the Hotel Commonwealth is great also--right next to the Kenmore T stop. Prudential Center shopping is not too far either. The real test of the hotel staff came AFTER we checked out. We were scheduled to fly out on Mar 16--when Boston received 9 inches of snow that shut down Logan Airport. While at the airport we ran into 25 high school students and 2 chaperones from Dallas (some from my daughter's class) who were also trying to get home after an organized college tour. We had already rebooked our rooms when I called them back to see if they could take in the stranded group for 3 days until they could get flights out of Boston. While initially hesitant for obvious reasons they agreed to take them in. Many of the students were surprised that such a nice hotel would be so accomodating to a group of high schoolers. I am hoping that my daughter ends up at a school in Boston so that I can return to the Hotel Commonwealth.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: docmark
Reviews.Content: The Commonwealth is a pleasure from start to finish. The rooms are large and beautifully appointed. We particularly appreciated the leather topped, oversize "partners" desk, with chairs on both sides, a free ethernet port (or free wireless if you prefer), and a built in powerstrip with outlets for charging a pda, cell phone, gps and laptop simultaneously. The staff bent over backwards to accommodate our every wish. The doormen, bell staff, concierge and desk staff were all great. The hotel is conveniently located at the east end of Boston University, which I took my daughter to visit. We would stay here again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jacksmack76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Convention at the Hynes. It was a brisk walk in February, but definetly do-able. We chose this hotel becuase all the other hotels closer to the Hynes were booked or outrageous in price. This hotel had 2 great restaurants, the Great Bay has excellent mussels and calamari and a very friendly bartender. They bring you cookies each night which was a pleasant surpirse. Price was very reasonable for the quality of the hotel. Rooms were immaculate. Great value and great atmosphere. Enjoyed being in a classic Boston building instead of a typical chain hotel. Would definetly recommend, especially if going to Fenway Park since it is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice When In Boston!”
Reviews.Author: mpalmer351
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in numerous other Boston hotels and a former resident of the Kenmore area, I was quite pleased to finally try the Hotel Commonwealth. The hotel is located in the heart of Kenmore Square and convenient to all areas of Boston. The Kenmore stop on the Green Line of the "T" is built into the hotel. Although not a "downtown" or financial district location, the hotel is close to Fenway Park, the Back Bay, Hines Convention Center, Boston University, MIT, Harvard, and Cambridge. Dowtown can be reached in under 10 minutes on the T. As a lifelong Red Sox fan, you could not choose a better view than that of one of the hotel's Fenway rooms. Our room looked straight out into Fenway Park. The rooms are first-class and something that you might expect from one of the superior hotels found downtown. The hotel also provides an evening turn-down service, complete with chocolates before bed. This is truly a first-class hotel and should definetely be considered when choosing the right place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At The Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Sweeper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Commonwealth during the first week of December and had a wonderful time. We booked a Commonwealth room which was spacious and comfortable and looked out on to Commonwealth Avenue. We didn't want to stay right in the city centre so this hotel was ideal as it was only 2 stops on the T or a $6 cab ride in to the main shopping area. We only ate bvreakfast at the hotel so can't really comment on the dining but what we had was excellent. The staff were always courteous and helpful and it was handy to have heaters while waiting for the doorman to get us a cab! I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than similarly priced hotels”
Reviews.Author: YOW76
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed here while attending an annual conference in Boston. We had always stayed at the Hyatt prior to this, but we had decided to try this hotel on a whim. We now wished we had known about the Hotel Commonwealth years ago. I cring when I think about all those wasted over-priced stays at the Hyatt. The Commonwealth far outshines its competitors in terms of the quality of the rooms and of the service. Our room was absolutely beautiful and had a view over Fenway park. We raved about this hotel to all our friends at the conference and plan to stay here every year now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: chi_traveler2
Reviews.Content: Walls were paper thin and we could hear the tv and talking in the room next door. They started cleaning at 8:30am (in the hallways) and that woke us up. The rooms were very nice but you could hear everyone else's doors slam and other room noise. It was a fancy place and the staff was great but for the price, I expected a little quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “most comforatable hotel bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: layla61
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! We booked it because it said it was close to Fenway, and was it ever! We could see into the park from our window. The rooms were super luxurious with the most comforatable bed/linen I've ever slept in. The lobby was very hip and the restaraunts in the hotel are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not four stars”
Reviews.Author: mao23
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel but definitely not Four Seasons quality or service level, which I think is what they are trying to reach. The hotel walls must be very thin, because I heard the ice machine every night, as well as the rather loud guests heading to the elevator at midnight. We had requested a crib for our room and the one we got was unstable and it took more than two hours for staff to find a sheet that fit it. The one they eventually found had to be held together with safety pins! The staff were competent but not particularly welcoming. Turndown service was also a bit random--we got cookies one night but nothing the other three nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JoAnnchilada
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed the evening we got engaged (we're Mass residents). The hotel staff was extremely pleasant from the moment we handed the keys over to the valet to when we checked out. We stayed in a suite. One side of the room- closest to the windows- had a nicely furnished, comfortable, and spacious sitting area with a TV. A curtain could be pulled to separate the seating area from the area with the bed and bath, which came in handy since I woke up earlier and wanted to watch some TV and read. When we arrived in our room, champagne, fine chocolates, and a note were waiting for us (not something my fiance requested - just a gesture from the hotel). The handwritten card congratulated us and thanked us for choosing the Hotel Commonwealth to spend our special evening at. What a thoughtful touch. We're just two kids in our early twenties, not staying in the most expensive room, so the gesture was that much more appreciated. Sometimes I feel snubbed by hotel staff, like my money isn't as valuable because I'm younger. Not so at this hotel. The bathroom in our suite had a separate toilet area from the shower/sink area. The tub shower was large with beautiful marble. The bedding was very soft and comfortable, with plenty of pillows. It was like sleeping on a cloud. Our friends stayed as well, but in a standard room. It had less bells and whistles and was more like your standard, nicer hotel room. They really enjoyed it. When we stayed, there was construction (of course- it's Boston!). Regardless, the room was insulated from the hubbub of the city streets below and construction. I called down to the valet in the morning and asked if it would be possible to leave our car in the garage for the day until 4pm, even though we checked out at 11am. I threw in that we were there for our engagement evening. No problem - we spent the day in Boston without paying for parking, other than the typical fee to park at the hotel overnight. The in-room breakfast. I think this is why I hold this hotel so dear in my heart. I've stayed at nice places in my life - eaten at wonderful restaurant. But never in my life had I, or have I since, had fruit like I had that morning. It may sound weird or trivial, but it was so delicious I was taken aback. We went a little nuts on the breakfast and got omelettes, toast, homefries, the fruit! :), coffee and tea, and other things I'm sure. I know we spent more on breakfast than we typically would for dinner in the city. Everything was phenominal. I'd love to see what this hotel can do for lunch and dinner. The hotel is really well located and you can walk to many locations. If you're unfamiliar with Boston, it's very accessable by foot and by subway (T). But there are, of course, areas that are less accessable, and this hotel is in a good location if you would like to walk to attractions, restaurants, the Common, etc. I would be content to spend my honeymoon at this hotel, even though I'm a life long Mass resident. I know my fiance wants to get away - but for another holiday in the future, I'm staying at the Hotel Commonwealth. You will not be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Comm. Ave. is a work in progress...”
Reviews.Author: jackfurlongesq_123
Reviews.Content: My daughter is at Boston University, literally across the street from the hotel. My experience stems from roughly half a dozen stays over the last 30 months. Location: "Back Bay" means different things to relators, visitors, and cabbies. The hotel is a couple of blocks north of Fenway, across a bridge over the Mass. Pike. Road noise is an issue, so you may wish to book Comm. Ave. side to reduce it. Unless you're sleeping in on a weekday. Commonwealth Avenue has a long term construction project at the west end of Kenmore Square. (They took down an old bus depot, and in another five years, they'll put up...a traffic light with three trees?) The hotel's web site is accurate. Kenmore Square is a beautiful stroll, but it is east of the hotel. You'll have a view of Barnes and Noble across the street. Still, the "T' (Green Line) is right next door, easy to navigate, and able to get you downtown quickly. Pru Center and MFA are a decent walk. Rooms: Basically two types of room, deluxe and junior suite (they have the real kind, but those price out of the range of almost anyone who actually reads on the Internet). The junior suite is a bed room next to an open sitting room doubling the size, with a full wall curtain you can pull to separate the two. The sitting area has its own tv, writing desk, free Internet, comfortable leather club chairs, and an ottoman. Hall noise can be an issue that could easily be solved if guests actually recalled that they were, well, guests. But then, self-absorption has reached pandemic proportions in our country, so why should things be different in a hallway outside a series of bedrooms? Talk as loud as you like. So what if it's two a.m.? The game's over; you had six beers; we WANT to know what you said to that "chick you followed to the girl's room." Service: Many of the employees are hotel school students from BU, trying hard, but not often sure how to handle the off-speed pitch (OK, my last baseball metaphor in the shadow of Fenway), like a request for late check out, etc. There is a support staff contingent from the Dominican who are extremely helpful, despite the disrespect I have witnessed from some guests. The restaurant adjacent to the lobby is uneven and pricey ('Hey, it's Boston, whaddya' expect?'), but on its good days it is a fresh sea food bistro that should probably not try to serve breakfast. Of course, any hotel that stocks L'Occitane in its bathrooms starts ahead of the pack. And they keep a large stock of DVD's at the front desk which you can borrow if you'd like your kids to curl up and watch a movie. The treat? Free goodie bag for the kids to go with their flick. Price: Depends on when you go, dramatically. Junior suite on January 1-2? $195/night. Same room during Head of the Charles weekend? Add $400. Is $600 (taxes included) too much for a spacious junior suite with free Internet, writing desk, black and white postcard photos of Red Sox of yore? Probably. But the same room, give or take, at the Four Seasons downtown is $1100 (Hey, it's Boston, whaddya' expect?) Bottom line: a reasonable, but lesser alternative to the Four Seasons/Ritz Carlton options closer to the Common. If you're destination is Fenway or Boston University, this is the ONLY option for upscale rooms, products, and service. Just keep reminding yourself. It's cheaper than the Common, and less crowded than Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “location, location”
Reviews.Author: natureniche
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 18. One of the priciest hotels we have ever stayed at but it was only for one night and we really wanted to see a Red Sox game. The location was amazing. To be able to walk to the game with the crowds over the bridge was very exciting. No parking hassles! The third floor room itself looked out to the Fenway Park sign so that was cool too. The beds were incredibly comfortable. You just melt into that mattress. I found the room to be quiet. There was a thunderstorm going on outside which usually wakes me up but not this night. The air conditioning was lovely on this hot, humid day too. My only complaint was that after flying in from out of country, and having a cab ride from hell ftom the airport we arrived at the Commonwealth at 3:30 pm to find that the room wasn't ready. Check out is at noon so that seemed sluggish! Another minor complaint was that we weren't told that there was coffee in the lobby in the mroning, so I went out to buy some at a local fast food, ohly to find a coffee pot in the side lobby when I returned. The room toiletries were way too fragrant too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Redbud
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 3 nights. Hotel is only a few years old and therefore still has that "new" feeling. Located across the street from Fenway and I have a perfect view of the park from my room. Front desk staff were ok but not real friendly. Bell hop and our "driver" were much more customer oriented. Lew, our bellman delivered ice, got movies, you name it. He was sweet and more than helpful and after our first tip to him, he actually refused the others!!! Hotel has a car (Mercedes) and they offered to drive us to a restaurant, the trolley stop, and the airport. We had the same driver each time (a college boy) and he was very nice and helpful. I suspect that service will be discontinued when demand for it gets to high. Room was large, bed was comfortable, bathroom was very nice. We couldn't get two double beds all during our stay and my college age daughter had to sleep on a sleeper sofa. They have a movie DVD list. Movies are delivered to your door, and are free. They even come in a gift bag with popped popcorn! I paid about $260 per night. Only 2 negatives: the dinner we ordered at Eastern Standard was not good at all - a total ripoff. And the cleaning staff did not throw out our leftover chinese food when the cleaned the room so it smelled the next day and I had to track down someone to throw it out for us. High speed internet was free. But BEWARE, I made three one minute long distance calls to my daughter's cell phone while she was out sightseeing in Boston. They cost me $30!!!! You read that right - thirty dollars!!!!!!!!! The front desk refused to remove the charge saying it was the charge of a contract company and they could not touch it. Other than that I totally enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “luxury with a fenway view”
Reviews.Author: xraytrip
Reviews.Content: I brought my husband here for his birthday so we could spend a romantic night away from home. I picked this hotel because it had rooms with views of fenway park. My husband loved it. We walked down to the park and checked out the shops. We thoroughly enjoyed the wonderful breakfast we shared in our room. The only thing that would have made this stay the best, tickets to a game!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good... a couple minor problems”
Reviews.Author: HelloandHi
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on business during the week of July 17th. The hotel is beautiful and conveniently located. The staff is very nice as well. I had a couple problems though.... The hotel does a "turn down" service for everyone. Which, would ordinarily be nice. However, I didn't know about this... so when I came back to my room at 10pm, to find that the door had not been closed all the way, I was pretty upset and nervous that someone had been in my room. I guess the maid came in, did the turndown, and then didn't close the door all the way (left the deadbolt out, so the door didn't shut). Needless to say, this was extremely careless... but I would assume that it was a mistake. The other issue is that the walls are very thin... I could hear everything. In fact, I awoke on my second night to find my ENTIRE BED shaking... which I presumed to be my neighbors. However, even trying to fall asleep was difficult because of the hall traffic. What would have normally been minor noise, seemed louder b/c the gap between the door and the floor was rather large (allowing light and sound in). The walls were also very thin, which didn't help either. Besides my minor issues... this hotel is very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Hotel Commonwealth!”
Reviews.Author: JuicyCouture
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston for a family member's wedding and the reception was being held at the Hotel Commonwealth. After careful consideration, we booked a room at the Commonwealth and we are very glad that we did! It was an excellent hotel. We arrived after having been traveling literally all day and we were exhausted. From the moment we stepped out of our sedan from the airport, the doorman assisted us immidiately and made us feel very welcome. Check in went fairly smoothly although they told us the rate was $20 more per night than what they had told us when we originally booked the room. That aside, everything went very well. The bell hop took the bags up to the room immidiately which was very much appreciated. The rooms are very large and spacious --you definitely will not feel as though you are sitting on top of each other. I know one of the other reviews stated that the furnishings try to "look antique but fail" and while yes, I do see what they meant, it is really a non issue in my opinion. The room was immaculate and the furniture seemed sturdy and it did compliment the room well. The beds are hands down, the best beds I've ever slept on at a hotel, coming in even above the Four Seasons. The sheets were very soft and they didn't have a "cold" hotel feel at all. The matress and pillows were fabulous. If you are one who likes a firm matress and/or pillow, you may not find it as comfortable as I did so that is something to keep in mind. The bathroom was also spacious and the tub was very deep. If you need a lot of space for your beauty products or whatnot, you will love the huge counter top. The L'Occitane bath products were a welcome addition as well. The hotel offers nightly turn down service which was included in our room rate. It was a very welcome addition to return to the room after a full day of activities and have classical music playing and have lovely cookies on the pillow. The hotel also has a house Mercedes which is available for guest use. It was free of charge and our driver took us just about everywhere we needed to go, whether it was shopping or to various wedding festivities. A very much appreciated touch! I would definitely stay at the Hotel Commonwealth if I travel to Boston again. It is an excellent hotel and they exceeded my expectations. When we got the bill at check out, we were happy (and suprised) that the hotel had removed the extra $20/night they had added for the extra person in the room. I highly recommend the Hotel Commonwealth. You really can't go wrong here. If you don't mind spending the money, don't hesitate to check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel EVAH!”
Reviews.Author: oneluckyb
Reviews.Content: I am a Boston University alum and on a whim and after not being able to get Red Sox tickets in Atlanta, my husband and I decided to take an impromptu trip to Beantown. I had heard about Hotel Commonwealth and knew the location would be perfect to show my husband all my old haunts. Imagine my surprise when we found a great rate for oneof their smaller rooms! I immediately booked and could not wait to arrive at my first luxury hotel, as we normally stay at middle of the road places when we travel. (Doubletree, Sheraton, etc.) The outside of the hotel is beautiful and really spruces up Kenmore Square, for anyone that was a BU student from 92 -96, HC is where the IHOP use to be. They renovated the Kenmore Square T exit so when you come above ground the hotel is directly to the right. Through the double doors(with doorman) and you walk into top notch luxury. Plush carpeting, fantastic decor. At the counter we were greeted quickly and efficiently by a lovely woman with an accent. If it had been my first time to Boston I felt confident the front desk staff would be helpful in everyway possible. Our room was on the 3rd floor and when we got off the elevator, the window in the foyer gave a wicked awesome view of the Green Monster and Fenway. My husband was stoked, as this was his first live view of Fenway. We got to the room and I was amazed. Granted this was one of their smaller rooms, but it was gorgeous and definitely big enough for two. There were two closets, one housing a safe. A desk, armoire with TV and stocked minifridge. I felt like royalty! The bed was soft and had a ton of pillows. The bathroom had beautiful tile and L'Occitane toiletries. Every felt so grand I almost didn't want to leave the room!! Overall I will suggest this hotel over and over for anyone visiting Boston for the first or 50th time. The prices are right on with comparable high end hotels. The location is excellent and the service and atmosphere can't be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room- great location!”
Reviews.Author: j2000princess
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked us a room here for my birthday and we were very pleased with our stay. The staff was very friendly and personable; they even joked around with us as we were checking in. The room was clean and spacious. I am a huge Red Sox fan so the view of Fenway Park from our room was spectacular! The hotel is in a great location with inside access to two restaurants, Eastern Standard and Great Bay. I had eaten in Eastern Standard before our stay and recommend it to everyone- service is impeccable, food is fantastic and the price is just right. We ate at Great Bay the night of our stay- service was exceptional but we were not impressed with the food for the price. Within walking distance to Fenway Park, lots of nightclubs, and the Green Line to take downtown. I am a travel agent with high standards and would stay in the Hotel Commonwealth again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: TXBluebonnet
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to write another great review for fear the hotel will always be booked. But the Hotel Commonwealth was great.
