We stayed with our daughter in a very large, comfortable room with 2 Q beds overlooking Fenway Park. Plenty of room to spread out. The hotel is next to I90 (between hotel and Fenway) but we never heard a sound from traffic. Parking is expensive ($34/day) but the T Greenline is just outside the hotel. We rented a car our last day from the Rental company in the Hotel shops to run errands and drive back to the airport. Reasonable rates and very clean cars. I definitely recommend the Hotel Commonwealth.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it better than the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: softcoverbook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel near the end of a pretty long, tiring book tour. In 30 days, we'd slept in 20 hotels and this one was HANDS DOWN the best. Huge standard rooms w/ a thick curtain to seperate the office space from the bedroom space. Oversized desk (in the photo, that's a 15 inch laptop), free wireless access, wonderful quick room service (even though the guest services book says they don't have service between 2:30 and 5PM, we ordered at 4PM with no problem), great L'Occitane toiletries, toilet is seperate from the tub and sink. Very helpful, cheerful staff, the area is near great shops and dining. I honestly can find no fault with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The friendliness of the staff at Hotel Commonwealth began as soon as we pulled up to the front door--the valet was exceedingly pleasant and helpful, hard to believe given the brutally cold weather. The front desk clerk was equally welcoming and immediately checked us in. Our room was just beautiful and looked exactly like it was shown in a virtual tour on its website, and at an extremely reasonable price. The entire room was in excellent condition--extremely clean, no wear and tear to be found. The room was large with a nice view, lovely furniture, 2 closets. The king-size bed and many pillows were heavenly. The bathroom was bright and clean and had plenty of towels.The room provided an iron, ironing board, lots of hangers, the usual bathroom items....and bathrobes--really nice ones!They provide turn-down service, accompanied with delicious cookies! The maid was gracious and very friendly.We had dinner at a restaurant inside the hotel, Eastern Standard--it is one of the most beautiful restaurants I have been in--great food, top notch service. Overall, our entire stay was a pure pleasure, from beginning to end. It's a beautiful hotel with outstanding service and it's in a great location. Just to let you know--I am extremely critical and I found nothing to complain about here--really!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottWang
Reviews.Content: My conference was at the Hynes/Marriot/Sheraton; those two hotels were so impersonal compared to the Hotel Commonwealth. A real person called to wake me up and greeted me by my last name. The maid turned down my bed everyday with a pretty and delicious cookie on my pillow. They extended my check-out time by 2 hrs with no questions asked. The front desk, the doormen and the maids were friendly. The room and amenities were not ultra luxurious, but the gym was adequate for a guilt-ridding evening workout. Comfortable and clean bed and bathroom met my expectations and I travel a lot internationally. The only thing negative: you can hear people outside of your door, if there happens to be a loud and chatting bunch. For $159 per night (watch out for the taxes, though, about $18 or so) and 5-10 mins by foot to the Prudential Shopping Center, this is a great place to stay, especially after a day of stressful/boring meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great for going to Fenway Park!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1345
Reviews.Content: We've stayed three times at Hotel Commonwealth. Two of them were for going to Fenway Park to watch the Red Sox, and the third time was for an easy getaway. Hotel Commonwealth is centrally located, so you are close to everything after a reasonable walk. The rooms at Hotel Commonwealth are superb! Everything is new and very clean. The two queen sized beds were a great find. The sparkling bathrooms are mostly made up of marble, and are filled with L'Occitane products! Every night turndown service came and left delicious cookies and chocolates from the hotels Temper chocolates. Dining was really good, but maybe not great. Eastern Standard was a nice restaurant, but just had a very limited menu. Good plate of offal didn't appeal to me and I wasn't ready for my father's liver and onions! We overall have had nice times at Hotel Commonwealth. We haven't had as much luck with dining, but other options are nearby. We will be planning to go back to Hotel Commonwealth again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “A real winner in Kenmore Square”
Reviews.Author: revjeff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a weekend getaway up the road in Boston. In looking for a hotel, I wanted something nice, but not terribly expensive. I thought the rate for the Hotel Commonwealth (about $ 199 per night) seemed a little steep-- but not really for Boston where a night at a first class hotel like the Ritz or the Four Seasons can run up to $ 400. Plus, the Commonwealth is right next door to one of our favorite Boston restaurants (Petite Robert Bistro), with lots of bookstores in the area, so we decided to give it a try. We were not disapppointed. And the nightly rate was well worth it for the excellent service and marvelous accomodations we enjoyed. This is an exceedingly well run hotel; everyone from the front desk staff to the bellhops to the parking attendants seem intent on doing their jobs to their full ability. They were extremely friendly and efficient, and made us feel pampered and welcome indeed! The hotel is only about two years old, so the facilities are in excellent condition-- and everything is spotless. Our room was HUGE-- twice as large as some comparable places we've stayed. Amenities and facilities are excellent. Our only complaint was a slight problem we had with regulating the temperature: hot one moment, cold the next, but eventually we got it all right. Do yourself a favor next time you're in Boston and stay at the Hotel Commonwealth.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our friends stayed there previously and my wife and I had read about the hotel in T+L and in-flight magazines when we travel, so we thought we'd give it a shot. We were amazed at the service, the L'Occitane products, and how big the rooms were. We had a parlor room called the Commonwealth room and it was all we had wished for: two tvs, drapes that pull and split the room in two and so much more. We will recommend to everyone we know when they travel to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: NewportRICouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for New Year's Eve. We booked a wonderful package that included admission to the First Night events as well as a spectacular brunch the following morning. We were impressed with check-in where we were surprised with a champagne toast! We departed for the nights events and were given great directions from the doorman. Upon returning at the end of a long night, we arrived back at the hotel. We entered the lobby and we were greeted by a wonderful young lady who wished us both a "Happy New Year". At the lift we were greeted by a security man who called the lift for us and also wished us a Happy New Year and told us to have a "wonderful night". Impressive, smiles from everyone! The service here is second to none. The rooms are pure heaven, the beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in. We will stay here when in Boston and reccommend this hotel to anyone considering Boston for holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: libbsjm
Reviews.Content: I do agree that the decorations are a bit bla. However, the location and cleanliness of the hotel more than make up for what it is lacking in interior design. The bed is also extremely comfortable and the L'Occitane amenities are a magnificent touch. I have been known as a very picky traveler and I would recommend the Commonwealth to anyone. This hotel is spotless!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bahadir
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay here. The hotel was very clean and comfortable (gives you an impression that it is a very new hotel). The staff were very friendly. They offer free internet in rooms, mine did not work (probablty due to my laptop), but the on-site technician did his best to make it work. They actually knock the doors at night and give cookies and chocolate :)) I would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at Hotel Commonwealth!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth one night. When I left in the morning I forgot my jewelry on the night table. I called back to see if they could get it for me. Apparently the maid had already cleaned the room and guess what... they couldn't find my jewelry. I was dumb-founded by the way they handle it. The maid claimed that we had left our door ajar. Hmmmm... Basically they told me that I should have locked up my jewelry in the future and that was that. I advise no one to stay at this hotel, apparently the customer is never right.

Reviews.Title: “Pseudo Elegance -- But Quite Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DrMac
Reviews.Content: No complaints about this hotel, but if you're looking for charm, style, uniqueness...you can probably do better in Boston. We booked one of the larger rooms facing Commonwealth St (the most expensive room, which I believed is called a "commonwealth" room). This room is great if you're traveling with a child or third friend, as it has a large office space with sleeper couch than can be divided from main bed with a curtain. The good: very quiet and comfortable, outstanding bed and pillows (slept wonderfully), modern comfort, clean, marble bathroom, toilet in separate room from shower, L'Occitaine bath products. The criticism: Not nearly as elegant as the marketing pictures would have you believe. Pseudo elegance, like a Disneyland fascade. Certainly NOT your lovely botique hotel. If you're looking for classic style, you'd probably do better in one of Boston's older hotels. See "candid" photos to see the unfortunate decorating choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms, comfortable beds, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dppnv
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for 3 nights in October of 2005. Based on the reviews in Trip Advisor, we were not disappointed. The four of us stayed in a Fenway room with 2 Queen beds. The beds were so comfortable including down pillows and a down comforter wrapped in Italian Frette sheets. The oversized room was wonderful for a hotel in the city. Amenities such as the L'Occitane bath products and the chocolate covered graham cookie were a special touch. I've read other reviews from others complaining that the hotel isn't in the heart of the city or close enough to the action. I thought the location was great, Newbury street was 3 blocks away filled with shops and restaurants. The Kenmore T station just steps away from the front door was so convenient. We were there to see the whole city not just a specific area so this worked great for us. Granted the view of Fenway stadium wasn't a beautiful view, but if you're looking for a competitive rate, large room, comfortable beds, and nice amenities, the Hotel Commonwealth was superb. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family trip!”
Reviews.Author: samsmom2006
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here 2 nights in September based on a positive review in the New York Times. We reserved a Junior Suite. It was a clean, gorgeous and spacious room overlooking Fenway Park. Hotel is steps away from Kenmore Square T station. It was a very nice, safe hotel in the middle of the city. Large bathrooms, solid housekeeping. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Alright hotel - too expensive and lacks character. Also, in a dissapointing location. Kenmore Square is not what I would consider an ideal location. No, you could not stay at a better place so close to Fenway Park, but Boston has more to offer than just the baseball. I used the subway on a regular basis to bring me towards downtown area. Next time I will stay somewhere closer to the action so I can walk more and take public transit less.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, spacious, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many many reviews on the hotels listed for Boston, I booked the Commonwealth. Although it is outside the hustle and bustle, Hotel Commonwealth is a perfect location for a couple. My partner was there on business so I had the day to myself. After packing light for the overnight stay I realized after a few hours of wandering that my bag was just too heavy. It was a little before noon so I was skeptical that i would be able to check in but given the proximity to the T -Kenmore stop -I popped over to drop my bag with the concierge. A really sweet front desk attendant was kind enough to check me in right then. Our suite was really well appointed with great quality sheets and towels, amenities and was very spacious. The bed was ultra comfy, the furniture in the sitting area and general decor was excellent. Although the street below was busy, very little of the noise translated into the room. With limited time and desire to venture far from the room- we dined downstairs at Great Bay. Loved it! Our server James allowed us to order way too much :) but his service, the food and atmosphere made for a wonderful evening. The lighting in Great Bay is warm and calm. Food presentation and portions were great. We had the sweet and sour shrimp, gnocci, miso soup, stuffed lobster and a white fish i can't remember the name of. All in all, I absolutely loved this hotel, the area and all the staff we encountered. I'm the type of traveller that does not need a lot of assistance or coddling - so I found the class and respect for privacy to be supurb throughout the hotel and restaurant. The only two things that were outside of perfect were the room smelled pretty smokey. I smoke- not where i sleep -but even for me it was pretty strong and the fire alarm went off for about 20 minutes (due to some issue at Eastern Standard) but there was a really irritating recorded message that played way too many times during and after the alarm.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: Janeykins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth for one night to see the Stones Concert - we had a Commonwealth Room - huge room, so quiet - we loved this hotel and will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Really very very nice”
Reviews.Author: mitchward
Reviews.Content: Me and my better-half stayed here last week and had a very enjoyable stay. It really is a nice place, nice decor, very clean, nice staff, lovely room, great bathroom- we liked everything about it. The only Baseball game I ever saw before was in Detroit and i've never been so bored- strangely enough on our first night Detroit played at Fenway- needless to say I gave it a miss. And the Stones played on our last night- we went for a walk- Charlie's drumming was a bit too much. But I loved it all really. We recommend stolling into town down cosmopolitan Newbury St, and like us you may not even make it into the city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisp1946
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Commonwealth for 3nights at the end of 2 week holiday. Hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was large and well appointed, the air conditioning quiet and efficient. The highlight has to be the beds probably the most comfortable hotel bed with absolutely superb bed linen and pillows. The staff were welcoming and very helpful. Location is slightly out of the way but with a station to downtown underneath and a 5 minute walk to Back Bay not a major issue. Only downside is the lack of a decent diner for breakfast close to the hotel. Hotel breakfast very good but pricey when feding 4. highly recommend this hotel and would stay here next time i am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - shame about the building site”
Reviews.Author: thegrays
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel with comfortable clean rooms (my wife wanted to take the bed home!), friendly helpful staff and still reasonable prices. Decor was tasteful and the service, old fashioned courtesy. Eastern Standard (the restaurant attached to the hotel) had a good selection of affordable meals, with other oulets nearby. The location isnt ideal being slightly away from the Centre of Boston and facing the "Big Dig". But if you are a baseball fan, the proximity of Fenmore would be an advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: LI_Tony
Reviews.Content: An overall great experience. Very friendly staff; the doorman that met us when we pulled up greeted us by name every time we came in & out. The room was lovely and very comfortable. The L'Occitane bath amenities were wonderful. The location was very convenient. We could walk to Fenway Park or go downstairs to the Kenmore T station. Downtown was only a 5 minute train ride away. They also have a huge selection of free DVDs to view in your room. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on the raving reviews, but I must say, it did not live up to my standards. Unless in town soley for a game at Fenway, the location is mediocre at best. In the dumpy side of Boston University, the choices of restaurants and nightlife are limited to the Fenway park choices which are all touristy, overpriced and lose their novelty after the first couple of days. Service and rooms at the hotel were fine... nothing bad but nothing memorable. Next time I visit Boston I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Uber-fantastic-hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMark
Reviews.Content: Great weekend getaway to the Commonwealth. Fantastic bed, linens, pillows -- could have slept until check out. I swear there were 2 kinds of toilet paper as well -- quilted and "regular". Never seen that before. A bit annoyed by the $34 a night for parking, but would happily stay again and again. Will hope to try the hotel's bars / restaurants next time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Commonwealth!”
Reviews.Author: efb74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth last weekend as a mini-getaway. I did tons of research on hotels, and I have to say we were thrilled with my final choice. Our room was big, with a separate sitting area with 2 very comfortable leather chairs, and a second TV. The bed was extremely comfortable with Frette linens. And the bathroom was large and so nicely decorated, with great L'Occitane products! We walked everywhere from the hotel....all the way to Long Wharf and back, but we are from NYC and used to walking. The T is right outside the front entrance of the hotel if you do not want to walk as much. Back Bay is about a 10-15 minute walk, and Fenway is right around the corner! In all, we had a great weekend, and loved this hotel! We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: mce930
Reviews.Content: I just came for a stay with my two daughters, to tour colleges in the area. The hotel is lovely, the staff are friendly and extremely helpful. While, it isn't cheap, I've paid more and gotten much less. It is nice when you get what you pay for.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Commonwealth
HotelInfo.Address: 500 Commonwealth Avenue, (Kenmore Square, Fenway Park), Boston, MA 02215
